Reviews.Title: “Ideal location with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethWellington
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week on our first visit to Istanbul. Upon early arrival we were offered a sumptuous breakfast on the terrace with breathtaking views. Our room was just right and we were ideally located for all we wanted to see. Staff were very helpful and courteous and went out of their way to help us. We would totally recommend Nena Hotel and their excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Wonderful views”
Reviews.Author: Barbara N
Reviews.Content: excellent position 5-10 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and near a tram. Very friendly helpful staff. Good buffet breakfast. Get up early for breakfast to get a table on the terrace with views over the rooftops of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nena”
Reviews.Author: SelmaGso
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location; within walking distance to the major sights and to the tram stop but on a side street, so it is not noisy. The hotel staff is absolutely great! They are extremely helpful and friendly, and they always offered us coffee or tea. Everything they recommended like restaurants, stores, etc. was perfect. We stayed there 4 nights and we loved it! The hotel has a nice indoor garden that is nicely decorated, as well as the rooms. The bed was excellent and the bathroom very neat. It is overall impecable. Complimentary breakfast with view to the Blue Mosque is wonderful. From 5-7pm they have complimentary snacks arranged in a little buffet that is also very tasty. We also had dinner at the hotel and I ordered the Sea Bream; the fish and the side dishes were luscious. I only have good things to say about our experience, and I am ready to go back to Istanbul and stay again at Hotel Nena. Thank you to all the staff for helping make our trip so wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Lorna L
Reviews.Content: The room was a good size, tastefully decorated and like the rest of the hotel very clean and well maintained. The bed was very comfortable.The location was excellent , safe and a few minutes walk away from the major sights and the tramway.The hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly .The breakfasts were really good with a varied selection of hot and cold dishes and the view was amazing. and there was a complimentary snack each evening in the restaurant .I expected this to be just a cup of coffee but it was more like a small buffet .We ate in the restaurant one evening and the food and service were really good and excepional value.There was also free use of computers and free bottled water in the room every night. I have nothing negative to say about this hotel and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Easy base from which to explore the main sites”
Reviews.Author: candace f
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Hotel Nena, and while I found the service somewhat impersonal, it was otherwise much better than I expected and a great place from which to explore without having to work too hard at it - you will find yourself running into the major sights and the convenient tramway as soon as you walk out the front door, the breakfast was good, the view lovely, the bed very comfortable, the water pressure a relief after two weeks in rural China, and the wifi worked perfectly at all levels of the hotel. I had hardly any time to prepare for this trip and found it was practically impossible not to hit the major sights just walking down the street. The price is very fair, but my room was also quite noisy - I heard my neighbors and any commotion in the hall or lobby - and awkwardly set up. As someone who wanted to have a more comfortable space to unwind, the room and the cramped lobby were not ideal. I wish I had stayed somewhere with a more relaxed and communal atmosphere, even if it had cost more. Also, if I return to Istanbul, I will certainly want to try out a less touristy neighborhood as it is easy to get to Sultanhamet but hard to escape the throngs once there. That said, the staff were very kind, even giving me tea and smiling patiently as I re-packed my bags in the lobby before an evening flight, and the young man even chased down a taxi for me in the rain. I can't say it was the best hotel experience ever, but I would surely recommend it to anyone looking for simple, comfortable accommodation in the heart of Istanbul's old city. No pool and no fitness center, so please disregard those ratings.

Reviews.Title: “Small, nice, good location”
Reviews.Author: GissAndrea
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nena was lovely, and in a great location. We had a small room, but it was big enough. The bathrooms are old but perfectly functional. Compared to the glitz and glamour of the UAE, it was quite refreshing, but it will not blow you away. That said, it was good value for what you pay, and the location is fantastic - only moments from the Blue Mosque, Topkapi palace, the Bazar, and lots of potential for walking. The hotel receptionist will happily offer you help with buying anything you can think of, but I suggest going to the bazar and enjoying the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Adnan - Lebanon”
Reviews.Author: Adnan_1967
Reviews.Content: During vacations few things go well and few go not as you would like to; I know for sure that what went very well and had no negative comment about it is the Nena Hotel. From the minute we arrive to the last minute we left and in all their services they were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “the best location”
Reviews.Author: pianogal1018
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 4 nights at this hotel and had a great time using it as our base for exploring istanbul. it is in the best location right in tourist central for visitors with a packed schedule, as all of the major sites are within a short walk. there is also a tram stop right outside, making it easy to escape to the taksim square area. although it is pricey, our room was lovely, clean and well-cared for. be sure to have a copy of your reservation price in advance as one clerk stated our friend arriving a day late would incur an extra charge. otherwise, the service was great, breakfasts filling and wonderful (the best spread among the hotels we stayed in during our week-long trip) and location ideal!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ParisBrad
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience in Istanbul and this was due in large part to the wonderful staff at the Hotel Nena. From the moment that their driver picked us up at the airport (included in our rate) we knew that the level of service would be of the highest quality. We were offered a drink upon arrival and were taken to our double room with queen sized bed. The room decor was simple and elegant and we felt immediately at home. Our room had its own private balcony which we also enjoyed very much. The location of the hotel is spectacular, particularly for the first time visitor to Istanbul. It is right on the tram line near Sultanhamet but it's a super easy and enjoyable walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Spice (Egyptian) Market and the Grand Bazaar. The hotel restaurant offered an incredible variety of international and Turkish offerings at their breakfast buffet which we enjoyed while sitting on the 5th floor balcony with an incredible view of the Blue Mosque. The staff of the Hotel Nena really cared that we had an enjoyable stay. They clearly take a lot of pride in their city and their hotel. They quickly became trusted partners in helping us navigate all the exciting choices in the city. They were never pushy, in fact they did not offer us advice proactively on activities, restaurants or a place to get a great massage, but when we asked they always came through with a great suggestion. The restaurant staff were lovely and attentive and made sure that breakfast was enjoyable. It's hard to be more positive about our stay. We can't recommend the hotel enough. It's a wonderful, relaxing place to unwind in one of the world's most fascinating cities. We will be back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “10/10”
Reviews.Author: kreska1411
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, near to Blue Mosque. Very nice and helpful staff. Good breakfasts. Clean. I recommend this hotel 10/10.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: triptty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from our vacation in Turkey. We decided to stay in Nena Hotel in Sultanhamet area after reading lots of great reviews from Trip Advisor. The location of the hotel couldn't be better. It was in the center of Sultanhamet close to the Blue Mosque, Haghia Sofia, Basilica Cistern, Grand Bazaar and the Hippodrome. Close to almost all major tourist attractions and a tram stop that you can take to Beyoglu area across the Galata bridge. We were also very close to Cemberlitas Turkish bath, which was an amazing experience. Muzi, who welcomed us to the hotel (I think he's the manager), was very nice and gave us lots of great pointers about Istanbul. The room that we stayed in was small, but coming from NY, small rooms didn't really bother us. The rooms were clean and comfortable to stay in. Breakfast was included in the price and it was great. The view from the hotel breakfast terrace was amazing! We had the views of both Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. Overall, we had an amazing time in Istanbul and when we come back (which we definitely will), we would stay in Nena Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Micheljane
Reviews.Content: Ah, the Nena, a unique hotel right in the center of the old city of Istanbul, our home when traveling to other countries in the area. This was our third time back to Istanbul and the Nena as we were heading on to Bulgaria and Romania. We spent two nights in the Nena on the way to Bulgaria/Romania and then one night before heading home. We were greeted as old friends by the the staff of the Nena and as always treated so well. From the offer of coffee/tea to the beautiful rooms to dinner on the rooftop overlooking the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus, one cannot go wrong staying at this boutique hotel. I love the discounts that the Nena offers. If we booked by Oct. 2011, we received a 10% discount. If you pay with cash, you receive a 5% discount and you are offered a coupon for 50% in their dining room for dinner. We used all of the above. They also offer pickup and dropoff service to/from the airport. Depending on the number of nights one stays the pickup is included. As we left the Nena, all came out to see us off. We will be back to Istanbul and the Nena in 2013 on our way to the five "stans" (Uzbeckistan, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan, Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan) and look forward to staying in our favorite hotel in our favorite city:-) To us, this is the perfect place to stay. Warm, friendly, location is amazing, a wonderful choice in the beautiful city of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “a fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: dwong321
Reviews.Content: We absolutely enjoyed our stay at Nena Hotel. Although this hotel is rated with 3 stars, we would give them 5 regarding their excellent hospitality. During our whole stay we felt welcome and in good hands. Guests are picked up at the airport. At the reception while sipping your welcome drink you get all the necessary information about the hotel and available tours. We were very impressed by the view from the roof top restaurant, where you can eat dinner and breakfast. Especially at night time it is a romantic place to be and daydream. No doubt, we will book this hotel again at our next visit to Istanbul. Since the hotel has a favourable location at Sultanachmet district within a stone's throw of the major attractions we recommend to book well in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for first trip to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Martin791
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in hundreds of hotels and this is the first time I have been moved to write a review. Myself and my wife stayed in Hotel Nena for 4 nights on our first trip to Istanbul and found it exemplary. Lots of others have commented on the view from the dining room, it is indeed breathtaking, and the location is superb, being 5 minutes from the 2 main attractions, the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. It is also a few metres from the main tram route taking you to Galata Bridge/Tower. However, many other hotels are in similar locations, what I was most impressed with about Nena was the exceptional service, advice and assistance given, above and beyond the what is normally found. We arrived very early after the complimentary airport pick-up, and were immediately offered breakfast until our room was readied, again much earlier than is usual. The standard of service throughout the stay was maintained, and felt very genuine. I have booked again for later in the year. Oh, and if you like a tipple, the Cosy Pub just down the main road from the hotel towards the Blue Mosque is a great place to people watch.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view of Sultanahmet from its terrace”
Reviews.Author: Riccardo79
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Istanbul, try to book this hotel. It is perfectly located in Sultanahmet, just a walk from all the main sights (Agya Sofia, Blue Mosque, Gran Bazaar, Cistern Basilica). Its rooms are wonderfully decorated, but the most remarkable part is the amazing terrace where you can have breakfast. It has breathtaking views of Agya Sophia, the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus, not mentioning the very good buffet. All considered, the best place you can get in Sultanahmet for that money. One tip: try to avoid special "tourist packages" that the owner may offer you, you probably do not need them if you have a good tourist guide. Second tip: have a relaxing visit at the Cemberlitas Hamam (Turkish bath), just five minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a good value short break or holiday”
Reviews.Author: Frank S
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is a brilliant one. Right in the centre of the main tourist area of Sultanahmet, yet it was quiet and we were able to sleep very well. The staff couldn't have been more friendly, helpful and efficient. Not only were we allowed to use the PC in the manager's office to print our boarding passes for the return flight but we also received both a welcome drink each and a going away present of a box of Turkish Delight! With airport transfers (which were right on time) included (because we booked directly on the hotel's website) we felt the value for money was outstanding. We didn't dine in the restaurant but the buffet breakfast offered a great range of choices - and, while you're eating, you get to enjoy a wonderful view towards the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “there is no bad write-up”
Reviews.Author: Mehmet D
Reviews.Content: friendly staff, good service, best location, very good price-performance ratio

Reviews.Title: “Overall an excellent hotel at an exceptional price”
Reviews.Author: EthiopiaSeth
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for a few days and had a wonderful experience. The best part about the hotel is the location. Everything you want to see in the Sultanahmet district is within a short walk from the door. The staff was incredibly helpful and made out stay even more enjoyable. The view from the top restaurant is exceptional. The included breakfast was quite the spread as well. I can't say enough good things about the Hotel Nena. On top of all of these great things, the price was a great value. I will definitely stay here on my next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service. Ideal location in old Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Genepng
Reviews.Content: 40Min from the airport by tram and metro with 1 transfer. 5min walk to tram stop. 15min walk to blue mosque and grand bazaar and a bit further to spice bazaar and Ayasofia and topkapi palace. A dedicated team of staff. The friendly and warm mr. Mehmet who takes time off to offer us tea/coffee and to chat with us and ask us about our day after each shopping spree. There is also mr. Muzi...very dedicated and motivated to offer help and advise about the what,where and how around the old town. Would like to thank Ural and Faruk, the bell boys who served us tea and coffee after each tiring day. Keep up the warm cosy service at Nena guys! Will certainly check in here again if I return. Ideal for couples!

Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my girlfriend for 8 days having read the reviewa on trip advisor. The first impression was not very good as the hotel and rooms seem much bigger in the photos. But i have to admit that the treatment we've received from the staff was exceptional...!! This treatment and the great location of the hotel would be the main two reasons why I would recommended this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Grate place to stay in Stambul”
Reviews.Author: Domasz
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nena is a really grate place to stay in Stambul. We are gay couple and did not experienced any problems at all. On the contrary - the staff was extremally nice and helpful. Thy even upgraded us to the best appartment they have within the same price wich - just like that. The localization is perfet, grate view on Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosk and Bosforus from the appartment tarrace. The rooms are clean and well equipped, they also picked us up from the airport. Perfect brekfast with whole range of local and non - local specialties.No problems at all. I really recommend this place it's totally worth it's price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisa A
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a really convenient position and we were very pleasantly surprised. The hotel staff were very nice and friendly. Our room was beautiful and I was surprised at the size and lovely decoration. The free Internet in the room was an added benefit!! The hotel looks just as it does in it's photos on the site and the rooms were all unique and very clean. The hotel decor was lovely and the rooms very truly beautiful. We would definitely stay here again and will on our trip next year.I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a place to stay in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Isidora A
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the best hotels me and my famÄ±ly had stayed in. The staff are all very fiendly and helpful, they make you feel as if you`re a part of the family. Another very positive aspect of thÄ±s hotel is that it is located in the centre, and very close to the best attrections (such as Blue Mosque and HagÄ±a Sophia), and everythÄ±ng Ä±s 5-15 mÄ±nutes away. The rooms are all very comfortable, clean and tÄ±dy so you cannot go wrong. All in all a very good hotel, worth every penny and Ä° promÄ±se you won't be dÄ±ssapoÄ±nted. :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service 10 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: Sari_Awwad
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews from people who visited this hotel we decided to book with Nena hotel 6 months ago and we were not disappointed. We arrived in mid January and were greeted by the friendly driver who transferred us to the hotel. We stayed for 8 nights. Our family consists of two adults and two young girls. We were given 5 star treatment. As soon as we arrived we had booked a Triple room however we got upgraded to a deluxe room free of charge and were given a baby cot for our 1.5 year old. As we paid cash we also received 10% discount and were given a 25% voucher to enjoy our first lunch or dinner in the hotel. My family really enjoyed every minute in the hotel and we were treated with first class service by all staff members there. I got to say the staff are very welcoming, helpful professional, respectful and hospitable. Our girls felt they were like family, every breakfast the waitresses in the restaurant will spoil them with games and cheerfully play with them. Nena hotel has really lived up to its standards and we will definitely recommend them and go there again and again. A very special thank you to all the staff members in Nena Hotel, you have made our stay in Istanbul an unforgettable one. Thank you soooo much for your great service! From Sari, Gheda, Halima and Nasma Awwad

Reviews.Title: “The perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: Francesca T
Reviews.Content: Excellent address, very conveniently located. Staff is extremely kind and cooperative, rooms are nice and perfectly clean, and the view from the roof garden is absolutely fantastic

Reviews.Title: “A Great find in Istanbul!!”
Reviews.Author: Kar62223
Reviews.Content: After a delay in New York, we arrived in Istanbul a day late. We were promptly picked up at the airport by a Hotel Nena staff member. What a relief after a long flight. Our room was very nice, though small by American standards. The breakfast was great along with dinner. The view from the rooftop dining room was amazing!!!!! The location of the hotel was outstanding. We could walk to the Blue Mosque, two Turkish bath houses and the tram was close by for far away places and easy to use. The best part of staying at the Hotel Nena was the staff. They were very understanding of our lated arrival and accomodated our every need. During the evening, my husband and I enjoyed sitting in the garden while enjoying a drink from the bar. I would not hesitate staying at the Hotel Nena on our next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Travel484
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 5 nights over new year's and loved it! The hotel is a few buildings down from the main street in sultanhamet that the tram is on - this means GREAT location! You can walk to the Sultanhamet tram stop in 5 minutes or less, the Grand Bazaar in 10 minutes, Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Hagia Sophia and Cistern in 5-10 minutes, and you are just steps from tons of shops and restaurants. Also, a couple doors down, right before the main street is a little shop that sells water, soda and snacks. We always got our water here becuase it was cheap - 5 liters for 1.75 lira! The rooms themselves were really nice and as pictured in the main picture here on trip advsior and on the hotel website. We had just a standard room, not the deluxe one that has extra space. The room was a little small maybe, but that is how all rooms are in Sultanhamet unless you pay extra for a deluxe room or a suite. We did just fine. The room even had a desk/vanity and a fridge. The room also had a flat screen tv and a safe. The decor was modern and the bathroom was updated. The rooms have individual heating/cooling controls. We found that our room was always a bit warm, but not big deal becuase we would just crack open the window for a bit and cool it down. We did think the walls were a little thin. We heard the kid talking and crying in the room next door, but this wasn't a huge bother. When the next people moved into that room, we didn't hear noise, so perhaps the first family was just a little loud in general. The outside noise was never a problem and a couple mornings we didn't even hear the call to prayer. We were in room 107 and our room was at the back of the hotel directly above the enclosed sunroom of the hotel. This was nevery noisy or a problem. Someone's review said that this view was awful, but we didn't think so. Sure we couldn't see the sights from our window, but neither can most rooms becuase there are other 5 or 6 story buildings around. The rooftop of the hotel is amazing!!! This was one of the main reasons we chose to stay here becuase we wanted to watch the new year's eve fireworks from the hotel roof. We were not disappointed! The views of the blue mosque are incredible and you can see the sea of marmar, the bosphorus, the bosphorus bridge and Hagia Sofia. We watched the sunrise over the Blue Mosque in the morning as we ate breakfast - georgous! Breakfast is included and is served on the top floor of the hotel. There are a few tables outside and many inside. There are floor to ceiling doors/windows between the two so you can sit inside and still have the view. Breakfast was good with many hot and cold choices. There were hard boiled eggs, cooked eggs, sausage, olives, cheeses, vegetables, fruits, breads, pastries, crepes, jams, honey, cereal, fruit juice, water, coffee, tea, etc. We always enjoyed breakfast. The hot options change slightly each day so you won't get bored. They also have tea time each afternoon with free tea (turkish or apple), coffee and cakes. We ate dinner at the roof top restaurant one night and thought it was really good. You also get a 25% discount on food (not alcohol), so it was a good deal. Overall, we really liked this hotel. It was really nice and was cheaper than many other options. Can't beat the location and the views either. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Would have rate with 6 stars.”
Reviews.Author: Kirill_Saturov
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week in this hotel and found it amazing. We travel a lot and never met such accomdating and friendly yet professional stuff. Location is perfect, all major sites are in walking distance. Great value for money. Would recommend it to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scorpioathens
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel,close to Hagia Sophia,Blue Mosque and all of the main attractions of Istanbul.A great value for money hotel with friendly and helpful stuff!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and value”
Reviews.Author: SueDenym
Reviews.Content: I took a party of seven spread across three rooms for five nights over christmas 2011. The standard of service is admirable, the rooms perfectly acceptable and kept spotless. I agree with all the positive comments posted for this hotel and can only add that it is spendid value, with genuinely pleasant personnel and a location that could hardly be bettered in terms of seeing the important sights.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Anna K
Reviews.Content: The Nena Hotel was excellent. The hotel is close to all of the major sites in the historic part of Istanbul. A SHORT walk to the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern, and the Grand Bazaar. A slightly longer walk will take you to the shore to enjoy the sea and the restaurants that line the piers. The tram to Taksim Square - the trendy, hipster hot spot - is close to the hotel. The hotel is well decorated and comfortable. The room and the bathroom were very nice. The hotel staff was helpful and friendly. The breakfast was enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice old hotel”
Reviews.Author: melpok
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, first night room at the back of the hotel facing the walls... next nightmoved to a bit better room. But VERY clean, helpful staff, great location, very good breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nena - A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jenpop
Reviews.Content: Both my husband and I would like to highly recommend the Hotel Nena and its lovely staff, especially the manager Mustafa. We stayed in August for a week and really enjoyed our stay. The breakfast was a delicious Turkish style buffet which includes hard boiled eggs, porridge, yoghurt, cereal, cake, bread and fruits. The evening meals are also good. We would definitely return when we come back to Istanbul! As a warning to other travellers, please avoid the men that stand outside their shops (esp carpet and ceramic shops) in the Sultanhamet area as many of these men are dishonest and wish to scam travellers credit cards. If you must shop in these places, we would advise paying cash only.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good stay with room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Miracle20
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Always willing to help with a smile on their face. Great location very close to many tourist destinations. Breakfast buffet was awesome. Loved the variety in spread everyday. View from the verandah was amazing! Rooms were very small and walls were paper thin. We could hear neighbor next door cough or sneeze. Sleep was very difficult in such an environment especially if we wanted to sleep in a little in the mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money!”
Reviews.Author: AlexandraMT
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, helpfull staff, very clean rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nena - brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susan R
Reviews.Content: A group of us went to Istanbul for a few days. Hotel Nena was perfect. Friendly and helpful staff, comfortable and very clean rooms, great position for sightseeing, either walking or by tram. Can't recommed Hotel Nena highly enough - we would most certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “HOMELY, CENTRAL, GREAT-VALUE HOTEL NENA”
Reviews.Author: TONY T
Reviews.Content: Istanbul has a plentiful offer of hotels, of all costs, locations, stars and sizes... Yet, if what you're looking for is a homely, clean, central, great-value hotel at the heart of the old area (at a stone's throw of Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, the Bazaar, and so on), don't look for any other hotel. It's not an 8-star, it doesn't have 500 rooms, it has no useless luxury, but the staff are wonderful and the views of the sunrise over the Blue Mosque in winter are breathtaking...!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - 1st visit Ireland to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: AdinoM
Reviews.Content: Nena Hotel is very close to the Airport where we were picked up & brought straight to the Hotel. I found the staff to be so friendly, polite, helpful and always professional. Rooms were very clean and well serviced daily. Breakfast was delicious with a variety of foods to suit all tastes served in the Terrace Restaurant where we could enjoy the amazing views of Istanbul. The location is very central, within walking distance to Istanbul's famous historical sites. Great shopping & restaurants and public transport i.e. trams & ferries all close by. Staying at the Nena Hotel made my first visit to Istanbul a most memorable experience. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A real boutique hotel experience in Istanbul...”
Reviews.Author: BusyyyTraveller
Reviews.Content: Location, service, hospitality, room decorations, breakfast.. All perfect.. Everything was just I expected them to be.. Plus plus.. A marvellous terrace to enjoy the real Istanbul!..

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectation”
Reviews.Author: ScottS69
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, affordable boutique hotel. Well situated in the Sultanhamet section of Istanbul with a gorgeous view of the Blue Mosque from the breakfast room on the top floor. Breakfast buffet was delicious and beautifully presented, and was included in the price of the room. From pick-up at our boat, directions to sites, and arrangement of an early-morning taxi to the airport, the staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. The rooms are very clean and well-appointed, and the hotel itself is interesting architecturally and beautifully maintained. A wonderful base of operations in a fabulous city - easy walking distance to major sites and close to transportation, shopping, and restaurants. Hotel Nena is not just a place to stay, but an enhancement of the Istanbul experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sharabia
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at hotel Great from the moment they picked us up at 5am ,we had breakfast at no extra cost,beautiful appetizing breakfast no need for lunch.Rooms were good ,central position close to tram ,no transport needed,plenty of shopping around, staff great Muzzafer and staff at dining room for breakfast zahira was very nice Highly recommendable hotel

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Staff, Beautiful Views, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Robin S
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nena has exceptional staff, beautiful views & perfect location. Muzaffer Sahin operates a 1st class hotel, providing excellent customer service. Musaffer & Muzzy assisted with all our needs making our stay in Istanbul a truly wonderful experience. They even helped us when the ATM on the corner would not return our credit card. Zehra & Ebru made every morning at the exceptional breakfast buffet, absolutely delightful! Hotel Nena will always be our home when in Istanbul & we will recommend Hotel Nena to everyone! Thank you again for a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Philip s
Reviews.Content: What a great way to start a 2 week trip. We arrived early 9 am, room was not ready check in time 3 pm Manager Muzaffer Sahin had us go in for a great buffet breakfast ( no charge ) while they finished cleaning our room. The room extra clean, staff friendly and helpful. Best location for major sites all in 5-10 minute walk. Would recommend this hotel to anyone to going to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff and good staff”
Reviews.Author: 885carlos
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. The staff were very helpful and friendly. They were always ready to help with any information that we need to know about our surroundings, as this was our first time in istanbul. The buffet breakfast was very good. The rooms were clean. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “memorable part of vacation”
Reviews.Author: brian w
Reviews.Content: Character boutique hotel, excellent upkeep in historic building, heart of Sultanahmet with easy walking access to major sites and public transportation, clean, excellent view from roof terrace for breakfast, certainly adequate breakfast buffet, friendly accommodating staff from front desk personnel giving advice on sites and restaurants to Ebra & Mehmet serving breakfast, had 1 dinner at hotel restaurant with excellent food although ambiance is limited, would highly recommend hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: Abdullah H
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has the perfect location. All the famous landmarks are nearby and it is very close to the tram station which makes things very easy for you. The staff here is very nice. Mehmet, the guy at the reception is specially very helpful. The breakfast is very good. They have a lot of variety. The rooms are clean and comfy. Overall, a superb experience!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, character hotel and charming staff!”
Reviews.Author: Sue850
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights November 2011- excellent boutique hotel. Rooms spotlessly clean, fantastic breakfasts in rooftop terrace restaurant with beautiful views, and easy to walk to main tourist sites. Ate in restaurant one evening and felt dinner was a bit of a hit and miss affair, although the food itself was well cooked. Staff very friendly, and would have arranged more ( excursions etc) if we had asked them. Would definitely go back if we visit Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “JUST PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: JOHN LAFAS G
Reviews.Content: The location of hotel is very convinient.The hotel is very clean and comfortable with polite, helpful and friendly stuff. breakfast combines many tastes and flavours and a large variety of selections. we are very satisfied and we will come again to Nena hotel For Sure!!!JOHN NIKOS DINA ANASTASIA FROM GREECE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superior Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Daniel562
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Nena in Istanbul for 3 nights October 2011. Our travel plans changed and we needed to cancel. I used their web site to cancel the reservation but for some reason they did not receive the cancellation and our credit card was charged for 1 night stay as a no show. I immediately contacted the hotel . The manager took the time to double check the records but could not find a cancellation. I gave him the date and time of the cancellation but still no record. He very generously agreed to remove the charge. I was very impressed as I did not have a record of cancellation. He did this in good faith after taking his time to review my situation. I commend Hotel Nena for their kindness and superior customer servcie ethics. Karen (Nova Scotia,Canada)

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Good Staff!”
Reviews.Author: lurch1
Reviews.Content: Hotel was good, clean, and safe. A bit higher cost for a room than many others I considered, but at last minute availability for certain nights forced me here. Gave me a room on the second floor facing the street. Although there was street noise even thru the night it didn't bother me at all. The location is such I think that the call the prayer was barely noticeable and certainly didn't wake me up at 5am. Room was medium sized and plenty of room to open and organize suitcases. Bed was spacious and comfortable, a TV was provided with only the BBC, CNN as English channels and sometimes another channel would provide English....but thats it. Restaurant on Terrace was great - perfect views of Sophia and Blue Mosque and the Bospherous. Breakfast selections were plentiful with typical turkish dishes - cheeses, olives, yoghourt, jellies, breads, meats, and cereals. Never saw any dinner served at night nor was the Nena Always the ground floor ever open. Location is perfect. Halfway between Grand bazaar, and the main sites and easy access. Even close to Galata Bridge if you know the route. Main street and tram are 1/2 block away and loaded with tourist places to eat....or...going the opposite way you can find local places to eat which are much better...however less english spoken if thats ok with you. All in all a very good choice for a stay...with a star taken away because of the price.

Reviews.Title: “A Delightfull Stay”
Reviews.Author: miloSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Nena. Beginning with an offer of a cool drink upon arrival and a relaxing informative discussion of the area with the manager in their lovely glassed-in patio. The room was charming and clean, with comfortable beds and bedding. The room small, but quiet and the in-room coffe/tea set up was much appreciated. walkinThe hotel was within walking distance to the sights and tram line. Breakfast on the terrace overlooking the Blue Mosque and Bosphorus was the perfect way to begin the day. The breakfast buffet was very good and included fresh fruit and vegetables. The personal attention we received from the staff made us feel as though our comfort and enjoyment was their primary concern. The manager recommended a tour that fit with our schedule and budget. The tour was great. We saw every important sight and more. Diner in the dining room was delicious, unhurried and was especially beautiful at sunset. Our manager assisted us with our airline reservations and the complimentary airport transportation was a bonus. I would recommend this hotel and should we return to Istanbul in the future would certainly return to the Nena.

Reviews.Title: “A dream stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tanya B
Reviews.Content: I had been referd to stay at hotel Nena & I was so happy we decided to do so. The proprietor, Fahri & his amazing staff in particular Mehment, Ugur, Cem & Gulten could not have done enough for my friend & I, they were so helpful & friendly & we were made to feel like part of thier family. We appreciated the airport pick up service. Great location. The rooms were very clean with coffee & tea making facilities but best of all were the breakfasts up on the roof terrace, so yummy & with a view to die for. I will always return to Istanbul & to beautiful Hotel Nena. Thanks guys for fabulous stay & sorry it's taken so long to do this review. Tanya, Melbourne, Australia

Reviews.Title: “so nice !”
Reviews.Author: Valentina C
Reviews.Content: fantastic position, lovely accomodations! the breakfast is very delicious and the restaurant view is wonderful! i suggest this hotel amd i would like to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: SACALosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We had been traveling for 5 weeks when we arrived in Istanbul. We loved the Nena Hotel. It is just 5-10 minute walk to the major Istanbul sites...Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Aya Sofia. And 5 minutes from the major tram that drops you right in front of the Spice Bazaar to the right and if you take it to the left, you are dropped right in front of the Grand Bazaar. The staff is extremely courteous and helpful. The full breakfast was a great way to start the day and though we ate in the restaurant just once, we enjoyed it very much. We had a lovely view of the Blue Mosque from our room's balcony and the room itself was quite large. It is not a big modern new hotel, but a little gem hidden on a side street in Sultanhamet (old city). It was the perfect choice for us.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service and Rooftop Views”
Reviews.Author: Phil S
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Nena Hotel, Sultanamet for two nights. Staff were friendly and obliging, providing very useful information on attractions and transport. The reception desk was daily filled with assorted turkish delights for patrons passing through the area of the foyer. It was a five minute walk to the tramstop where we ventured onto the tram and proceeded to the Grand Bazzar and Egyptian Spice Market. Room were clean and well serviced by staff. The breakfast on the top floor was superb with a great variety of foods, and astonishing views of the blue mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel in great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mairtin_81
Reviews.Content: Great experience from start to finish. Lovely quaint room that is cozy for a short trip. The staff couldn't be more friendly and helpful. Hard to beat for value for money. Breakfast wasn't exactly my "cup of tea", but would appeal to most people and is probably my withdrawal symptoms from bacon! Overall couldn't recommend Nena enough and perfect for a weekend break as the touristic sites are at your doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: tiredofthisSydney
Reviews.Content: After spending 3 weeks in Turkey, we accidently left our new camera in a restaurant, and then returned to Australia. The manager at Hotel Nena arranged for the camera to be taken to Hotel Nena and promptly continued to assist us with various suggestions, by email, until we found a friend who could bring the camera back to us. Besides this fantastic assistance, our overall impression from spending 6 nights at Hotel Nena, was very high. All the staff were friendly, our standard room was very clean and pleasant, the food was good, the furnishings warm and tasteful and the design of the architecture very attractive. It has a beautiful view of the Blue Mosque and Bosphorus from the terrace where we had breakfast and occasionally dinner; was quiet but very close to the tram and monuments in Sultanahmet. The cost was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: swifs
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at the Hotel Nena in October after our cruise. They met us at the cruise ship port with a van. We can't say enough for the quality of this hotel, staff and its wonderful location. When we arrived, the staff brought us into their pretty interior courtyard and brought us hot tea. They wanted to make sure that we knew everything about exploring Istanbul and offered to help us in any way! As we had just stayed, pre-cruise, in a modern, rather unhelpful, hotel in the New Town, we didn't need much help finding our way around Istanbul but we were really touched with their earnestness to be helpful. Later, they offered to print our boarding passes for our return flights and they persisted until they achieved success despite the usual roadblocks on the computer. Their location was very easy walking distance to the main sights in the Old Town- much better than the location in the New Town of our other hotel. For our last night in Istanbul, we had dinner in their wonderful rooftop restaurant which has possibly the best view in Istanbul of the Blue Mosque. The pictures we took became the cover of our photo book of Turkey. Our room was on a lower floor, which we initially thought might be noisy, but it wasn't - it was clean and neat and had a comfortable king bed. We didn't care about the location because the view from the restaurant upstairs was easily available. When we asked the front desk for a scale so we could adjust our baggage to accomodate the weight restrictions of our airline, they handed over a bathroom scale which more than adequately addressed our needs- we were so happy they had a solution to the problem! We were sure that the other hotel would have been totally baffled at such a request. The next morning we enjoyed the most spectacular full breakfast buffet, with the same wonderful view of Istanbul. It would be hard to describe all of the hot and cold offerings. We had requested a transfer to the airport and they not only drove us to the terminal- they drove to the upstairs of the parking garage, found a cart for our luggage and then wheeled us up to the first security gate. In every way, the Hotel Nena showed us the wonderful Turkish hospitality that we came to love in our trip to Turkey. We look forward to going back to this hotel someday.

Reviews.Title: “A cut above the rest”
Reviews.Author: OxtedDeany
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through Trip Advisor and were delighted with our choice. We received a very warm welcome and the reception staff were very helpful with the planning of our three days in this fascinating city. The location was perfect; within walking distance of the metro and most of the main attractions in the old town. An excellent breakfast was served in their roof top restaurant, overlooking the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus beyond. The bath/shower arrangement was small but the bedroom was adequate for a short stay and did not detract from our overall enjoyment of our stay at the hotel. We look forward to returning again with the family.

Reviews.Title: “A boutique gem in the heart of Sultanamet”
Reviews.Author: DrFrank
Reviews.Content: We originally reserved a "safe" brand-name Hotel down the road but my wife found the Hotel Nena 2 months before our trip. We were disappointed that the larger rooms were already booked but no matter. It had high marks on tripadvisor in location and closeness to the iconic things we wanted to see in our short 3 day stop-over on the way back to Australia after a wonderful 12 day Greek Island cruise. Nena didn't disappoint! We were first delighted by the big, warm welcome from the Manager, Muzaffer, and his reception desk associate...Memmet. Once the signing-in paperwork was done, Memmet took us to the lovely garden courtyard for a cup of apple tea so he could show us a map where all the major sites were located and the walking distances. He said he was aware we had requested a larger room and indicated that if one came up, we would get it. The next day after a lovely breakfast with a fantastic view of the Blue Mosque and surrounding areas we were told a room was available on the 4th floor. It was huge...with 4 beds! It gave us a chance to spread our luggage out without tripping over. At every turn they and their backup personel were their to meet our every inquiry and need. It is so close to everything, from the Turkish Bath (1584 AD), the Cistern, Topkapi Palace & the brilliant Archeological Museum next to it, Grand Bazaar, Hagia Sophia etc and many tasty cafes, bakeries (including Turkish delight!) and trams. We are making plans to stay there again next October and getting picked up after another cruise and explore this crowded but friendly city even more.

Reviews.Title: “"Great staff, great location, great hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Kenneth M
Reviews.Content: We chose this 29 room boutique hotel in the old city after a lot of research on the net and it more than met our expectations All the staff were very friendly and were always willing to assist with quality trip bookings and directions. Their website has full directions on how to get to all the main attractions and we found that extremely helpfull. All main attractions are within easy walking distance of the hotel. An excellent breakfast is provided with a huge selection of local and western food. The hotel is located just aound the corner from the main tram line and just a 100m from the nearest stop and dozens of places to eat. There is a free shuttle service to and from the airport if you stay for 4days or more and after a long flight, it's a relief to see your name on the arrivals board. We intend to return to this hotel next year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - perfect for Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: cleopatra119
Reviews.Content: Nena is the perfect base hotel for your stay in Istanbul. It's a quick 10 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar in one direction, and the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia in the other. The museums are just a few minutes further down the road. The rooms are beautiful and clean -- average size by European standards (small by US standards) and include everything you need. The staff was terrific -- attentive, thoughtful, helpful, and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Location & service: perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Faros
Reviews.Content: Like many others have said, the location of the Nena Hotel is outstanding. A five to ten minute walk to all of the main historic sites of the old city. On a nice side street right off a main thoroughfare, but relatively quiet. The hotel staff is wonderful - lots of great tips about the city, calling for reservations to restaurants, taxis, etc. Their English is generally very good and they make you feel very comfortable and at home. Breakfasts were quite good with lots of variety. Not outstanding, but quite good. But you can't beat the views from the roof-top restaurant for breakfast or for dinner. We only ate dinner there one night. It was good but nothing special. The only down side was that the regular rooms are a bit cramped. The quality of everything in the room and bathroom was very nice and clean, just a bit on the tight side, that's all, and without much closet/storage space. Other than that, it's a five star.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nena”
Reviews.Author: Marie P
Reviews.Content: Small boutique hotel, nice rooms, nice and friendly staff. The location is absolutely perfect, walking distance to most major sights in old part of Istanbul. Highly recommendable!

Reviews.Title: “All we could have desÄ±red”
Reviews.Author: 835Max_ne_L
Reviews.Content: We cannot praÄ±se the Hotel Nena enough. Ideal locatÄ±onÅŸ attentÄ±ve staff. Breakfast Ä±n the rooftop restaurant was the best possÄ±blke start to the day. The vÄ±ew across the cÄ±ty over the Bosphorous Ä±s breathtakÄ±ng.Clean rooms excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MaggieRB
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with very helpful staff. Room impeccable, reception staff friendly, hospitable and efficient, breakfast chef and waitresses always with welcoming smiles. So easy to get anywhere in the city from the hotel and the airport pick up and drop off made arrival and departure seamless. So many thanks to the manager and all the staff for making our stay in Istanbul such a success.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Julie M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Nena and the staff could not do enough for us. The position is fantastic close to everything. The buffet breakfast on the roof top terrace overlooking Istanbul was everything you need. Rooms small but clean all you need. Julie from Australia

Reviews.Title: “Service! Service! Service! Nena is now even better than ever!”
Reviews.Author: constant-cruiser
Reviews.Content: Having stayed three times in the past (with a group) at the Hotel Nena, I have come to expect great location, exceptionally clean rooms, a spectacular restaurant view from the top-floor balcony, great breakfast buffet and stellar service from Manager Muzaffer Sahin and his staff. Our fourth visit offered all of these and more! Those preferring a Sheraton or Hilton hotel should not stay at the Nena. The Nena is a smaller hotel with 29 rooms. But therein lies its charm. All rooms have very recently been remodeled and feature new furniture and a brand new lighter and brighter color scheme. Rooms and bathrooms are spotless and the front desk employees could not be more helpful! And Muzaffer and Hotel Nena have not been resting on their laurels. Since my visit last year, I have noticed an amazing increase in the number of new employees at the hotel. Service levels at the Nena are now at a new high. As our shuttle bus from the cruise terminal appeared at the Nena, several employees greeted us and assured us that they would take all of our luggage from street to lobby to rooms. An employee seems always available in the downstairs lobby area--awaiting any request. Service in the upstairs restaurant (where you will enjoy a recently upgraded array of breakfast foods) is wonderful. Two ladies are there to pour your coffee or to bring any additional food items to your table--and their smiles will help start off your day! By the way, carpets and wall treatments in the upstairs restaurant have also been updated since my last visit. During my groups three day trip to Cappadocia, Muzaffer arranged to store all of our large luggage downstairs at no additional cost (we carried only our carry-on bags on the trip). In addition, Muzaffer arranged a cruise terminal pick-up, transfers to and from the airport for our flights to Cappadocia, and even found us an excellent, affordable private guide for our three days in Istanbul. As fate would have it, I was fortunate to encounter a couple from the U.S. who were at the Nena due one of my past Tripadvisor reviews. They, too, loved their stay at the hotel. When staying in Istanbul, don't pass up this jewel of a hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet. I have included a few photos taken during our recent visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations and location”
Reviews.Author: peter v
Reviews.Content: You could not ask for a better place to stay than the Hotel Nena. From the very accomodating and professional staff to the wonderful roof top views and buffet breakfast. Great location with easy access to the tram system for traveling about Istanbul to all the major sites. Room was kept very clean. The bathroom tub/shower access was a little tight but functional. Would stay here on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Nena experience.”
Reviews.Author: WilliamEncanto
Reviews.Content: We and 13 others just returned from Istanbul where we stayed at the Hotel Nena. It is a typical European hotel centrally located near the good sites. The rooms were very clean, the breakfast buffet with spectacular view is unbeatable, and most importantly the staff went out of their way to help in any way possible, even arranging city tours with independent guides. This is a good one!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon September 2011”
Reviews.Author: mattlb
Reviews.Content: I am an American, and this was my first trip outside of North America. My wife and I chose Istanbul for our honeymoon because I am an Architect, and my favorite buildings are the old Byzantine Churches in Istanbul. One of my guide books recommmended the Nena Hotel, and after reading views on this site and checking out the Hotel's website, I decided it looked like a reasonable place. However the accomidations were well above and beyond reasonable. After a very minor incident meeting the shuttle at the airport that was quickly remedied by calling the hotel, we were welcomed by Mehmet with apple tea and an unobtrusive offering of tour guide options and brochures. We decided to hire a tour guide for our first day, and not only was the guide about 1/3 of the cost of the tour guide I booked for a later day of our trip, but he was just as knowledgeable and pleasant. Perhaps I am talking a bit too much about things outside the hotel, but it was Mehmet and the other staff members guidance that helped us have such a wonderful time in Istanbul. Like other European hotels, the rooms were a bit smaller than one might be used to in the USA, but still comfortable. We stayed in room 401, which is the suite with the view used in ther ads. The view is as good as advertised. We almost didn't even need to leave the hotel to get good pictures of the city (though you should because while crowded, the people of Istanbul are very friendly). Some reviews I'd read complained about the noise, especially in the suites below the roof top restaurant. While we could hear some noise in our room, it was only during normal operating hours, and never kept us from sleeping since the restaurant tends to slow down around 8 or 9PM and doesn't open until about 7:30 AM. All told the noise really wasn't any worse than a typical hotel in terms of noise from other guests, so other reviews that complain about the noise in the hotel I found to be exagerated. Also, I read some reviews that complained about the air conditioning. It was a bit warm all week while we were there (80 F), and the air conditioning worked perfectly for us. On top of the great service, I found the rooms to be extremely affordable. I think we payed an average of $266 US dollars a night. It was a 5 minute walk from the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque and basically the best vacation experience of my life. The staff was attentive to our every need, and I eagerly hope to return again some day.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding experience”
Reviews.Author: claire21117
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nena is perfectly situated in the heart of the Asian side and within walking distance to all of the best sites in Istanbul. The staff is absolutely fantastic and cannot do enough for you. Mehmet is particularly attentive. There is a superb buffet breakfast and the servers are very charming. Breakfast overlooks the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and Topaki Palace. A wonderful way to start the day! We will return the next time we visit Istanbul. Also, the price cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Good report!”
Reviews.Author: gghol
Reviews.Content: Good location; pleasant staff; modern facilities, yet not bland cosmopolitan. An excellent introduction to Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Courteous Staff, Some Areas Need Improvement”
Reviews.Author: wong561hb
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel just can't be beat. If you wanna be in the heart of Sultanahment within walking distance of just about all the cultural icons of Istanbul, this place can't be beat. With a staff that's extremely courteous and helpful, and prices well within most budgets Nena Hotel can be a strong contender for your stay in Istanbul. However, a couple of key factors for me that take away 2 stars are: the hotel itself feels more like a hostel, expect with older residents, the room walls are paper thin so if you have noisy neighbors, you may not enjoy your stay. Hotel staff are up early to begin their chores so you should expect to hear conversations and doors opening and shutting starting at 7am. Add to this the fact that the hotel room itself is extremely small and for 2 people it's a very tight squeeze in my opinion. Let's put it this way, if you view your hotel room simply as a place to lay down to try and get some zzzzs on your vacation, this is the place for you. But, if you are a traveler accustomed to staying at the "chain" hotels like the Hyatts & Hiltons of the world, this would not be the place for you. All in all I give this place a solid 3 stars and I believe this is a fair assessment of my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Riz24
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Turkey. Spent 6 nights at The Nena. Booked on line and the manager Muzaffer was very good at answering all our questions and even recommended the rooms- we wanted something very quiet. On arrival, picked up from the airport very professionally. Made very welcome by the staff- Mehmet, Djem and Ugur stood out. Friendly and informative without being pushy. Muzaffer helped us out with giving us his istanbulkart travel card to get us on our way. The room was a triple- spacious, very quiet and had a small balcony looking on to the back. My wife commented that the decor was traditional and a bit dated- yes compared to some of the ultra modern minimalist hotels out there- but perfectly acceptable. Likewise the bathroom was clean and functional- ideal for a family. All the usual appliances/conveniences were accounted for and working just fine. The beds were on the firm side but that was what we preferred at home. The views from the roof top terrace restuarant were stunning with the Blue mosque and Aya Sophia dominating. Buffet breakfast was good and again the staff were brilliant and really got on well with my 5 year old son (especially Ebru) who is pure energy defined. Within a couple of days the staff knew my personal beverage preference and it was served without even having to ask! The covered garden area in the back is a very nice touch- quiet and relaxing and chess and draughts set out to occupy the mind. All in all highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: joc21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights at the end of August. I was staying with my sister, her friend an d my parents in two rooms. The staff were very helpful and friendly. They facilitated arranging a turkish bath and a walking tour, both of which were great fun. They gave us first two rooms side by side on the fourth floor with views of the blue mosque and then had to move one group of us on the same floor but on the other side of the building. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The terrace restaurant was great for breakfast with lots of choices. We had planned to go for dinner there but it was so quiet (ie no one else was there) so we decided to go out to the streets instead for some more energy of the city which i think was a wise choice. The hotel is well situated in the heart of it all and on the tram line which was very convenient. They also provided slippers which was a nice touch. I would definitely go back to this hotel and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Well recommended”
Reviews.Author: SusanLeicester
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in August. The staff are very friendly and helpful, room for 3 was a good size and well maintained. There is a fantastic view of the Blue Mosque from the hotel restaurant, lovely to look at over breakfast (which was great and well stocked.) The hotel is right in the middle of all the tourist sites - 5 mins walk to Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, 10 mins Topkapi Palance, 15 mins Grand Bazaar. There are lots of nice restaurants round about and a starbucks over the road if the turkish coffee is a little strong! If I returned to Istanbul I would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, and we would go again.”
Reviews.Author: CWilliam F
Reviews.Content: The staff extended themselves way beyond the normal service in assisting us with services in the hotel and making excellent recommendations for tours, restaurants, etc. during our stay in Istanbul. The location within walking distance of the historical district was also very good, as well as, the roof top dining with great views of Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: MARILENA871
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated just five minutes away from Ayia Sofia and the blue mosque and two minutes from the tram station, so any area can be reached very easily. The rooms are very clean and the personnel is more than willing to make your stay memorable. You enjoy your breakfast watching the view of Ayia Sofia and the Blue Mosque and the food both at breakfast and dinner is very carefully prepared and delicious. The transfer service from the airport to the hotel and otherwise was very convenient because you didn't need to mess with the taxi drivers at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A decent place!”
Reviews.Author: nitwit29
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night and had a nice comfortable stay. The service is good and the staff members are nice and helpful. The location is very nice and really close to the main attractions in Sultanahmet. There are a lot of restaurants also around the area. The room was quite small and we did not have any place to keep our luggage but the bed was comfortable and we had a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable holiday in Turkey”
Reviews.Author: 425alessandra
Reviews.Content: Istanbul was a real surprise!!! Everybody told us it was beautifll but the reality was even better. The town is wonderfull, people soo kind and everything perfect. Hotel Nena was a real good choice. Nice, clean, wonderfull position (our balcony facing the Blue Mosque) and all the staff very very kind and helpfull. we will remember these days for a long long time, waiting the time to come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: humanb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located across the street from the Grand Bazaar and only a few minutes away from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. Topkapi Palace is also an easy walk away. The hotel itself is fine. The room felt a little small because of the way the oversized furniture fit into it. The bathroom was very, very dark. The decor was was a bit tacky but the place was certainly clean. The best part of the hotel is the rooftop restaurant - not for the quality of the food - but for the views. The food is not bad however, though the service is a bit lackadaisical. They'll always offer you free Turkish Delight at the front desk, which is a nice touch, and they'll mail your postcards. There are computers with free internet in the common area downstairs but no printing - though one of the staff allowed me to use their office computer to print. A decent hotel in a great location. Breakfast on the roof is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Cathryn S
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel to those staying in Istanbul and wanting to see the major tourist attractions in Sultanahmet and surrounds. They have their own driver available for airport transfers. It is located midway between the Grand Bazaar and the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia so central and few minutes walk in either direction. The staff are helpful, friendly and generous.The breakfast is very satisfactory - will miss those apricots and watermelon! Freshly squeezed orange juice can be ordered for an extra charge. The view from the terrace really sets the scene each morning and is magnificent in the evening too. The only thing that slightly disgruntled us was not having certain items available that were listed on the menu. We were there for 6 days and would gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel with Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Ellacious
Reviews.Content: Nena Hotel isn't as luxurious as those famous 5 stars hotel with grand structure and design but it is a very comfortable boutique style hotel with pleasant staff. The staff there are always eager to help you and even go out of their way to make you comfortable. I travelled there alone in August 2011, and I totally enjoyed my stay there. The hotel is strategically located in Sultanahmet. It is a walking distance from most tourist attractions. I definately recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Istanbul for touristic visit.

Reviews.Title: “Culture and relax starting from one point: Nena Hotel”
Reviews.Author: raducondulimazi
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed at Nena for 2 nights/3 days - too short to fully enjoy the historical center of Istanbul. The check in was quick and the hotel stuff helped us carry our luggage from the parking lot (not belonging to Nena), which is 50 metres away from the hotel. The hotel has a few parking lots situated just in front, but at the time we arrived they were occupied. We were told they could move our car in front of the hotel the next day, but we felt confortable with the private parking. The hotel is conveniently situated in the heart of Sultanahmet, 5 minutes walk from Aya Sofya, The Blue Mosque Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cisterna and the entrances of the Grand Bazaar. We were shortly and friendly briefed by the hotel manager about the neighbourhood and what to do and not to do in Istanbul. We were given one of the best rooms in the hotel, I guess, on the 4th floor, right just below the terrace restaurant, which means we had almost the same panorama with the roof terrace, so we enjoyed the view of Aya Sofya, The Blue Mosque and the beautiful Bosphorus. In the evening it was even more spectacular, with all the lights around. The room is not big, but it's very cosy, with white furniture and spotless. The bathroom was also very clean, provided with immaculate thick towels, shampoo, shower gel and body lotions that were changed daily. The room cleaning was also daily. There's a LCD TV with some international channels, very good air-conditioning, fridge provided with full option minibar drinks and a safe. Wifi works good anywhere in the hotel. Breakfast is organized on the roof terrace restaurant, it's very rich so anybody cold find something to eat. With such a view while having a good breakfast you feel the day starts perfectly and nothing can go wrong. We also had one dinner, but by option on the terrace of our room, as the Ramadan had just started and the restaurant didn't serve any alcoholic drinks. The room service was impecable and the food was brilliantly cooked . The guests of Nena Hotel have 50% discount at the restaurant. The stuff of the hotel is very friendly, well trained and speaks good English. They will provide you any info or help you need. Very good value for the money, Nena is your home in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: SAF101
Reviews.Content: Perfect location Delicious breakfast Wonderful view Very clean room Friendly atmosphere Thank you for warm hospitality...

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous”
Reviews.Author: InigoBocken
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not only very beautiful, it is also very clean and the service is really marvellous, very personal, they do everything for you, and this in an elegant style. You are here very close to the historical centre of Istanbul. The rooms are great, with everyhting a modern hotel needs. Out of that: I forgot my shirt, I called them and they sent it immediately to me. There is also a good transportation to the airport. The price is very acceptable, when you see what kind of luxuary you have The garden is very nice. Inigo Bocken

Reviews.Title: “Magnificient”
Reviews.Author: miami52
Reviews.Content: We made our reservation through hotels webpage and we have offered some promotions. First, after our long cruise the driver picked us up from Cruise port and we arrived to hotel early morning. There was not available room at that time but they prepared a room in a short time. Normally check in time is 1 pm but we were lucky. The room was very clean and well decorated. After we settled down we had our lunch at the terrace restaurant. What a view... We can see the panoramic view of Istanbul. Second promotion was discounted bill for our meal. The foods was extremely delicious. I loved the meze plate. All the staff are very friendly. Reception staff arranged a private guide for us. We visited all Sultanahmet area by walking. Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Place, Grand Bazaar... Breakfast was open buffet and very rich. I loved fresh fruits and Turkish breads. And Turkish coffee. (A little bit strong but worth to try it) I spent a little time at the back garden of the hotel and it was very peaceful. At the check out we had a cash discount. We made our check out very quickly and they offered one more free transfer service to airport. What can i say; it was a great experience. We stayed too many different hotels in too many different cities, but this was the most cosy one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel& Excellent City....”
Reviews.Author: GalileoV
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Nena during our holiday in Istanbul. It was a lovely hotel all the staff are very friendly and helpful. We have the all information we need from the reception. Whenever you asked a question no matter what they are doing they try to help with a big smile on their face. Our room was a standart room and it is very clean and we had the best sleep there. Also we could have coffe and tea in our room they have a very sweet facilities in the room so we can have our coffee before we have the great breakfast. having a breakfast at the terrace restaurant with a georgeus view of Istanbul is unforgetable. The hotel is very close to historical places so we had a plenty of time to see every single thing arround there. When we come back to hotel after sightseeing they serve homemade lemonade with the cookies it was awesome. Next time we will be there for sure highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice. Excellent view!!”
Reviews.Author: excursionist_01
Reviews.Content: We have decided to make reservation at Nena with the help of the reviews and when we entered the hotel we understand that we are in the right place. Staff were amazing. They welcomed us with cold beverages and gave us some tips at garden. our room was in 2nd floor with small balcony. The room has tea making facility with different kinds of tea and coffee free of charge.Breakfast was excellent with some fruits but most ipmortant thing is the view of the restaurant(great advantage). Only one criticism: It would be perfect Ä±f the room has comfortable chair

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic weekend”
Reviews.Author: Den1322
Reviews.Content: Not very often to meet such friendly, competent and hospitable staff in a hotel. More than excellent! Location is perfect! Very clean rooms and well designed. Really it's perfect hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in Sultanhamet”
Reviews.Author: Francesco_Manzo
Reviews.Content: Situated in the middle of Sultanhamet, few hundred meters away from all major touristic locations, Nena Hotel impresses its customers for the beautiful views enjoyable from the terraced rooms and restaurant, the cleanliness of the rooms, the availability and courtesy of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: nik1962
Reviews.Content: very convenient to downtown. staff very helpful and kind. excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for old city tour!”
Reviews.Author: Burist
Reviews.Content: We have stayed 3 days in nena ( room308 looking back garden) all staff made our istanbul trip incredible. Rooms are not so big but all hotels are same in sultanahmet area. Breakfast was delicious both traditional and global foods. Also the most important thing is the view of terrace. Highly recommended hotel we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nena was the hÄ±ghlÄ±ght of our wonders of turkey tour”
Reviews.Author: IstanbulYvonne
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and central Ä±n Istanbul. ServÄ±ce was excellent from frÄ±endly concÄ±erges, helpful young man carryÄ±ng our cases, excellent restaurant food and servÄ±ce from AlÄ± - everyone who worked Ä±n the hotel was great. We hÄ±ghly recommend thÄ±s hotel. Rob and Yvonne from AustralÄ±a

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: Hibbsy35
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time staying here. The service started with a personalised email with our booking. Being met and having a free transfer services from and to the airport made life very easy and took the stress out of our arrival. The manager was great and gave us some tips so that we felt safer wandering around this very hectic city. Fantastic location to visit lots of the main tourist attractions. Tram stops near by, very easy to use and much quicker than sitting in a taxi. Liked the added touch of receiving chocolates, nuts and wine on arrival to room. Bed was very comfortable and room was nice and quiet. Would have been nice to have more storage and a comfortable chair to sit on but we were not in the room that much. Good breakfast buffet. The young team at the hotel went out of their way to make us feel welcome. We recommend a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GWOngar
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Nena quite late after loosing a suitcase at the airport (not really lost but taken by another traveller) Nena was great, the staff could not have been more helpfull, on arrival we were given a cooling beer and advised of all amenities and tourist information, in this time they contacted the Hotel were the 'plonker' had taken our case and arranged for collection and repatriation. (we knew were he was as he left his similar case on the reclaim) Room was small but extreamly well fitted for a 3* Breakfast on the roof top terrace was excellent with fantastic views over all the touristy things (Blu Mosque, Topkapi Palace) Istanbul is indeed different but the people were really friendly, the hotel location was just about perfect with everthing within walking distance and reasonable prices. Overall I could not recommend the Hotel Nena high enough and when we return to istanbul we will definately rebook

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: NicSyd2011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Hotel Nena in early July 2011. The staff are very friendly and extremely helpful in offering suggestions of where to go and what to see in Istanbul. They also have very good English, which is always a great help for fellow English-speaking travellers. The room we stayed in was very comfortable, especially the pillows! We have been travelling for the past few weeks and they are by far the most comfortable pillows we have encountered so far (the small things make all the difference!). Tea & coffee making facilities and complimentary chocolate on arrival. Bathroom facilities were very Westernized, again the small things help! Hotel Nena is very centrally located in Sultanahmet, it is in walking distance to Agia Sophia museum, the Blue Mosque, the Grand Bazaar and Topkapi Palace. Plenty of local Turkish food and other restaurants nearby as well as little street carts with corn and roasted nuts etc. We also ate in the hotel restaurant several times, a great selection of Western and Turkish food to keep everyone happy.

Reviews.Title: “A great boutique hotel which offers excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Chancan
Reviews.Content: The Nena Hotel is in a very convenient location. The staff there from general manager to bell boy are all very friendly and helpful. All these made my stay a very pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelbuff11usa
Reviews.Content: Good location, walking distance to most of the historical sites. Very helpful hotel staff. Breakfast is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in good location.”
Reviews.Author: happytraveller085
Reviews.Content: Although I thought it was a little pricey, was very pleased with my stay at this hotel. Upon arrival was offered a cold drink - wish all establishments would do this when the temp. is high 20's and one is dragging luggage ! Staff very friendly and helpful - nothing too much trouble. Very good breakfast selection, and stunning views over the Bosphorous from the dining room. Excellent location, short walk to major tourist spots eg Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace etc. Many decent cafes/restaurants nearby. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and we hope to return”
Reviews.Author: randj040
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Nena Hotel and could not find any fault. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful - nothing seemed to be too much trouble for them.
