The room and bathroom were very comfortable and all cleaned beautifully every day. The hotel is in a really central area and yet was quiet at night. It is possible to walk to all the main sights from the hotel. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Istanbul for a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nena--Charming and Efficient”
Reviews.Author: Challancin
Reviews.Content: I recently led a small group of women to Istanbul, where we stayed for a week at the Hotel Nena (also called Nena Hotel). The physical space is charming and the staff is wonderful, efficient, and exceptionally helpful. I can't say enough good things about this small hotel. This was the second time I have stayed there, proving once again that I made the perfect choice for my groups. And the location is terrific as well--right in the heart of the Sultanahmet District near the Grand Bazaar. It is easy to get to the tram as well as the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, and various museums. A perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great return visit”
Reviews.Author: Business-traveller4
Reviews.Content: Background - Having stayed in Istanbul and Hotel Nena before I was more than happy to return. Staff - All welcoming, friendly, helpful and chatty. I received a text in Turkish from my airline whilst staying here and the manager was happy to translate and make a call to the airline and clarify the content for us (minor change in flight time). Rooms - since I stayed 3 years ago many rooms have been overhauled and are much improved as a result. Comfortable beds, tea/coffee, tv with plenty of channels, decent shower and aircon. Dining - The breakfast (& dinner) room is on the top floor with sliding glazed panels onto a terrace looking out to the Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque and the Sea of Marmara. The best view in Istanbul. For dinner there are plenty of good restaurants off the nearby main street (with the tram running down it). Public areas - A small hotel in general, but the the lobby/reception is a welcome rest-bite from the busy streets. The courtyard area is rather pleasant too and perhaps you'll be offered a gratis tea/coffee whilst you're there too. Other points - With hard floors on the stairs and corridors it's occasionally quite noisy when fellow guests return to their rooms in the early hours - particularly as some guests seem to need to have loud group conversations outside other people's rooms at 2am. If you have a free transfer provided back to the Airport, make sure there is plenty of float time built in - we waited 20 minutes beyond the requested time before giving up and getting the manager to book a taxi there/then instead.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nena, Hospitality and Friendliness at the highest standard”
Reviews.Author: brambles321
Reviews.Content: A warm welcome awaits you at this fantastic located hotel, we had a wonderful stay in Istanbul, the tours recomended by the hotel were excellent, we were on a B&B stay the breakfasts were excellent with a large variety of choice, we dined in the hotel all but for our last evening, the menu and food were great value, albiet the rooms were smaller than we are used to our room was maintained to a very high standard each day, the view from the dining room is superb. The staff go out of there way to ensure your stay is most enjoyable, should we return to Istanbul we will without doubt stay at Hotel Nena again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and personal”
Reviews.Author: sverre75
Reviews.Content: The service and personal in Nena Hotel are in the highest level. Perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fantastic location - would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Rachel186273
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location just a 5 minute walk from the blue mosque, grand bazzar and all the other main sites. The staff were so friendly and could not have done more for us during our visit. We ate at the hotel for my birthday and the staff surprised us with a birthday cake, it was a very nice touch and made our visit even more enjoyable. The hotel itself was beautiful and it is definitely worth taking advantage of the roof terrace which overlooks the city. Thank you to all the staff who made our visit to Istanbul really special, we would definitely recommend and certainly return there in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: bernardste
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife has decided to spend 3 days in Istanbul. Although we took almost a 13 hour long flight from Cape Town to Istanbul and we were there only for 3 days Hotel Nena people did their best to spend quality time in this beautiful city. We were welcomed by the hotel staff in the airport and transported free of charge. Our arrival was very early in the morning but the reception guys have immediately given us a room (without waiting the official check in time) and let us rest. The breakfast was superb too. We were able to taste varierty of nice international and Turkish dishes. About the location, it is great as the other reviewers have pointed. So I highly recommend you to visit Istanbul and stay in this charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, in a next journey stopped at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Volodymyr65
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, friendly personnel, good breakfast, ideal location, not very much good sound-proofing of numbers of,nemnogo noisily, but it did not strain us. In a next journey stopped at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A VERY COMFORTABLE STAY”
Reviews.Author: Marion083
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, ideally situated, very friendly service, very nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AND RELAX IN HOTEL NENA”
Reviews.Author: Graham_8
Reviews.Content: I was reccomended by friends in Fethyie to stay at this hotel and indeed it was great. The hotel staff were excellent as well as the lady who looked after our room. Breakfast was great and also the view from the breakfast terrace was incredible...also eat in the restaurant in the evening and indeed an excellent meal...the chef was brilliant. yes I would stay again at the NENA on my next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “best views of Istanbul from the Restaurant and extremely hospitable and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: opaUtrecht
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the best area of Istanbul for tourists, the heart of Istanbul, with views on the Bleu Mosque from the Restaurant on the top floor. The day starts with an extended breakfast, which is enough food for the whole day! The staff is extremely hospitable and helpful. The rooms are not so large, but very clean with nice furniture. We'll certainly come back to this hotel to enjoy Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “nice & cozy hotel, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: georg1964
Reviews.Content: absolutely positiv: friendly & helpful staff, great view from the terrace, next to Topkapi, blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, breakfast choice room for improvement: room size, hard mattress...

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nena is a pleasant clean hotel with very nice and warm people running it!”
Reviews.Author: karen0867
Reviews.Content: Dear Hotel Nena, This was the third time we stayed at your hotel for our business in Istanbul, and once again had a wonderfull time. The rooms are clean, the staff are friendly and very helpfull, the breakfast area with the stunning view and the location is just perfect. Thank you again for making our time in Istanbul fantastic. We will be back soon. Regards, Karen, Janine and Sonja

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dgbLondon
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 3 nights and found it an excellent hotel with friendly staff, nice room, excellent breakfast and ideal location as my walking is limited due to hip replacements so being near the tram was a bonus. The dinning room has an excellent view over the city and whilst the food was good the it seemed to lack atmosphere in the evening which was a pity. If you want something differnt for the evening go to the dinner and show at the Orient House which was recommended by the hotel. I would certainly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Watsclay
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at Nena very much. Very friendly staff. Nice location. The hotel is situated in the historical center of the city and the public transportation is a stone throw away. The breakfast was rich and was served with the perfect view of the city. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well located hotel, polite and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: espressogirl82
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very good choice for those looking for a clean and well located hotel in Sultanhamet. We are used to staying in smaller hotels so this was a bit of a change for us but we like it all the same. The staff are all very friendly and can organize anything you want. The breakfast buffet was very he Oriya and in a room with a beautiful view of the bosphorous. Would definitely reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm and friendliness”
Reviews.Author: BritoninAnkara
Reviews.Content: Of the 3 hotels we have stayed in in Sultanahmet this is the best. Location is very convenient, service is excellent, rooms are clean, well laid out and comfortable. Breakfast is more extensive than we have had before and the restaurant view is stunning. The hotel pays attention to detail with some nice small touches. The staff were helpful in many ways but especially when we had a problem with one of the local restaurants. We will definitely return and would recommend this to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel that meets all your needs”
Reviews.Author: PollyTopolina
Reviews.Content: Planning the trip to Istanbul made us wonder how to find right hotel and place to relax after long day of sightseeing. Browsing the internet led us to Hotel Nena, which has perfect location in historical part of city, with very helpful and friendly staff, nice and cozy atmosphere. Buffet breakfast (in roof top restaurant "Bosphorus" with excelent view to the city) was very substential and with great choice of local cuisine, as well as international one.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for money”
Reviews.Author: Hacke84
Reviews.Content: Best location, very good service, perfect breakfast with excellent city view, good and clean rooms for money

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and nice hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: heemels
Reviews.Content: Everything was very good at the hotel Nena. We had a great time, with very clean room and bathroom. Nice was alsoo the management, the roomservice and the fact that there was frech water, tea and coffee every day for free in the room. Hotel Nena had the most wonderfull brackfast, with te most beautifull vieuw at the bleu Mosque and Haghia Sofia, we ever had (and we have travelled to many countries in the world)!! We felt at home for sure.! A little comment are the beds, they could be a bit softer, maybe a tip for the hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value,good food, clean rooms, helpfull friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: greekray
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nena. Is well situated for local transport. yet in walking distance of many sights. Picked up from airport, taken to hotel,no hassle, Nice restaurant with views over the Blue Mosque and the Bospherous. Beware it is very cold and wet in late Feburary.Hat and gloves being order of the day. One Can escape the cold, visit the wonderfull bazaar's, grab many bargains. A good pint can be had from the"Cosy Pub " just across the road. Good time. Good food. Very pleasant stay in Istanbull.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent locaton, friendly staff and good value accommodation.”
Reviews.Author: jamespring
Reviews.Content: Located in Sultanahmet and close to Seraglio Point,, The Blue Mosque, The Hippadrome, Hagia Sofia and Topkai Palace are all within walking distance. It is very easy to travel further a field via tram, there is a stop located just moments from the Hotel. The accommodation is clean and comfortable and the buffet breakfast was excellent. with limitless cups of coffee and a variety of hot and cold cuisine,. the restaurant benifits from a terrfific view of the Blue Mosque and the Sea of Mamara, all the staff were firendly and helpfull and ready to advise me of the best way to travel to various sites and restaurants. I would highly recommned this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ase_29
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I have ever seen with friendly staffs,delicious food. I enjoyed with the location of the hotel and wonderful scenery. I highly recommend everybody which makes difference. Despite all the pozitive factors; room rate also reasonable. Since I always come to Turkey due to the business and conferences, I am sure that I will directly come this hotel with a high pleasant

Reviews.Title: “fascinating city,excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ozimandias23
Reviews.Content: The staff were very pleasant and helpfull. The hotel was in a very good location. The hotel and bedrooms were beautifully decorated and the atmosphere was relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: gggenco
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Nena Hotel, I felt the location was excellent,its located center of Sultanahmet the rooms were spacious and property was clean. Staffs were great ,lovely and friendly,i really fall in love with istanbul because of the view from the roof of Nena hotel,the view from roof restraunt definetly awesome, next summer i will definetly stay at this hotel again p.s: i am not able to forget ,delicious of foods just for their breakfast and lunch i can stay at this hotel untill end of my life....

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: elieajamra
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great from all ends. We were very glad to be at Nena hotel with the people's hospitality and guidance. I didn't feel away from home and thanks to everyone who made this trip a memorable one especially Mehmet Sara GÃ¼rbÃ¼s who we became good friends with. I would like to thank him for all the advice and hospitality he welcomed us with.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: anuragc1971
Reviews.Content: Great location, courteous and helpful staff (especially Mr. Muzzy at the reception), nice breakfast spread...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fettyfet
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Nena hotel very much. We contacted the hotel online and booked through their website which included free airport transportation. The rooms were clean. The staff were friendly. The breakfast at terrace was superb. The breakfast was rich of selections. The location is perfect, all major monuments are steps away. I think Nena is a very good value for travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: Dibby94
Reviews.Content: The reason we ticked poor sleep was that we found the mattress very hard and difficult to sleep on. Maybe the mattresses could be a bit softer with a little give in them. Apart from that we enjoyed the stay at Nena. Amenities to make coffee or chay would be a great advantage.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel with very friendly staff in a good location for tourits”
Reviews.Author: Kristina027
Reviews.Content: We received very friendly welcome and the staff gave answers to all our question, all neccessary information and guidance during our stay. The room was beautiful and clean. Perhaps if you plan to spend a long time in the hotel the room would be a bit too small but for our purposes (sightseeing every day) it was perfect. The hotel is located near most important tourist attractions and therefore very suitable for holidays. The restaurant is nice and has a great view, unfortunately in the evening it was rather empty. We would certainly recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “cosy hotel, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Vasilis_and_Friends
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really good situated, only 5 min walk to Aya Sofia and TopKapi. Would suggest it for someone who wants to stay really near to historical sights though it's just a bit far from good nightlife. The staff was willing to reserve for us sightseing visits, and give us guidelines while staying in Instanbul. It is a recently renovated hotel, something that was obvious, mainly inside the rooms. Clean, quite spacious. Wifi access was really good while our staying in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews were right!”
Reviews.Author: dj171950
Reviews.Content: This experience taught me the value of these reviews, which is why I am writing this. Hotel location is central within the older European part of the city -- a few minutes' walk from the Blue Mosque, etc. in one direction, the Grand Bazaar in the other, just off the tram line that goes to the port (where you can find ferries riding up the Bosphorus) and the city's newer section, from which I walked back one afternoon. Breakfast (up on the top floor) was great -- even in December, it was warm enough this year to sit out on the porch/terrace, which has a breathtaking view of mosques, port, etc. Hotel was clean; staff were friendly and helpful -- including paying for a taxi to the airport when the one they had booked said he'd be "15 minutes" late (I appreciated the airport pickup on arrival and then return, included with 5 nights' stay). Only negative was dinner in the hotel restaurant: a coupon with a deduction for dinner, and I was too tired to venture out; but it was slow season, and the menu was severely limited. Still, it worked out in the end, and this is a minor criticism.

Reviews.Title: “Super Super Super...!”
Reviews.Author: bey_78
Reviews.Content: Charming boutique hotel in the center of Old Istanbul. Me and my family did very much enjoyed staying at the Hotel Nena. Very helpful staff, great room, tidy and confortable. Breath taking view from the rooftop restaurant. Thank you to all for making our honeymoon a very special one... We will definitely be back...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect to stay for a couple of days in Sultan Ahmet”
Reviews.Author: timur_aksoy
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect for visiting the most important sights of Istanbul. What i liked most was the very helpful and friendly staff. The interior of the rooms is also very nice. One of the best price-value relation that i know in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good choice”
Reviews.Author: joanna004
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice with comfortable and clean rooms and the staff was really helpful and friendly The Buffet was rich and foods were tasty The view from the restaurant is fantastic since you can see all the importants sights

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have picked a better hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angelite
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel tucked just off the main road and around the corner from the Sultanahmet Tramstop. The tram takes you everywhere you could want to go so it's great to be closeby. Sultanahmet is on a hill with the tram at the top so if you pick a hotel further down the hill towards Kennedy Caddesi you have to huff and puff up it to get to the tram. Airport collection went smoothly - the driver took me to exchange money and to buy a Turkish SIM Card before we left. Warm welcome at the hotel by english speaking staff who gave me tea and sat me down for a brief overview of Istanbul, things to do, transport etc. They answered many questions and assisted with directions etc. They held my luggage on the last day - it was safely locked away and each bag was given a security tag which I had to produce to retrieve them. Hotel rooms were small but clean with lovely touches - I used my shoe polisher the whole two week trip I was there. Windows are double glazed so you don't hear the call to prayer in the morning :-) Good breakfast with lovely view of the Blue Mosque. Change Exchange over the road - 0% Comission. Plenty of fancy or cheap options nearby for food, or some turkish coffee and baklava on the way home late at night. One thing - the mattresses are a bit hard but I was so tired after a busy day I didn't let it get to me.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice staff, i'd recommend to everybody travelling to istanbul !”
Reviews.Author: elizinha85
Reviews.Content: the hotel is nice and renovated from not long, breakfast was great, staff polite, rooms not very big but comfortable. I'd recommend to choose the hotel to everybody visiting the town especially for tourism, it's located really close to the main attractions in a quiet and safe area ! i'd come back with pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location Perfect Hotel in heart of Sultanahmet Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Turgutalp
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th visit. Always a pleasure to return. Excellent location, exceptionally friendly, helpful staff makes it feel more like home from home. Good food and great views overlooking the Sea of Marmara and Blue Mosque. Book on-line for 10% discount and pay by cash for another 5% discount. Good value. Have recommended this hotel to many friends all of whom have agreed with my comments.

Reviews.Title: “Warmth welcome & goodbye”
Reviews.Author: eslimmer1388
Reviews.Content: We were staying at Nena for 7 nights I travelled with my wife & 3 children We arrived early at 7am on Saturday morning and was greeted by Nena crew and by 8.30 am we were at the hotel after clearing immigration & baggage We were told that no rooms are available a day earlier and have to wait for 1.30 pm for check in time However, once arrived Mr Mustaffa greeted and told he will tried his best to accomodate us as early as possible We were offered for a complimentary Nena Hotel breakfast for 5 of us while waiting for room be ready We spent our time for breakfast while facing Blue Mosque and Haiga Sophia Once we finished breakfast, the room was ready for us The most important, the location was a plus point Tram station only 5 minutes away, Main attractions all are within walking distance The crews at hotel were friendly and whenever we requested for room cleaning, it was cleaned by the time we were back It came with safety deposit box,full time hot water with high water pressure available All in I'll recommend Nena Hotel for value for money

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made my trip!”
Reviews.Author: newplacesnewfriends
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! I was nervous to be visiting Istanbul alone for the first time. Upon arrival to the hotel, a member of the staff sat down with me and went over a map of the city and pointed out places of interest. This was above and beyond the call of duty and was so much help! This level of service continued throughout my stay (2 nights). The rooms are very clean and the hotel is located in a great location, very close to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. The breakfast offered is delicious. I really wouldn't be able to think of anything bad to say! I will definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: easygoingwesternUS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nena Hotel for 5 nights. We upgraded to a deluxe room (#401), and we were very happy with our choice. We had a lovely view of the Blue Mosque and also the bridge crossing to the modern side of Istanbul. We had heard from others that the standard rooms are small; for five nights the larger room was great. We LOVED staying in the old part of Istanbul, and the Nena Hotel was perfectly located for exploring so many parts of that area. The staff at the Nena Hotel were friendly and quite helpful. The breakfast buffet was very plentiful and the view from the restaurant terrace was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location & Management”
Reviews.Author: george01
Reviews.Content: If you want to be within walking distance (and I mean 2-4 blocks) of all the main attractions, you found your place, specially when it rained non-stop in the 4 days I was there. If not enough heat in the room, ask the staff and they'll raise the thermostat. Management is just as good as the location, very kind and helpful. Breakfast was very good and plentiful with a great variety of foods for all tastes, and with great waiting staff. Dinner, on the other hand, at the terrace restaurant left a lot to be desired, not so much because of the food, but for the waiter who was terribly annoyed that I was interrupting the TV program he was watching (I was the only person in the dining room). The food comes form the restaurant downstairs. If you don't care for the view at night from the terrace and want to dine at the hotel, go the ground level restaurant. As for restaurants in the area, plentiful, my favorite though the EL FARO restaurant on the main street, about one half block from the hotel. Food and service were amazing, and some staff speak good English. It's always full, that tells you something. The city is great, the bazaar a few blocks form the hotel is very interesting and very reasonable. Do not forget to barter the price down, it's fun and you can get good bargains that way. Use the HOP ON HOP OFF tour bus, it gives you a very good idea of the city. All in all, very interesting and fun city, with very nice people.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay in this hotel unless you want to be called a thief!”
Reviews.Author: wblyons
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel once before and found it reasonably pleasant although not a value for the money. During my last stay I was informed by the manager on checkout that the maid had reported all the towels in the room were missing. I offered the staff the option of searching my luggage for the missing linens which they declined. Very unpleasant experience to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, great location, great value hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy171717
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Nena was excellent. Although the rooms are small, they're very clean and light. The staff could not have been more helpful and accommodating. The view from the restaurant was magnificent and the breakfasts were delicious. The location made everything an easy walk or tram ride away. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Istanbul. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Our third time staying at the Nena Hotel”
Reviews.Author: constant-cruiser
Reviews.Content: As a travel agent from Arizona (USA) who organizes group travel, it's always nice to return to a hotel that has consistently provided value along with stellar service. I am happy to say that such was the case again in October when i brought another travel group back to Istanbul and the Nena Hotel. For once again Manager Muzaffer Sahin and his staff went "above and beyond" in taking care of the details that always make for a memorable vacation stay in this amazing city. After the long and tiring air flight from Phoenix, it's always comforting to find Muzaffer's driver waiting in the arrivals hall to shuttle our group directly to the Nena. And once there, we never stand in a long line at the main reception desk to obtain room keys. Instead, Muzaffer escorts us all to the upstairs restaurant balcony where he offers us his sincere welcome along with a cup of hot Turkish Tea, our room keys, and a spectacular view that encompasses the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and the Bosphorus. It's always a memorable welcome for all! Muzaffer and his staff also again arranged for a first-evening "welcome dinner" in the upstairs restaurant. The optional (delicious!) 4-course Turkish meal was this time served out on the balcony where we were able to dine as we gazed out on the lights of Istanbul below. And upon arrival to our rooms it was nice to discover that the Nena Hotel has recently completed a very successful remodel. Rooms now sport light and bright colors, along with new beds and furnishings. Room floors are now covered in attractive hardwood. But it was also nice to note that the management wisely chose to leave the reception area, the Winter Garden and the hallways in their traditional (attractive) original condition. Great service again prevailed when one of my group members (with mobility difficulties) asked to take a cab to the nearby Grand Bazaar. Worried that she might not meet up with the rest of our group members who were already there, Muzaffer insisted that a Nena staff member accompany the lady in the cab! So once again, I would like to take this opportunity to thank Manager Muzaffer and his entire Nena staff for taking such good of our group. I'm already in the process of organizing another return trip to Istanbul for 2011, and you can be assured that we will again be staying at the Nena. I highly recommend that others do the same! Rick Hardina Gold Canyon, Arizona USA

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with dedicated management/staff in ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: Sukhumvit10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 nights in the Nena Hotel in mid-Oct 2010. The location, smack in the middle of Sultanahmet, next to the tram station and a 5-7 minute walk from major tourist attractions such as the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, and less than 10 minutes to the Grand Bazaar, is a superb advantage for this hotel. Muzaffer Sahin, the GM, and all of his staff are personable, highly efficient and dedicated to ensuring you enjoy your stay without being obtrusive. The top floor terrace breakfast coupled good quality food, charming service and superb views. We certainly had no complaints about our spacious attractive room. First class shower and comfortable bed. We had checked out a number of other hotels in the Sultanahmet area, as we had spent several days in Istanbul earlier in our trip. We were delighted in every respect with our initial choice of the Nena Hotel and would definitely return to it on our next trip to istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service without the 5 star price tag”
Reviews.Author: ptraves50
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated within a few minutes walking distance of attractions such as the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and the Grand Bazaar. The staff are superb. We arrived two hours late at the airport but the vehicle was waiting to take us straight to the hotel. This characterised the attitude of the staff and management. They were all eager that we enjoyed our stay and were very helpful with advice and service. The rooms are quite small but very clean and comfortable. The breakfast buffet is excellent and there is a spectaclular view over the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia from the Terrace Restaurant. We will go to Istanbul again and we will stay at Hotel Nena.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, good location”
Reviews.Author: Istanbul01
Reviews.Content: Very friendly service. Excellent location. Nice restaurant and terrace with beautul view of the city and Bosporus. Good breakfast. Good value for money. 3 friends shared room, with nice balcony. Free transfer to/from airport. Only negative thing were that the beds were a little hard.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel at good location”
Reviews.Author: windu21
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the must-have-seen-attactions of Istanbul. The staff was very friendly and the room clean and affordable. Great breakfast buffet in the restaurant situated on top of the building with a fantastic view over the Bosporus.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: DDAMean
Reviews.Content: My husand and I stayed at Hotel Nena for 6 nights last November and loved it. The location is ideal - they aren't lieing when they say five minutes to the Blue Mosque - it is close to everything in Sultanahmet and for the other parts of Istanbul, the tram line is a very short block away. The breakfast was wonderful, our discounted dinner on the first night was delicious and gave us a chance to get our bearings and meet some fellow guests. The wifi was a little iffy in the room, but fine in the lobby. The staff were friendly, courteous and helpful. Hotel Nena is one of the many reasons we plan on travelling from British Columbia back to Istanbul as soon as we can. There is also a fabulous "runny food" lunch place if you go out the front door, turn right and take the left just down the hill. Delicious, home made food for next to nothing. The only downside is the call to prayer at sunrise will likely wake you up, but that's the price you pay for being so close to so many beautiful mosques.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ejdjejdj
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two night stay at the Hotel Nena after a cruise and it was a wonderful experience. The staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. They arranged tours and guides for us and were sensitive to my husbands special needs. The location is fabulous, a short walk to most major sites. They upgraded us to a room with a balcony and view of the Blue Mosque. The room are clean and comfortable but not deluxe. The breakfast buffet was excellent but the dinner was only okay and you'd do better going out to one of the many nearby restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Baklavababes
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nena is in walking distance of the main tourist attractions, just off the main street, with public transportation nearby. The room was very neat and clean though the beds could perhaps be a little bit softer. We felt very welcome due to the friendly and helpful staff, in particular Mehmet, Kemal, Ahmet and Can. The view from the roof terrace is stunning! Great choice at breakfast and we loved the apple tea we were served when returning from a day of sightseeing! We will definitely return to this hotel for our next visit and recommend Hotel Nena to any traveler visiting the beautiful city of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location-Great Service”
Reviews.Author: emergencyvacation
Reviews.Content: Location could not be beat-walking distance to most major attractions. Concierge staff experienced, cheerful and very helpful. Excellent buffet breakfast. Great dinner at rooftop restaurant with view of Blue Mosque etc. Flawless complimentary airport transfers. Only downside was beds were very firm, too firm.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lyndael78
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful and friendly (special thanks to Mostafa on reception and the ever smiling breakfast waitress!). Good breakfast with plenty of choice. Rooms clean but small. Wouldn't recommend the restaurant for an eveing meal. We were disappointed that the courtesy of a pick up from the airport was not extended to us as we had booked via an agent. Beds very hard! The location was very central and all major tourist attraction accessible on foot.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Nicholson9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights, and despite unseasonably wet and cold weather for two of our 4 days, we really enjoyed Istanbul and Hotel Nena. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, the breakfast is superb and the roof top restaurant is out of this world. The location is spot on, a few minutes walk to most places of interest but on a quiet back street, so a good nights sleep is possible. We stayed in a delux room with a balcony with great views of the city; if one is available it is is well worth the little extra cost. Sue and Roy Nicholson Norwich, England

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: hansnagtegaal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really value for money. Perfect location, excellent staff consisting of people who know how to service its guests. If we ever go back to Istanbul (and we probably will, because we have not seen 25% yet) we will book Hotel Nena again without any doubt. Breakfast in the sun on the roofterrace overlooking the Bosporus of having diner on the same roofterrace enjoying the side of the changing colours of the bridge or looking straight at the blue mosque and the Hagia Sofia. It was a unique experience which we will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel in the centre of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: LeticiaB00
Reviews.Content: My experience in the Nena hotel has been wonderful. The personnel of the hotel was excellent, always friendly and helpful. The hotel has just been refurbished and the furniture, beds, etc. are clean and new. The room is extremely clean even though it is not very big. The hotel has free wifi service in all the areas and in the rooms. The breakfast is OK, it is not very varied but quality and quantity was good. The location is excellent, just 5 minutes walking by all the main places of the city. The only inconvenient in our stay was that during the night our room was a little bit noisy due to the general air conditioning machine. I really recommend this hotel and if in the future I come back to Istanbul I will come back again to Nena hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “â€œHotel Nenaâ€� exceeded all our expectations,”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Kay_70plus
Reviews.Content: In our case [now 70 +, and I guess like most other people] we rate holiday â€œtravelâ€�, & â€œaccommodationâ€�, etc, on a measure of value, â€œa degreeâ€�, in which it â€œMeets our Expectationâ€�. On deciding to have time in Istanbul we acquired a couple of holiday catalogues that listed a number of hotels. We then used â€œGoogle Earth [for location]â€� & â€œtrip-advisor [for comment]â€� to help sort which of the hotels to put on a short list. Then make direct contact via their â€œOwn-Web-Siteâ€� to ask for â€œavailability and special offersâ€�. Istanbul was new to us and we had no preconceived ideas of what to expect. Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend Hotel Nena”
Reviews.Author: Turkishdelights08
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel that offers easy access to the city's sites, is very affordable and has the comforts of home then Hotel Nena is definitely a good choice. This year I had the pleasure of returning to Turkey and had no hesitation in choosing Hotel Nena for accommodation. I have now stayed at Hotel Nena four times and each time it has not disappointed. It was a pleasant surprise however to see that the hotel and guest rooms were renovated prior to our return. The quality of the renovations were good and made the stay even more enjoyable. The hotel staff are highly professional and always eager to please. If you can get a balcony room you won't be disappointed either. Whether it's your first visit to Istanbul or fourth visit Hotel Nena comes highly recommended by myself and family and friends who have stayed with me. The tram is at your door step and will get you around easily. All the sites like the Blue Moshe, Bazzar, Sistern, Spice Market and many others are within easy access. Taksim is also a short tram ride away. I hope you get the opportunity to experience a pleasurable stay at Hotel Nena

Reviews.Title: “One of the best small hotels in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: anncorless
Reviews.Content: Thanks to a friend who was there last year, we made a reservation at Hotel Nena before our cruise trip. What a delightful place. The top floor open-air restaurant has probably the best view of the Blue Mosque around. The included breakfast was superb, as was the dinner of very fresh fish. The location is perfect and within walking distance of both the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. For a stay of two nights or longer, they will pick you up from the airport for free, otherwise there is a very reasonable charge. Only complaint was not having a top sheet on the bed, which may be a local custom.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: dannyTianjin_China
Reviews.Content: It was a challenge choosing a medium priced hotel, with so many offerings, and in the end it was strictly "throw of the dice". We arrived in the early morning, were met at the airport by a professional driver and taken directly to the hotel. We stayed 4 days, and were given a room upgraded from our reservation, with unbelievable view of the "Blue Mosque" and the sea. The location was great, service and housekeeping as well, and a generous buffet breakfast on the terrace. It was a very positive beginning to our two weeks in Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a luxury boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: bozleesmom
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and our room was clean and very comfortable. The location was excellent for sightseeing and right in the middle of the old city. We enjoyed the fantastic views from the terrace where breakfast was served each morning. At 108EUR per night with a cash discount, we felt it was an excellent value and would definitely stay at Nena again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: 186273Traveller
Reviews.Content: Great location for Sultanhamet sites and 2 minutes to Tram for further afield. Lovely small hotel with fantastic views from terrace. Staff very helpful, Mehmet on reception answered all our queries. Very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Our second visit to the Nena”
Reviews.Author: heidotheroad
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Hotel Nena, as we stayed there two years ago in a deluxe room. I loved the deluxe rooms as they have their own private balcony with an outstanding view over the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya and right over the water to the Bosphorous Bridge. It is lovely to sit there first thing in the morning with a coffee, planning your day, or to watch the city lighted up while enjoying a nightcap (or rice pudding from one of the many take away pudding shops!) This time we needed a triple room, which limited our choice somewhat. Much though I loved the Nena on our last visit, I do like to try new places, and hunted pretty widely, before deciding that nowhere else decent seemed to offer a triple room, with a balcony, for anything like as good a price. When checking the Nena prices be sure to enter your dates on their website as they offer several discounts, restaurant voucher and airport transfers which substantially reduce their initial published rate. The Nenaâ€™s secure booking section of the website is very good and they are very prompt at answering any queries you may have. We certainly were not disappointed with our second visit, being met at the airport by the same member of staff as last time and driven right to the hotel door. Entering we were met by some more familiar faces, before being shown to our room. The rooms have just been renovated and are looking extremely smart and clean (though this is not reflected on their website pics yet) The room was big enough for us and it is a great bonus to be able to sit comfortably at a proper table and chairs out on the balcony. It must be said that the triple rooms do not have such an outstanding view as the deluxe rooms but they are muh cheaper and we still enjoyed it. The rooms are well equipped with sidelights, tablelamps, wardrobe, desk, fridge, TV and safety box. The only thing lacking was a bedlight for the third bed but we just moved one from the opposite side of the room. The bathroom is also quite spacious with a good shower in the bath. The side of the bath seems higher than normal, and although we had no problem, it could be a little tricky for an elderly person. The front entrance area is very attractive with computers available for guest use and the large covered conservatory is a lovely spot to relax with a drink. There is an elevator/ lift, too, which many hotels in Sultanahmet lack, but it is really welcome when youâ€™re weary after a long day sightseeing. Staff are always friendly and helpful, too. Speaking of sightseeing, the Nena is ideally located just a few steps from the main street Divan Yolu and the tram stop. Many sights auch as the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, the Cisterns and the Grand Bazaar are only a few minutes walk. The selection at breakfast was huge with cereal, bread, cakes, fruit, typical Turkish cold meat, cheese and veg selection, and also hot sausage, eggs and potato dishes. The view from the breakfast room/ restauarant match that of the deluxe rooms so dinner here is also enjoyable in a lovely setting with good fresh meat and fish. If I had one criticism, it is that the Nena does not provide tea/ coffee making facilities in the room, although the fridge is stocked with cold drinks and tea/ coffee are always available from reception. I just carry my plastic travel kettle and borrow a couple of cups from reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel, close to all”
Reviews.Author: KThomason
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to all travelers.. it has great service and is very clean and extremely comfortable.. The staff was always very helpful and the food was great.. The hotel is approx 20 meters from the Blue line tram which can get you almost anywhere within 5-10 min. from the roof top terrace there is a lounge where they serve a great breakfast and the views of the Hagia Sophia and the blue Mosque are great.. the sights and sounds of the area along with the kindness of the people will make this a "for sure" stay on my next visit...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, view, and comfort.”
Reviews.Author: lowerpost
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with the web interface used by the Nina Hotel, and the honest and informative description of the hotel and its advantages given on the web. We would not hesitate to recommend Hotel Nina as having a perfect location for seeing all that Istanbul has to offer. When we accidentally left a pair of sunglasses in the room, the hotel went to some trouble to locate us (we were traveling), and ask how to return the glasses to us. Then they kindly sent us the glasses by courier. The included breakfast was excellent--the best we ever encountered in Turkey. The cost of the roomwas in the high end for us, but we were glad we paid more that we usually do, as we appreciated both the location of the hotel and the comfort of the room. Also the view from our room and very large private balcony was extraordinary!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: williamhager
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Turkey and we, my daughter and I , had the pleasure and luck to find this gem of a hotel. The staff was unbelievable from the moment we arrived we were welcomed like royalty. This is a very caring staff and they were always right there for me. Clean, and comfortable with a complete daily breakfast that left us not to want for anything else. I recommend this hotel 100% for it was just a fine and great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nena hotel in centre very clean, friendly and good food”
Reviews.Author: suyderhoud
Reviews.Content: Hotel was cosy, clean, the rooms were standard size and staff was very helpful. Had some problems with their computer but it was all solved by their friendly staff They have a very good and not expensive restaurant on the roof top overlooking the bosperrus We and the family had a lovely time there enjoying the view, food and pleasant atmosphere. I would love to come again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: vonh
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nena is a charming place and I can't say one bad word about it. Everything about my stay was perfect - free pick up from the airport, spotless room, excellent food served on a veranda with an amazing view, very friendly and knowledgable staff, free Internet access. Hotel Nena is within a walking distance to all major attractions of Istanbul, meters away from great restaurants. I know that whenever I return to Istanbul Hotel Nena will be the first place I will contact regarding accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but turned the AC off”
Reviews.Author: eventinggirl
Reviews.Content: We had a nice room and breakfast and service was very good. But the hotel turned off the hotels AC system when they felt it was cool outside (even when it was hot in our room) which was not cool. It was pretty uncomfortable in our room because of this. We found a better value hotel close by and moved after a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: MariaNewport_NC
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend the Nena Hotel . The location is perfect for the main attractions,such as Blue Mosque,Haghia Sophia,Grand Bazaar and others , it is just a few minutes walking . The tramway stations are very close also if you do not want to walk . The tramway is fast,air-conditioned,clean and takes you to pretty much every district in Istambul , ah ! and it is very cheap . The breakfast buffet at Nena Hotel is just wonderful and is served at the terrace overlooking the Blue Mosque and the Marmara sea , we loved it . The hotel staff speaks pretty good English and were very helpful with information regarding places in Istambul . The girls helping us at breakfast were also very nice .The bedroom was spacious and always very clean . I did not like the bed ,was too hard for me ,but my husband loved it . Some tips . At the Grand Bazaar , bargain as much as you can , we found big difference in price for the same article in different stores . There is a small Bazaar near the Blue Mosque where merchandise is the same at half price compare with the Grand Bazaar . Do non take taxis in Sultanahmet area , we had bad experiences . Take the tramway ,is very easy to understand . If you want to go to the Asian side , don' t need a tour , take a ferry for 1,5 TL (one dollar ) and you can choose what town you want to go to . Food is more expensive than in the States , and check your check before paying the bill . We had a wonderful time , we loved the city and would come back .

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel, well situated in central old Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: BriianAnn
Reviews.Content: We were recommended this hotel by Airmiles and were definitely not disappointed with their recommendation. The hotel, situated just off the main street in old Istanbul is within easy reach of nearly all the main attractions. Our initial room was on the small side but when we enquired we were soon moved to a larger one. The rooms were well maintained on a daily basis. All the staff were extremely helpful and very cheerful at all times. The breakfasts served in the terrace restaurant with outstanding views over The Blue Mosque and Bosphorus were plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: travel_girl_ks
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Nena Hotel for 3 nights. The staff was very friendly and helpful and patiently answered all of our many questions. It is in a great location, near the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, and tram. Breakfast served on rooftop terrace with amazing view. Lobby offered free internet.

Reviews.Title: “These guys were great”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaAcademic
Reviews.Content: Great staff; great location - everything within walking distance, loads of places to eat; I arrived early morning and they provided free buffet breakfast while my room was prepared; fabulous view over the Sultanamet from the 6th floor restuarant; friendly staff, helpful and informative; recommend this little hotel to other solo women travellers without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: pmayeur
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at hotel NENA in Istanbul this May and really enjoyed our stay there. I therefore, would like to point out what, in my opinion, contributed to the success. It is a well-kept, small size hotel with up-to-date comfort managing to convey the intimate atmosphere of bygone days. A most welcome harbour in busy Istanbul! Exceptionnal location in the heart of the old town, offering splendid view of the Marmara sea and Bosphorus from de roof-terrace and dining-room. The staff is very welcoming and efficient, going out of their way to please you and eager to chat (if you feel in the mood). It is also worth having a meal in the restaurant. The food is plentiful, tasty and well-cooked. Fresh and first-class ingredients being served. Prices are extremely reasonable but, as everywhere in Istanbul, wines and beer are expansive. Negative aspects; bedroom and bathroom rather small, could do with some extra â€œstorageâ€� space. I found just a little neglect in room-maintenance and finally plants looked somewhat rundown in an otherwise very welcoming conservatory. Thank you for your warm welcome and for such an enjoyable stay. Give our best regards to all the staff and congratulations and best wishes to Mehmet on his forthcoming marriage. Caroll Attley & Paul Mayeur, Belgium

Reviews.Title: “We would always stay at the Nena”
Reviews.Author: jeff255100
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, the dining room view is wonderful as is the food. Close to trams & trains and bazaar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly hotel, very good situated”
Reviews.Author: Paul188607
Reviews.Content: Good staff, friendly people. Nearby the Aya Sofia and Blue Mosque. Wonderful view from the roof terrace.

Reviews.Title: “A clean hotel with friendly people close to the tophits”
Reviews.Author: raymond_somers
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in the hotel Nena in Istambul. The hotel is situated close to the Blue Mosk and the Ayla Sofia. Breakfast is served in the restaurant on the roof with a beautiful vew on the above monuments. The people working in the hotel are very friendly, helpful and correct. The food in the restaurant is good and not expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: maxximop
Reviews.Content: We spent a 5-day holiday in this delicious hotel (family with two young children). It was quiet, clean, very close to all city's attractions and to public transportation. But the main points about this place are the kindness and hospitality of its young staff and the really good value. Don't miss its restaurant with a great view of the city. Perfect for a tour in the wonderful Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “everything and more”
Reviews.Author: amitabhnanda
Reviews.Content: we stayed at hotel nena for a short period during our stopover in istanbul at the recommendation of our travel agent. the hotel was perfect for our needs: -nice room [if a little small] with a charming balcony -great terrace restaurant with a killer view of the sights -friendly, knowledgeable, helpful staff -superb location

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful staff, delicious breakfast, superb view.”
Reviews.Author: tesekkur
Reviews.Content: If you want that short break to go as well as you deserve this hotel, its location, rooms and service would be hard to beat. Situated in the centre of Sultanhamit close to many historic sites witha perfect view from thebrekfast/ dinning room balconey. What did we like best, the staff, and least, leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you”
Reviews.Author: Faridrohani
Reviews.Content: Thank you to all the staff at Nena for a great time. We found your service to be excellent and the special caring by your team made our stay most comfortable. Thanks again. We will surely come back on our next trip and stay with you. Thanks again. Farid

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: russiantourist_10
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, beautifull view from terrasa, very delicious cousin, friendly personal

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great area”
Reviews.Author: Bogna9093
Reviews.Content: I was in Istambul for 5 days on May and my friend recommended me hotel Nena. It's small, charming hotel in Sultanhamet area. I took triple room with my friends and before coming our room was upgraded for delux room for the same price. We had beautifull terrace with the view on the Blue Mosque. The real highlight is breakfast terrace with the view of the whole city. The food is very good and the staff is waiting for you till u finish the breakfast ( even it's after the hour of closing the restaurant). Everybody is friendly and defenetely it made our stay even better in Istambul. I highly recommend this place to stay during the visit in Istambul.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great location, wonderful views from the rooftop terrace”
Reviews.Author: JD_NL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nena Hotel for 4 nights. It is really a good place to stay in Istanbul. We made the reservation through their website and paid 100 euros per night including breakfast and transportation from Ataturk airport to the hotel. We arrived late at night but it was no problem. The hotel is very conveniently located, it is within walking distance of the blue mosque, the cisterns and the aya sofia. There is a tram stop nearby which can take you directly to the ferry port (3 stops) from where you can enjoy a boat trip on the bosphorus or take a ferry to Uskudar etcetera (public transportation is extremely cheap!). The roof terrace offers wonderful views of the city and the bosphorus and beyond. You can enjoy breakfast there. The roof terrace is not very big, sometimes it is full and you have to sit inside but then you still have a great view through the windows. If you stay at this hotel, it is worth considering what kind of room you want- I read in one of the other reviews that the rooms ending with a 4 or 5 digit don't have a view outside. I mentioned it when I made the reservation and we got a good room, and when we were there I found out that indeed the rooms ending with a 4 or 5 have almost no daylight. However, the room we got was very nice! It is true that you can sometimes hear other guests (in the hallway, not in the other rooms) but it did not bother me at all. I was pleasantly surprised by the LCD tv which could be viewed from the bed and also offered foreign channels such as the BBC, as well as many sports channels. Very relaxing after a long day of walking. Things from the mini bar were not too expensive. The restaurant which is open in the evening (same location where breakfast is served) is a bit expensive but if you make your reservation at the nena website you get a discount coupon which you can use once (50% off). You can also just go there for drinks, they also have alcoholic drinks (not all restaurants in Istanbul do). There is wireless internet in the hotel, which was very helpful. Service was good. All staff speaks English very well and was friendly, for example, when we needed to print our boarding passes, they helped us print them in their office. All in all, the hotel is not very cheap but also not too expensive, and definitely good value for money. I have already recommended it to friends ;)

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: BucharestVlad
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, great location, free airport transfer if booked on the hotel site, good breakfast with terrific view. The only downside is the fact that the rooms - at least the one we were in - are very noisy, we could hear every sound in the hotel, guests opening their doors, walking on the tiled floor, speaking, etc and all the noise in the main street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Notaras
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent and the area is very safe. Service in the hotel is very good and the hotel staff is friendly. No problems with cash payment or with credit cards.

Reviews.Title: “A great value hotel with excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Abbykat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nena on the recommendation of Tripadvisor and some customers of ours who had stayed there. We were looking for a good value hotel, which was close to transport and the sights. Staff were very friendly and helpful, giving us good advise about taxi drivers and the price we should pay to get to a destination. Taxi drivers can be known to overcharge in Instanbul. Our room was basic but clean. The breakfast in the restaurant was the best we had in our 1 month holiday. Very good choice of foods. We also ate there once in the evening and again, were very impressed. The view from the restaurant was of the blue Mosque, which was a highlight. If we ever visit Istanbul again, we wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Nena. Excellent value

Reviews.Title: “Better hotel all the same will not find!”
Reviews.Author: Yugra
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located in relation to down town. The personnel is very polite, obliging and professional. Quality of meal at restaurant very high. I recommend this hotel for visiting by all without an exception!

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home in Hotel Nena”
Reviews.Author: Turgutalp
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be excellent in every respect. As a single lady travelling alone I found the staff friendly welcoming and professional. The room was delightful, newly refurbished, clean and comfortable. TV gave me a good choice of English speaking programmes. It was quiet but in central location close to tram system on Divan Yolu taking you to every part of the city. The restaurant was stylish with excellent views to the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya museum. The Hotel location in Sultan Ahmet was just perfect in every way. Plenty of shops, restaurants, transport, Grand Bazaar and other major tourist sights within a short walking distance. I also appreciated the free internet which enabled me to keep in touch with friends, family and my own business commitments. Another particularly important aspect was to be able to book on-line, get a good discount and even more if you settled the account in cash. Transport to and from the airport was a huge plus for me making this part of my journey comfortable and easy. Well done to all the staff and management - professional and reliable. Many Turkish businesses should use this Hotel model as a role model for best practice. They could learn alot. Thank you for making my stay so comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “value for money stay, with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LONDONAUDIT
Reviews.Content: excellent budget hotel with excellent location. the staff is soft spoken, submissive, cooperative and understand the needs of its customers. the rooms are comfortable, elegantly made up, bathroom is incredibly clean and stylish. would recommend others to stay in this hotel. the restaurant in the terrace gives a wonderful view of the holy blue mosque and the adjoining scenery is treat for the eyes.

Reviews.Title: “The right price in the right location”
Reviews.Author: wardywoo
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you are watching your pennies and want value for money. Our room was clean and had all the mod cons needed. The staff were really helpful and friendly and the location is fantastic - five minutes to the Grand Bazaar in one direction and a gentle five minute stroll down the hill to the Blue Mosque and AyaSofya with Topkapi Palace just beyond that. Stand on the roof terrace and you can see them, so great views too. The trams run on the main road which is adjacent to the hotel so easy access to the port although that is only a ten minute walk, just follow the tramlines downhill and presto, you are by the ferries and Galata Bridge. We were a bit wary of the carpet man who stood on the corner of the street but we ended up buying some nice cushion covers off him too, over the obligatory glass of Apple Tea and a chat! Would definately return when we get the chance to visit Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly. Like coming home after a long day of sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: Lois343
Reviews.Content: We found the staff to be very friendly and accommodating. Our room was upgraded upon arrival. The rooms were clean and the hotel was well maintained. The view of the Blue Mosque from the roof balcony was "awesome" We enjoyed our morning breakfasts on the roof garden. Food was fresh and offered a good variety. It was great to be in the downtown area of Istanbul where we got the full flavour of Turkey. Look forward to returning one day.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bernydoha
Reviews.Content: i had visited this hotel from 27th to 30th nov and i must stay that the hotel is perfectly situated in the tourist centre of sultanahmet and little on a quiter side... the hotel staff was very pokite and room was in a good condition and also well taken care everyday... the roof toof terrace was marvelous and the restaurant staff would go an extra mile to make the people confortable. even though i visited alone this hotel is fantastic for couple as well with all basic and necessial ammenities including wireless internet..... i was well taken care of and i look forward to visit again with a bigger group..... bernard pereira

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer service and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: CoCoffee
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Nena Hotel during U.S. Thanksgiving Holidays; the hotel is small, charming, 1 block from the Tram, easy walking to Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, etc. Fantastic customer service, great breakfast with wonderful view from breakfast room, clean, European style small rooms, but absolutely adequate, good shower, free internet; I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel to comeback to”
Reviews.Author: ecbmdpsych
Reviews.Content: In terms of our accomodation in Istanbul, Hotel Nena, I can say that generally the staff are friendly, most specially, the General Manager, Mr. Muzaffer Sahin. He was pleasant and very helpful particularly when he have questions about directions in Istanbul or other matters in general and was very accommodating when he let us use his own office computer to check-in via internet for one of our flights. He is truly a professional and should be given recognition for this. The other hotel staff were also willing to please you. However, our comments about this hotel were some of its amenities; like the torn and worn out bath towels provided that were truly in the "falling apart" mode, not replacing bath soaps, shampoos, etc., the lack of closet space for clothes, quasi tidy rooms with really old fixtures, a missing light bulb there, the clock not working, inefficient AC/Heating system, which practically was somewhat uncomfortable during our stay there, even though we were given a different rooms during our re-check in from Cappadocia and the window only faced a wall. I don't know if this was the room that was part of this package. I looked at the hotel's price sign in the lobby and the cheapest room was described a "Double Room," which I think was the one given to us. I was informed by one of the friendly staff that rooms ending in the digit 4 or 5 such as 104, 204, 305, etc. all have the same features. So you definitely want to avoid staying in rooms ending in the 4 or 5 digit.

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast”
Reviews.Author: GKEB
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from several weeks travelling in various countries in the Mediterranean and stayed in a number of hotels. We felt this hotel was one of the best, based on the great view and location, and the really good breakfast. The staff was efficient and friendly. Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: ForiegnShores
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nena is small but in a perfect location, within walking distance off all the sights and close to a tram stop. All the staff were extremely helpful and made us feel right at home. They were happy to give us lots of local information without pushing trips on us. Our bedrooms were on the third floor and were of a decent size with excellent bathrooms. The wi-fi worked fine plus there were PCs in the lobby if you wanted. Breakfasts were great with superb views of the Blue Mosque. We ate in the hotel restaurant on the first night and had a very good meal. However due the fact that there were a lot of restaurants nearby that we wanted to try we only ate there once. A big thank you to Errol and the boys. Family from England

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: chester1
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this hotel but found the rooms - especially for a single- quite small and a little dingy. There are many options in Istanbul so I'm not sure I would stay here again in a single. Staff were very friendly and helpful and it is a great location. Cost was quite high for an upgraded double (not worth it)-- within 20 euros of the 5 star hotel I moved to later.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: pcm7
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hotel Nena - which i booked after reading reviews on this site i might add. it was excellent in every aspect, the staff were so welcoming and friendly, the rooms were spotless at all times and the view from the terrace where we had a delicious breakfast was amazing. we would highly recommend staying at this hotel, its in a perfect location for visiting all the sights and an absolute pleasure to stay in. Pat & Dave

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: agator
Reviews.Content: Great location - though unkown to many cab drivers!!! - but the good news is that the driver we had, at least, was willing to do the search till he got us there! Charming iittle venue with smallish rooms- but clean and quite adequate. Staff very friendly and accommodating. Included breakfast very regionally acceptable and tasty. View from the breakfast balcony was great - Blue Mosque in the background. Very friendly and helpful staff - including free baggage storage post check out time. We would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Friendly and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Frank9955
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hotel Nena in October 2008 and October 2009. On both occasions we found the hotel to be very comfortable, the staff very friendly and helpful. The hotel is literally a 5 minute walk from the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia. The view of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Sea of Marmara from the hotel restaurant is wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: sahara214
Reviews.Content: We couldnt have chosen a better hotel, cozy, friendly, clean. Its in a perfect location close to all major attractions, staff are exceptionally helpful and kind, has a great terrace view, which makes breakfast an additional pleasure. Highly recommended, I would definitely stay here again! Thanks to al the hotel staff - you guys rock!

Reviews.Title: “Just what the Doctor ordered”
Reviews.Author: CharlesPlymouth_UK
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in the last 3 years.Location is everything in Istanbul and this hotel is perfect being near 2 tram stops, all the sights of Sultanahmet and some very good restaurants inc Nenas own.The hotel staff are very special,it is exceedingly well run and very clean. We had a very efficient pick up and take back to airport courtesy of Nena which was free. The views from the top floor deluxe rooms and rooftop restaurant are just amazing.Breakfast with history around you.My walking is very bad and the location for us is as good as it gets. It gets quite steep south of the Blue Mosque. Istanbul and its people are very special and the Nena is a credit to fantastic Turkish hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “A Million dollar view of the blue Mosque...aahh”
Reviews.Author: creativejunquie
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the Nena. Ok, it is a little boutique, but it was GREAT! Memhet at the front desk was more than helpful, and Ali, the waiter at the rooftop restaurant was completely entertaining. The Nena has an old fashioned charm, but is fresh and has a regal candor. Loved it! we stayed at 2 other (5 star) hotels while we were Istanbul mid-August '09. I would actually stay at the Nena again in a heartbeat over the more expensive places. i travel a lot, so i guess it is nice to be in a hotel that feels like home and makes you part of the family. Thanks guys!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location...”
Reviews.Author: Roelofsen
Reviews.Content: This hotel in conveniently located in the heart of old Constantinople. The magnificent view on the Blue Mosque from the breakfast room is unique!

Reviews.Title: “Super location and wonderful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Jagggs
Reviews.Content: A well-travelled friend recommend this hotel for its breakfast, location, and free transportation to the airport. We couldn't have been happier (unless the ac was a bit more robust.) The English-speaking staff was very helpful and Erol asked me to mention him especially. He's the most out-going of the staff, but all of them are extremely pleasant and easy to work with. The hotel is very well-located, just off the tramway, and only a short walk from most of the 5-star sights of ancient Istanbul. There are many restaurants nearby, as well as one in the hotel. We were two women travelling alone and never felt uncomfortable walking in the neighborhood. This is a place that we'll certainly suggest to friends and return to if we're lucky enough to get a second crack at this fascinating and welcoming city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BryoFrank
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in Hotel Nena. Great Location, hotel staff . . . very friendly, especially Mr Bean ! Room . . . . first class, breakfast - - - Great, Waitressess, very helpfull & friendly. Bed room cleaners first class ! View from restuarant - - - - panoramic ! Going to Istanbul ? - - - - Go to Hotel Nena ! Thanks to everyone in Hotel !

Reviews.Title: “A Family Feeling”
Reviews.Author: Tramel
Reviews.Content: Each member of the staff was so courteous that we felt welcomed and cared for. This is a small hotel that majors in service. It's location is excellent, with the tram nearby and outstanding historical properties...in the heart of old Constantinople. Great tour recommendation for a boat tour up the Bosphorus to the Black Sea, a good complimentary breakfast and a splendid view from the terrace of Haghia Sophia, the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Atmosphere is a bit heavy, but a good location”
Reviews.Author: DaveH-ExPat
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nena is located on the more modern side of the Old City, close to the Blue and Red mosques just off a busy street. The traffic noise is not too bad and the hotel is easy to find; it is a short walk from many shops and restaurants. The rooms are small, filled with heavy, dark furniture that gave it a very leaden feel (I've stayed in other hotels in the area that feel much lighter). The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was modern and clean, with tub / shower combination and good hot water. The staff was helpful but not always well-informed: directions to nearby restaurants were wrong on several occasions. The hotel has a rooftop restaurant and lounge, but there was nobody tending either one in the evening and we had to look elsewhere for dinner. Breakfast was good, and the view across the rooftops to the mosques is great.. The Nena is good budget value in a convenient location, but not as good as the more traditional neighborhoods nearby with less touristed restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “A true value for the price i paid”
Reviews.Author: TorontoQamar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Nena hotel for just one night but it was an excellent experience. I was received at the airport and was transferred to the hotel in a very comfortable coaster. The room was very neat and clean and the views of Blue Mosque from the terrace were breathtaking. The staff is very friendly and nice. I would like to thank them all specially their General Manager Muzaffar who had been very nice and helpfull to me. The food was good specially the breakfast was excellent in quantity, quality and variety. I would definately love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A splendid experience”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1306
Reviews.Content: We found a reference to the Nena in Budget Travel and looked into it. It proved to be the best move for our first trip to Istanbul, equipped with nothing more than a guidebook. The hotel is excellently located and we were able to walk to most of the prime tourist sites, from the underground cisterns to the Grand Bazaar, the Topkapi Palace, mosques and museums, even to the waterfront and the ferry up the Bosphorus. Better still was the hotel's small but charming and well-kept interior, with just enough amenities to feel comfortable within its price class. Our single room was large and neat, with a very clean bathroom and tub. Our only concern: furnishings in the room were a little spartan; it could have used more drawer space in addition to the free-standing wardrobe. The free daily breakfast was more than adequate, with lots of choices served in an upper floor restaurant with a view that was spectacular. But even with all of these positives, the most outstanding feature of the Nena was its staff: they were always helpful and friendly, eager to help make reservations for us, ready with advice on things to do and ways to get around. We will most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good job!”
Reviews.Author: Yuli_swift
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine recommended me to stay at this hotel. I was 100% satisfied with its location, personnel, food and cleanliness. The only thing (but I think it is a general problem in Istanbul) is parking, i.e. if you have friends coming to see you in the hotel, they will have difficulties with parking around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: JeffersonG
Reviews.Content: I have just spent three days in Istanbul staying at Hotel Nena. The hotel is so well located, between all the major attractions. The Staff were very helpfull and welcoming. I was there for a wedding located on the outskirts of the city, so the reception helped to get a cab and made sure we would not be overcharged by going the long way round (which has a tendency to happen). Room: A bit on the small size, but in a city like Istanbul the hotel room should really only be for sleeping, so the size was not important. The room was very clean. Breakfast is served on the top floor with a really lovely view of Istanbul. The breakfast was help yourself buffet style with a good variety of hot and cold selection, fresh bread and fruit. The hot selection was tasty. The hotel has also free internet access which is very usefull as Mobile phone call in Turkey are really expensive with a UK mobile. Recomendation for Istanbul. A must for every vistor is the 'bread and fish' sold on the docks near the spice market. The locals flock to it daily and for 4 Lira you get a freshly grilled fish (mackerel) in fresh bread. The secret is alo to get the pickles to eat with the fish. Its a great meal for next to nothing. I found the locals very friendly (overtly sometimes), but not aggresive, and once they understood that i was not going to buy anything they left you alone) I would come back to Istanbul, and Hotel Nena.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: Tossi
Reviews.Content: Free Airport Pick-Up, free Internet access, very friendly and helpful hotel staff, a rooftop terrace with a breathtaking view over the Marmara Sea, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Bosporus. Breakfast with a great range of products like eggs, oven potatoes, fresh fruits like melon or cherries, fruit salad, two different juices, porridge, cornflakes, milk, cheese, jam, bread and more. Room with minibar, modern TV, bathroom with hairdryer and comfortable shower, absolutely noise-stopping windows.

Reviews.Title: “great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: msr099
Reviews.Content: staff very helpful in this small boutique hotel which is a short walk to the historical sights, we triple shared and the room was quite large enough, the towels were large and thick and changed daily unlike some hotels of this classification, the trams are 1 minutes walk away so getting around the larger Istanbul is easy.
