Breakfast was good for Turkey and the evening meal was quite adequate both with a lovely view of aya sophia and the blue mosque thrown in free of charge. we stayed 3 nights and paid cash which made it cheaper as we booked online and we also received a half price voucher for dinner one night, all a saving for those who are on a budget. the atrium is very pleasant and we had no trouble getting coffee or tea served there unlike one other trip advisor complaint, we just asked!

Reviews.Title: “Overall, the most memorable hotel ive stayed in”
Reviews.Author: marcovanbatty
Reviews.Content: ......out of the 40 or so hotels ive stayed at throughout europe, this was my favourite. Ok, the room was nothing special at all. Fairly small with a tiny tv......but when you have views across the blue mosque and hagia sophia who wants a tv. The views were breathtaking. In the morning we had our breakfast looking out over the city - wonderful !!! In the evening I took a book up onto the terrace (ask them to open it up if it is shut --- they will do it for you, no problem !!) and took in the city. The breakfast was excellent..a fantastic array of meats, cheeses, cereals, hot and cold foods..... The staff were top class too - -- -very friendly and helpful. Also the location is excellent as it very near to the key sights. If you have just a few days in istanbul you need to be on this side of the river and this hotel has a very good spot. Oh...and the hotel has feee internet access too !! any Q's buddylove447@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “our stay at nenaÂ´s hotel in istambul”
Reviews.Author: ODRIOZOLA
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice and friendly small hotel . It is very well located near the Blue Mosque , the St. Sofia and the cisterne

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Jane34x
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect location for a romantic, sightseeing break. Situated in a quiet side road, just off the main street leading down to the two mosques , Yerebatan Sarnici (cisterns) and Topkapi Palace and up to the Grand Bazaar, these main attractions were within easy walking distance. From our room we looked out over the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, and Topkapi Palace. We upgraded to be able to get this room, but it was well worth it . At night it was a magical sight, seeing the mosques illuminated and golden seagulls circling in their light. Sitting out on the rooftop restaurant made breakfast a great experience, looking out over the Bosphorous and across to Galata Tower. We ate an evening meal on the same balcony at the hotel , with the same magical views, on the night we arrived and the food was very good. It is a quiet, clean and comfortable hotel. The staff are all very friendly, helpful and very efficent. All in all, a lovely experience and one we will repeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Hotel with an Even Better Staff!”
Reviews.Author: TurtleTurtle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Nena Hotel from May 28-31, 2009. The communication with the hotel prior to our stay was excellent and they had a handy system where you could indicate arrival times for your airport pickup. The location is fabulous, as it is in walking distance to all the sights and near the tram. Oh, and it is near a place that makes amazing baklava! We had a really nice room w/ a balcony on the fourth floor. The room was clean and spacious and the shower had the best water pressure of our entire Greece and Turkey trip. That alone was almost worth it. The balcony was big and the view of the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia was quite lovely. The breakfast was a good deal and the restaurant staff was very friendly. They also had a free computer to use in the lobby area along with wireless internet access. The best part of the stay was the incredibly friendly and helpful staff. Thanks for the great conversations! We didn't catch everyone's names, but thank you in particular to Mehmet G., Serkan, and Mehmet. Thanks for everything Hotel Nena!

Reviews.Title: “great location to enjoy the sights of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Henry08_9
Reviews.Content: Friendly hotel with staff always pleased to assist. We had a room overlooking the Blue Mosque and fantastic views. Beds extremely comfortable and lovely crisp linen. Breakfast buffet style with good choice and lovely fresh bread. Would highly recommend and only a couple of minutes walk from tram stop and within easy walking distance of Blue Mosque and palace.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful and friendly staff, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: HaHo100
Reviews.Content: We heartily recommend the Nena hotel for your stay in Istanbul! It is nicely situated in Sultanahmet, close to the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia - in fact from the rooftop restaurant you have a beautiful view on these two landmarks of Istanbul. More importantly, the hotel has outstanding and very friendly staff, extremely helpful in many ways, e.g. advising us on the transport in and around Istanbul, searching information and places on internet. The room service is excellent, it is the place to be to celebrate your birthday - as we found out. Breakfast is very good, not only with respect to the view, but also in the variety and quality of food. The room was kept very clean and tidy by the friendly cleaning ladies. The only negative point I can mention is that the room was relatively small - but no problem, since we were out most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “great location but a few big minuses”
Reviews.Author: jbo72046
Reviews.Content: great location, within very easy stroll of Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern and Aya Sofia as well as the excellent trams. We had a deluxe room (room 401)which was right below the restaurant and our wall was common to the restaurant stairway. As the floors and hallways are uncarpeted our room became extremely noisy from the patrons coming and going. We could also hear every clink of cutlery from breakfast preparation time to end of night and every conversation. Not so good. Our bed was a pile of rocks - the mattress is too thin for the bed base. We walked extensively each day and would wake up aching from our rock bed. There is no individual temperature control so if the hotel is being heated then you can't switch to cooling. Consequently our room was rather hot and uncomfortable. We left our balcony door open as much as possible. As this door was below the restaurant deck it also allowed much more noise into our room and smoke from the interminable smoking machines who stood about on the deck. The staff were very nice and attentive although one got quite snippy with us when we complained about the heat in our room. Still, generally they were of a very high standard. The breakfast is probably more suited to Europeans. We had one yoghurt to choose from. One hot dish of scrambled egg (burnt beyond eating one day and not replaced) and some sausages cooked in a tomato sauce. There were sugary cereals and one mueslie sort of thing. Some sliced orange and grapefruit and fruitsalad. The rest were salads and breads and some cake slices. There is no toast. It's OK but not as advertised in their publicity. The rooms are probably about the normal size for this kind of hotel, our deluxe room was reasonable and we could move around without bumping into each other but the furnishings are very old , tired and shabby. The stupid bedhead has the light switched set into it so when you move your pillow it turns the lights on and off, a real nuisance. And the TV is a tiny old set, too small to watch from the bed and very poor sound quality. We were out of our room each day all day sightseeing but we didn't look forward to returning each day. It was really just "somewhere to stay" not a pleasurable place to spend time.

Reviews.Title: “the best holiday i have ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: adrianoz
Reviews.Content: although the flight has been delayed nearly an hour, the hotel driver was still waiting for us in front of the exit gate with his smiley face. after having a little city tour, i and my girlfriend reached the hotel. the staff behaved very friendly to us; while we were waiting for our room, they offered us hot drinks. our room was big enough for 2 people and it was really clean. besides, location was the most attractive feature of the hotel. we could reach almost every historical place in a few minutes by walking. i strongly recommend who wants to stay here to taste turkish cuisine in the roof along with the charming view. overall; the room, staff, food, location was great. it is highly recommended. i am very thankful the staff who makes me feel valuable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Functional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dawebell
Reviews.Content: We just stayed there for 4 days. This place is great value for money, is very central, and provides a decent breakfast in the morning. Also, If you stay over 3 days you get a free taxi to and from the airport. My one small complaint was that the walls are very thin (or maybe my neighbour was just VERY loud..!!) Maybe the extra money for the deluxe room might have been worth it ??!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE and PERFECT LOCATION!!”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel8687
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at Hotel Nena for 5 nights and were very pleased with our stay. The location was absolutely perfect, about a 3 minute walk to the Aya Sofya and Blue Mosque. When we got to the hotel they offered us tea and coffee and we were able to use the free internet in the lobby while waiting for our room. There is also free high speed wireless. We also received free transport to and from the airport and the driver was there waiting to pick us up at the arrivals area. The breakfast was nice- very large buffet- with bread, cheese, fresh fruit, eggs, ham, etc. Our room was always kept very clean and replinished with towels every day. The room itself was small but this is expected for any hotel in the area. The bed was very comfortable as well as the temperature of the room. There was also plenty of hot water. The staff was very friendly, we were always greeted with a smile when we came back from a long day and they helped us plan day excursions. However. I wouldn't recommend the day trip to Bursa. Overall we had a great epxerience and would recommend this hotel to anyone and will certaintly stay here again when we return to Istanbul. Liked the most: Location, staff, breakfast, value, airport transfer Least: our room didn't have a great view- but I'm sure you can request a better view because the terrace where we had breakfast has a perfect view of the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nena, loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: KoLantaKaz
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a gem! Truly friendly and helpful staff. Clean and comfortable rooms. Perfect location for sight seeing. Breakfast was amazing, with views over the Blue Mosque and the sea. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to everyone. We cannot fault it in any way. During our 3 night visit, we visited 9 out of 10 of the recommended top tourist attractions! Probably only possible due to the location and ease of transportation around Istanbul. Istanbul surprised us with it's friendliness and cleanliness. Everyone was really helpful, courteous and often a little cheeky!! Our room was on the fourth floor with wonderful views from our balcony. The traffic noise never bothered us at all. We didn't notice any!! Thanks for our Mum's special birthday breakfast. XX

Reviews.Title: “central, friendly - even sent lost items to me for free”
Reviews.Author: kasias_travel_bunny
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nena is located at the very centre of the old part of istanbul. The staff is very helpfull and not pushy at all. They know good places to eat and help you in avoiding tourist traps (there are plenty of them). The room was clean and confortable. Nice place!

Reviews.Title: “we had a very pleasant stay at nena”
Reviews.Author: linaAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay in Nena with a very kind staff who helped us with discover Istanbul. The breakfast on the roof was very good with a marvelous view of the moskee and the bospurus. The rooms where a little bit small but clean. We enjoied the stay very much and we are coming again to nena, wich was situated in the middle of all the history in istanbul. thanks, ines and judie

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: lismore_lass
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a long weekend at the Hotel Nena.The location of the hotel was amazing, just near all the major sites. We were upgraded to a room with a view of the Blue Mosque, which was a nice surprise. And the staff were so friendly, but not in a overbearing, pushy way. It was quite a small hotel, so had an intimate feel. They also had a fantastic offer on at their restaurant - 50% off food for one night. The restaurant had a view of the Blue Mosque, which looks amazing at night. As we were there in winter, Istanbul was very quiet in general. So we were the only people in the restaurant. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel. It was incrediable value for money, clean, friendly and in an ideal location for all the sights of the old town. It was also quite quiet. And there is an amazing baklava store nearby!

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul: Lovely Stay in Hotel Nena / Istanbul, Turkey”
Reviews.Author: ViennaNikita
Reviews.Content: We looked for a nice good standard Hotel in Istanbul for a international Business Meeting and found it on www.venere.com : Hotel Nena. - Perfect and fast communication and booking - perfect english. - Very supporting and helpful staff . Transfer from and to airport included in prices. - We paid 40. -Euros per single room / which was in fact double bed rooms. - Very clean, nicely arranged rooms. Location of Hotel perfect - as you can reach all important places like Grand Bazar, Hagia Sofia. Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace within some minutes and have a nice walk there. - Breakfast Buffet was nice - could need some more creativity and bit more international standard - but the wonderful view from the restaurant over all Istanbul compensated this small missing detail. Another point to be mentioned is - and we are sure that the hotel management will and could change and adapt this soonest : to adapt to handicapped needs. One delegation member was wheelchair driver - stairs of entrance to hotel and up to restaurant from 4th to 5th floor didnt allow him to enter. By friendly and warm support of staff members we could carry him - but to meet international standards this is a point which should be changed. - In general we all felt as being at home - enjoyed our stay - and can really recommend this nice hotel with its friendly staff ! - We will come back for sure to stay there. .

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: georges12
Reviews.Content: I would strongly recommend thÄ±s hotel to anyone who wants to vÄ±sÄ±t Ä±stambul.The hotel Ä±s comfortable and Ä±s Ä±deally located to places of Ä±nterest.Mr.Mehmet Ä±s a very frÄ±endly and helpful guy.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: VoyageOn
Reviews.Content: The Nena Hotel is a modest but comfortable one, conveniently located near the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia and the Grand Bazaar. The staff were very friendly and helpful in booking tours if needed. The breakfast room on the top floor has a fabulous view of the water. I enjoyed sitting in the lounge just off the lobby which was a great place to relax and chat with others after a long day of sight seeing. There is also a covered courtyard off the back and I would recommend a room over this area if you want total quiet. Internet is also available in the lounge. Free transport to the airport is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: littlereddevilag
Reviews.Content: Great location but oh my we must have had the worst room in the hotel. There was no a/c and the room was too hot. There was no window to open for fresh air and no view either. It was like sleeping in a cupboard ! Breakfast was ok.

Reviews.Title: “A small and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: ninquisitive
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very conveniently located not far from the main tram line and within short walking distance from Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar. Breakfest area very comfortable with a good view and good range of choices. Staff very friendly and helpful. Bed clean and comfortable. Reasonable rate and good discount for a basic room which is small but sufficient. Found the free transport from airport to hotel very efficient. For light sleepers, might notice some traffic noise as it is about 70 metres into a side stree from the busy road. Ask for a quiet room if there is one. For most people, it should not be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Magic Carpet”
Reviews.Author: ricecj2000
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nena was a nice little hotel in heart of Istanbul old town. This was out first time to Istanbul so we came into it a little blind, but we fell on our feet with this hotel. If you are only in Istanbul for a couple of days I would recommend this hotel as its location allows you to walk to all the main attractions and the trendy shops over the Galta bridge. Things I liked about the hotels are -Location -Price -Complimentary breakfast -Friendly staff -View from the top floor Things that I think could be improved -Noise level -Temperature control (hotel was very hot) -Rooms are adequate but a little small and ours didn't have a great view For the price this is a very good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Culture at the Nena”
Reviews.Author: NaurangP
Reviews.Content: ProÂ´s: 1. Very good locatÄ±on 2. Staff Ä±s more than polÄ±te 3. Excellent vÄ±ew form the terrace restaurant ConÂ´s: 1. Rooms at the 4th floor very noÄ±sy because the elevator stops at 4th floor and everybody has to walk the staÄ±rs to go to the restaurant 2. The aÄ±rcondÄ±tÄ±on only gave warm aÄ±r. As the hotel was already quÄ±te warm there was no possÄ±bÄ±lÄ±ty to cool the room thus we had sleepÄ±ng problems 3. Wet area could be cleaner

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Basel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Nena hotel for 7 nights. The hotel was so nice, clean and well organized. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast room was amazing, nice view and excellent food. The location is the best, very close to the historical places of Istanbul, and just in front of the metro station. If I will visit Istanbul again, I will stay in Nena for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-great location and great price”
Reviews.Author: 59FOREVER
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel at a great price. The staff are fantastic, they really mean 'if you are happy - we are happy". Decent buffet breakfast with good coffee and a terrific view over the Blue Mosque. The 'sea bass' I had for dinner was excellent. My room had everything but a kettle which would be the only thing I would of liked as I like a tea in the evening. Clean and comfortable. The staff are happy to make tea or coffee after spending a long day out. There is a computer in the lounge and free internet so I was able to catch up on the Canadian News but I was unable to access my yahoo e-mail, same problem in Poland so it wasn't the computer. Annette Code, Pitt Meadows, B.C. Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great value, wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: teena1014
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Nena for 7 nights at the end of November. I booked the hotel on their own website and received two discounts...one for booking early and another for paying cash. The value was outstanding as the booking also included airport transfers (to and from) and a fantastic breakfast every morning. The rooms were a little small, but typical for a European room. Everything was very clean and well taken care of. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I cannot say enough great things about the breakfast. The food and selection was wonderful...a great start to our day. We also received a 50% off coupon for dinner at the hotel and we used it on a rainy night. The dinner was also excellent. The hotel location was perfect...close to everything. The lobby and garden areas were very relaxing. We sat every night after a long day of sightseeing and had Raki in the (enclosed) garden area. The only negative (and it is very slight) is that the wireless internet did not work in our room and we had to use the wireless in the lobby. Not a big deal! (They also have a computer that guests can use with free internet access.) I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nena is Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Ballard55
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nena is the perfect place to stay in Istanbul. It is within a 2 minute walk from both St. Sophia's and the Blue Mosque. The view of the Blue Mosque from the Hotel Nena is superb. Ask to stay in room 401, which has a large balcony overlooking the sea and all the sights, including the Blue Mosque. The hotel staff was wonderful and helpful in every way. I will always stay at the Hotel Nena in the future.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Car0linian
Reviews.Content: I spent two weeks at the Nena hotel and was there to study Turkish language. I had been to Istanbul before so I knew it would be conveniently located to all tourist sites. It is, and tram stop a few steps from the door which gives you access to all of the city's breathtaking treasures. The hotel is spotless and has all amenities. Rooms are on the small side but are comfortable and fully equipped. Rooftop restaurant where breakfast is served has a STUNNING view of Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque. The absolute best feature of this hotel is the staff's exemplary attention to the guests needs, going beyond the call and basically creating an unpretentious 'home away from home' environment. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to feel comfortable and 'looked after' and not to pay a 5-star price for that privilige.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: tibblesb
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at Hotel Nena. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were quite small but very clean and overall it was very good value for money - we booked early and so got a discount, with airport transfers (in a private car) and breakfast (excellent selection) thrown in.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Nena”
Reviews.Author: snorgerator
Reviews.Content: Loved the Nena. Just as described. Perfect for Americans. No problems being understood. We booked an airport pickup - no problem. Our wish was their command. Booking transfers to our cruise ship, tours, mailing postcards. Anything! Personable. Efficient. Professional. Great location, but a little farther from locations than advertised.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay”
Reviews.Author: bumskiaz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with another couple stayed at the Nena Hotel after our Eastern Med cruise. I had made all of the reservations directly with the hotel. When we arrived, the entire hotel staff could not have been nicer. I believe that since I had made both reservations, they upgraded my wife and I to a suite which had a balcony overlooking the Haggia Sofia and the Blue Mosque. What a thrilling sight at night. Our travelling companions were next door in a smaller room, but the staff was very gracious in allowing them to move into our room after our departure.(They were staying two additional nights.) The location of the Nena Hotel was outstanding. We could easily walk to almost all of the attractions wihtin Sultanhamet. Walking time would never exceed 10 minutes(unless you stopped to shop along the way). Overall, a very pleasant experience. We would not hesitate to stay at the Nena Hotel should we visit Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: GloriaJC
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Hotel Nena and were very pleased with our choice. The hotel is located very close to the sights of the Sultanahmet (Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, the Underground Cistern and the Grand Bazaar). It is also very close to the tram line. If you ride the tram to the end of the line and then walk about a block you can visit the Dolmbahce Palace. On your return, after you cross the bridge, you can get off and get a boat for the cruise up the Bosphorus and across the street visit the Spice Bazaar. The hotel upgraded our room to a triple when we arrived. It was large, clean, and had a small balcony. The decor is nothing to rave about , but the beds were comfortable and the room nicely kept. The staff especially make the stay very special. We had a suitcase damaged on our flight to Istanbul and the staff assisted us in contacting the airline. We were picked up and returned to the Ataturk Airport free of charge. We had dinner in the rooftop terrace the night we arrived and the food was very good.The view of the Blue Mosque, lit up at night ,was beautiful from the terrace. At breakfast, there was a wide variety of choices and they were well prepared. There was free internet service, an enclosed garden terrace off the lobby, and reception had free safety deposit boxes available for their guests. We would definitely stay at the Hotel Nena if we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “LOve the terrace view”
Reviews.Author: nhliza
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with free arrival airport transfer. Very good double room with fresh smell. Daily fresh towel supplied. View from the room is not crucial as the terrace restaurant has the astonishing view of the mosque and hagia sophia-breathtaking. Anyway you will spend most of your time away from the hotel sightseeing. All within walking distance. Tramway is 1 minute walk. Breakfast is really good but lack of choice over our 3 day stay. Staff were all polite especially the concierge Mr Mehmet. I would strongly suggest to the hotel to provide two way free airport transfer to ALL guests regardless duration of stay because this would make your service 6 star. My wife and I will definitely come back to the hotel next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the money...”
Reviews.Author: kelly14Milwaukee_WI
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel in Istanbul that was conveniently located to the historic sites, clean and comfortable for a reasonable price and this hotel met all of those qualifications. Very good value. In addition, the staff was great! From finding a last minute guide to offering honest advice, the staff went out of their way to help make our stay pleasant. This is not a fancy hotel, but it is clean, the beds are comfortable and the location is great! There is a nice garden terrace/dining area that is really nice for relaxing with a beverage at the end of the day and the lobby itself is lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location, hotel experience could have been better”
Reviews.Author: manarch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Nena for 9 days in September. For the price we felt it is an average hotel in an excellent location (Sultanahmet), and were a little disappointed. However, this could be because we had just come from Santorini where we stayed in an excellent apartment (Enigma Apartments), and Athens where we stayed in a great hotel (Hotel Parthenon), and the building next door to the Nena in Istanbul was a construction site (it was being renovated). The rooms were at the â€œbudgetâ€� end of the range, were on the 1st floor just above reception area, were a bit of a squeeze for 2 people, and without tea/coffee and ironing facilities. The bathroom in our room was small and had small areas of mould in some places in the shower cubicle, but had a great shower height which is important for tall people who get sick of having to bend over to shower in hotel rooms. The corridors on each floor are marble lined without carpet on the floor so any voices above normal quiet conversation level echo very loudly, particularly late at night. Also, unfortunately for us, the building next door was being renovated so there was a lot of drilling and jack-hammering noise both during the day and well into the evening. For those like us who like to race around until mid-afternoon sight-seeing, and go back to the hotel for a siesta before taking off for the evening/night meal and entertainment, this was pretty well out of the question. Having said this, the reception staff were excellent - always helpful, pleasant, and courteous, and they provide internet access for free. We had pre-arranged airport transfers through the hotel which were prompt and well worth it. The Roof Terrace breakfast/dining area has views of the Sea of Marmara and the Blue Mosque to rival any hotel in the area, and the breakfast buffet (included in our room price) had a great range of both cold and hot foods. Breakfast on the terrace every morning was a great treat, and the location of the hotel is an absolute winner. Istanbul is absolutely mental, and for those who havenâ€™t been there itâ€™s a â€œMust Doâ€� for your travel list. The people are friendly (particularly as most of them are trying to sell you something), although the younger men seem to have a bad tendency of standing uncomfortably close to western women, and take opportunities for the odd grope in big packed crowds when they think they wonâ€™t be caught. All in all the location of the Nena is its strong point, an absolute winner â€“ very close to the tramway on the main street (which is part of an excellent and cheap public transport system) and within walking distance of all the major historical sights within the Eminonu/Sultanahmet/Bazaar districts. Would we go back to Istanbul? Absolutely. Would we go during Ramadan? Absolutely. Would we stay in Hotel Nena? Maybe, maybe not. Weâ€™d probably give it another try or think about trying a different hotel in the same area - it'd be a toss of the coin at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Nena especially the staff”
Reviews.Author: Ness39
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate to stay at the Hotel Nena which is fantastically situated close to all the main sites in Istanbul. The hotel itself was very nice and the view from the restaurant awesome. What made my stay were the staff, they were friendly and exceptionally helpful. The general manager, Muzaffer, did everything he could to assist me with an incident that happened at another hotel. Mehmet the man who greeted you at reception was also a great help and support. I would highly recommend this hotel because of the great staff who work there. I trust they will keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend Nena Hotel for your next stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Turkishdelights08
Reviews.Content: Nena Hotel in Istanbul - highly recommended Reviewed entered- October 2008 My friends and I first stayed at Nena hotel in 2007 and were impressed with the level of service and comfort offered. So much so that we actively went out of our way to book it again when we made plans to travel back to Istanbul in 2008. The hotel is well positioned and central to a lot of the local attractions in Sultanahmet. The staff were very friendly and made sure we were well looked after. We particularly appreciated the warm welcome of the staff during breakfast. The rooms are really well equipped and clean. The hotel also offers a range of early payment options and rewards cash payment with a discount. It was great to know that we would be eligable for the discount from point of booking even though we did not have to pay the bill until the day of check out. I would highly recommend it and will definitely book Nena Hotel again in future.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Nena”
Reviews.Author: Zoyenka
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Nena for five nights in late September 2008. I am a single woman in her 50s. I found the location superb, public transportation easily accessible and the staff charming and gracious. Rooms were clean, spare, no frills, but comfortable. Hotel decor is charming, with a lovely garden bar on the ground floor and rooftop terrace. Rooftop bar/breakfast room has an outstanding view of Aya Sofia, the Blue Mosque and the Sea of Marmara. Can't think of a single negative to say. Staff came to know me during my visit, and were polite, friendly, accommodating, made dinner reservations at my request, and spoke excellent English. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: LGA23
Reviews.Content: In some ways, I feel like staying at the Hotel Nena was the first time TripAdvisor has let me down. On the one hand, the hotel location and view from the rooftop restaurant was fantastic as described. On the other hand, the hotel room itself was a little disappointing. This hotel is an Istanbul Top 10 on TripAdvisor so it may be that I had higher expectations (for hotels in Istanbul) than I should have. My review is colored by the double room we were in the first night. My husband described it as a "dank hole" and it prompted me to frantically search availability at the Istanbul Four Seasons - no matter the cost! It was terribly small with almost no light from the outside (or inside for that matter). The bath/shower was very rusty/unkept looking and I was afraid to look too closely. To the hotel's credit, we were moved to a different, triple room for the following 2 nights, which was much better size and light-wise, although still very basic. For example, I could feel the springs in what was a not-very-comfortable bed. The service was, on the whole, quite good. The staff was very friendly and helpful. In the final analysis, I think I should have searched harder to find the great location/view + a better room with a little more style, luxury and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Big_Bird_Dubai
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and the rooms comfortably appointed and recently refurbed. Superb location, with a tram stop 2 minutes walk away. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BillStickers_7
Reviews.Content: The good: Friendly, efficient and helpful staff. Front desk man speaks English very well. Very nice breakfast. Clean lobby, clean restaurant and mostly clean room. Safe neighborhood. Center of tourist district. Directly on trolley line. Double-paned windows block much of outside noise (at least from rooms at the back of the hotel â€“ not sure about the front). Free internet access, both WiFi and on PC in lobby. Driver from airport perfectly punctual, met us with clear and obvious sign, patient as we stood in line for cash machine. The bad: Moldy shower grout and claulking. Very small room made smaller by 12-inch square pillar shooting up in one of the few open areas. Rather beat up furniture in room. Central AC runs constantly in summer creating continuous white noise at night. Very thin interior walls so voices neighboring guests can be heard fairly clearly. A very aggressive carpet seller sets up his business on the sidewalk across the street from the hotel every morning. He watches for guests as they come and go from the front door, calling out to them day after day. Very annoying. The unexpected: Airport shuttle is free only when you book directly with hotel, not on Expedia or other web site. This is common to most, perhaps all, other hotels in the area. Beautiful view from the rooftop terrace dining area â€¦ but only three tables so youâ€™ll be lucky to sit outside and enjoy the view at breakfast. Beautiful view of the Blue Mosque, Marmara Sea, and Sultanahmet district from the rooftop terrace, but the view of Haggia Sophia is partially blocked by another building.

Reviews.Title: “The wonderful Hotel Nena”
Reviews.Author: Micheljane
Reviews.Content: Ah, the Hotel Nena, Istanbul. Just left yesterday and thought that I would review it today while the scenes of Istanbul are still fresh in my mind. This is our second time to Istanbul and the Hotel Nena and it was every bit as wonderful as our stay in May of 2007, in fact, even better. I booked our stay directly with the Hotel which was perfect. That URL is www.istanbulhotelnena.com. When we arrived for our first three night stay, we were told that since we had been there before that they were upgrading our room to the fourth floor and that we would be overlooking the Blue Mosque! Wonderful as the rooms are much larger on that floor. When we traveled to other parts of Turkey then returned for our last night stay, we were given a fourth floor room as well. I cannot say enough about how wonderful the staff are, the amazing location, the price, the pick up and drop off at the airport and how smoothly it all went. I only hope that we will be back in that area of the world and again stay at the Nena. Yesterday morning we were sitting at breakfast, enjoying coffee and gazing at the Blue Mosque. It was amazing........................................Thank you Hotel Nena staff. You were wonderful to us.

Reviews.Title: “Best reception staff i nTurkey!”
Reviews.Author: sazza60
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay here and like other reviwers found the situation excellent for the sites. The rooms were on the small side, but perfectly adequate. Free internet and great breakfast looking out at the mosques. The recepion staff were very friendly and helpful, although very bemused by my request for a gin and tonic, none available at the bar, so we tried a martini and lemonade- their lemonade is fresh lemons, so it was a new experience! We had a laugh as we sat in the lovely conservatory area at the back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nena - an absolute joy”
Reviews.Author: TRNC4ever
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 nights at this wonderful hotel (Aug 2008). Its location is spot-on if you wish to be based in historic Sultanahmet, with the Agia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, the Grand Bazaar and all the other landmarks of Istanbul just 'around the corner'. If you want to travel a little further, the local tram is 2 minutes away ....and excellent value too. We booked thru the internet and communication with the hotel was superb. They arranged to pick us up from the airport and drop us off as well (no charge) and the hotel has everything you would need - safe deposit box (no charge), internet 24x7 in TV area (again no charge), staff who are very friendly and helpful, rooms were clean and spotless, breakfast an absolute joy (and the views from the terrace as I sipped my umpteenth tea ..... wow ! ) All in all, we had a fabulous stay and would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nena for us”
Reviews.Author: Neilio99
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Istanbul on 8 previous occcasions Hotel Nena is the most wonderful hotel we have stayed in. It is so close to the mosques, the grand bazaar, restaurants, the train, etc. It is a quiet location considering it is a city with millions of people We would certainly stay there the next time in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: Tar23
Reviews.Content: In a spur of the moment decision, it was my wifes birthday, we went to Istanbul, just for four days. I had researched the net and came up with the Nena Hotel, what a great find. In a nutshell, it's a three star hotel with a five star staff, the rooms are small but ample, very clean, at night it was quiet, we even turned the AC off and it stayed cool, we were on the 2rd Fl front. The roof terrace was a joy, the view wonderful, breakfast fresh and more than ample. We asked the desk about a good fish restaurant, they suggested one called Kalamar, which sent a car, [ free ] the fish was very very good, not cheap, if you go ask the waiter the prices first and don't order more than one or two starters, the hotel desk without telling us ordered a small birthday cake with musicians playing, it was a wonderful experience. We originally lived in New York but now live in Provence, we have traveled most of our lives and hotels like the Nena don't pop up everyday. Neil & Pam

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: jadelauren87
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Nena for four nights and were extremely happy with the hotel and the service we received from the staff whilst we were there. The location is the biggest plus for this hotel. It is central to the Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque (about 5 minutes on foot in one direction) and again about 5 minutes on foot in the other direction to the Grand Bazaar! Very hard to get lost when you are so close. The hotel is lovely, a garden terrace at the rear which is fully enclosed and a breathtaking view of the Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque and Marmara Sea from the breakfast room at the top floor. Breakfast was included on our stay and is a variety of Â´Turkish treats and western foods with a selection of cheeses and fruits also. Staff are excellent and helped us arrange a tour to Gallipoli and dinner at the Orient House. Our room was an average size, bathroom was well maintained and clean. Would definately recommend to anyone going to Istanbul!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: akabeli
Reviews.Content: The hotel is charming,the rooms very well equiped, It is extremly well located and the team is by far the most efficient, caring and lovely I have seen since a while. And I am a frequent traveller.... The breakfast on the top terrasse offer a great view on what you must see in Istanbul... A great recommandation... Ask Muzaffer Sahin the manager he is very kind.

Reviews.Title: “A little Gem in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Davwend
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice, once after a cruise and once after a tour of Turkey and both times were treated beautifully. We booked the hotel through their secure internet site and had instant, secure booking confirmations to take with us. Transfers were included both from the cruise terminal and to the Hotel Conrad on Beyoglu side. The breakfasts were beautiful with lovely fresh fruit salad and strawberries, lovely breads and scones, scrambled eggs or omelet and the traditional european breakfasts of cheeses, meats, as well as some lovely Turkish offerings. We also had dinner in the hotel and b/c we had booked online had a 50% discount for dinner for 4 of us. Lovely dinner and polite and efficient service. Our room was at the front on the top floor and overlooked the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. The only thing that we could possibly say that was annoying about this room, was when people were dining on the balcony above us, the chairs scraping on the floor would set your teeth on edge and we told management that it would be great if they could put something on the chairs to stop the noise and they said they would. The reception staff were so friendly and helpful as were the porters and breakfast staff. We would highly recommend this small boutique hotel to anyone staying in Istanbul. It is so convenient for exploring Sultahnamet, within walking distance of Grand Bazaar, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern and lots of good restaurants on Divan Yolu the main street where the trams also run to the other side.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: violacottage
Reviews.Content: We were picked up at the airport right on time and delivered to the Nena Hotel. The staff is attentive, the location is excellent, the breakfast has a good variety, and the lounge areas are comfortable. We couldn't have asked for a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in the perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: HawkeyeCruisr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nena for 4 nights pre-cruise and just loved the Nena! This is a lovely little boutique hotel centrally located in the Sultanahmet district of Istanbul. Itâ€™s easy walking distance to all the famous sites in the area and there are a lot of small restaurants nearby. We had asked for a â€œtripleâ€� room on an upper floor and it was quite large, especially by European standards. We had plenty of room to lay out our suitcases on the floor without them being in the way. There was a small wardrobe unit for hanging clothes, but very little drawer storage for folded clothes. The bathroom was small but nicely done with newer tile, a good sized tub/shower and the only wall-hung hair dryer I have ever used that puts out enough heat and power to do a good job. We loved the wonderfully thick Turkish towels, too. Our room also had a small balcony but we never used it because the view was of other buildings. We were in the back of the hotel; had our room faced the other direction, we would probably have had a nice view of the Bosphorus and Sutlanahmet sites. Still, it was nice to have all the light that came through the balcony door. The ground floor of the hotel has a nice sized lobby with big tables and chairs, the front desk, a back room with a small bar, a TV and several couches, a desk with a computer and the free internet access. Behind this is an enclosed â€œgardenâ€� area with tables and chairs and greenhouse-like windows and roof - the perfect place to relax with a glass of wine. The top floor of the hotel has a â€œrooftop restaurantâ€�; seating inside and out on a balcony overlooking the Sultanahmet and the Bosphorus. Here they serve a great breakfast, included in the room rate. They had scrambled eggs, potatoes, sausages along with fresh fruit, cereal and cold items that have a distinctly Turkish slant: feta cheese, olives and other savory items youâ€™d expect at dinner instead of breakfast. We also ate dinner two nights up there on the balcony just to see the magically lit Sultanahmet buildings. One of the best things about the Nena is the staff. They are so helpful and friendly that it made the entire visit a real pleasure. And the free airport or port pickup and drop-off are a real plus. After being in Istanbul 4 days, we realized that the Nena staff's attitude is typical of the warm hospitality of Turkish people.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel !”
Reviews.Author: love5pets
Reviews.Content: Based on the excellent review on Tripadvisor we decided to book Nena Hotel in Istanbul. It was a great experience and I'd highly recommend it to others. We were in room #405 which is a deluxe room with a balcony. Since we were staying 4 nights they picked us up and delivered us back to the airport which was such a plus. Our stay included breakfast on the rooftop terrace each morning. We also ate dinner there once and it too was excellent. The views from the rooftop terrace restaurant are magnificent, especially at night. The entire staff was wonderful and went out of their way to make sure we had a nice stay. The morning we left Istanbul we had a very early flight. The staff got up and made us coffee and packed sandwiches to take with us since we had to leave the hotel at 5:30am. How nice was that!! The Nena Hotel is in the best location possible. It is just a stone's throw from the tram stop and located just a 2-3 minute walk from all the historical sites. If you want to see pictures, this is their website: http://www.istanbulhotelnena.com/ We loved Istanbul and want to return. We would definitely stay here again in the same deluxe room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect small hotel in Istanbul, with location and view to die for”
Reviews.Author: chris32137
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at Nena. The location is absolutely perfect. Short walking distance from major historical sites, good restaurants and the tram line. Hotel is attractive and understated, but warm and inviting. Lobby would remind you a little of Paris. Staff was both competent and friendly. The room was just fine and the view out of our room, overlooking the Blue Mosque, was to die for. (Recommend requesting the deluxe room, with balcony and view. Not much more.) Our rate included airport transfers and breakfast and, all things considered, was a bargain. You can get a discount for early booking AND for cash payment. Highly recommended for people who like small hotels with atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nena: Above the rest”
Reviews.Author: RoadLady44
Reviews.Content: On my first trip to Turkey, a friend and I decided to go to Istanbul a few days early and found the Hotel Nena website. We had a great time. The hotel offers airport pickup with a driver who is quite above the average taxi you might take from the airport. The rooms were very comfortable and the food served at the hotel was delicious. Many hotels in Istanbul offer poor breakfasts of Tang and tired food. (We had this at the group hotel.) The Hotel Nena offered fresh orange juice, strawberries, melon and other healthy and fresh food. The restaurant terrace is above the Blue Mosque, the hotel is convenient to the tram line, there is a lovely garden area to relax and the personnel at the hotel were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nena is a delight”
Reviews.Author: oldebrit
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed two nights, prior to our cruise , at this delightful hotel. It was wonderful to have their car to meet us at the airport after a long flight. The hotel location is perfect and within walking distance of most of the famous Istanbul sights. The included breakfast in their restaurant overlooking Istanbul was a real treat and after touring Istanbul all day, having a drink in their cool, marble patio, filled with greenery was bliss. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who seeks a quiet, convenient hotel with helpful staff at a most reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel along with Outstanding Views”
Reviews.Author: LoveTravel1155
Reviews.Content: Even though I had read good reviews on Trip Advisor about the Hotel Nena, I was skeptical. Within minutes after we arrived, that changed! What a perfectly delightful hotel. We were lucky to have gotten a room on the 4th floor facing the Blue Mosque, so along with our very comfortable accommodations, we had the most amazing view and a little balcony as well. The rooftop dining room has the same view as we had from our room, and they serve a good breakfast. We had an excellent dinner -- reasonably priced -- one night in the rooftop restaurant; a good choice and they provided a discount on the food portion of the bill since we were staying in the hotel. The restaurant service is slow, but very hospitable. We weren't in any hurry to rush through our meals, so the slow service gave us an opportunity to enjoy the view and each other more. The patio area on the main floor is delightful, but we didn't have much time to enjoy it. The hotel is in a very convenient location as well. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ZedIndia
Reviews.Content: The Nena Hotel in Sultanahmet is a great place to stay. We were picked up at the airport by their courteous driver. As they had a few vacancies, we were upgraded to a sea facing room with balcony that had amazing views of the Blue Mosque, Sophia Hagia, the Bosphorus and Sea of Marmara. The hotel has a desk with a computer for free internet access to check your e-mail, and if you have a laptop, they have free WiFi internet access. Nena Hotel is clean with good rooms and bathrooms and I would recommend this place. It is within walking distance to all the attractions. I suggest that visitors do not book with any tour agency, but do all the sightseeing themselves as its much cheaper and more fun that way. The hotel will give a free map of the attractions to visit and a map of the tram line. Do buy an AKBIL billet/ticket from the tarm station near thehotel so that one can have cheap unlimited travel to the attractions. Places that you must visit are the Blue Mosque, Sophia Hagia, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, and a 1.5 hr Bosphorus Cruise. The Whirling dervishes show is not particularly exciting. There are ample inexpensive restaurants serving tasty food all over. Istanbul is a MUST VISIT destination and the NENA Hotel would be the right place to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Good location but not 4*”
Reviews.Author: ajax64
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Nena in May, with some friends. We booked in advance and got the discounts. The hotel is in a very good location for all the sights and there are number of restaurants nearby as well. The staff were very friendly and helpful. It is clean and safe. The breakfast was good, but they kept running out of some things quite early on. However the view from the terrace restaurant was very good. We did not have dinner at the hotel so cannot vouch for the quality of the food in the evening but did witness other people having dinner.The meze seemed to contain the same items that we had for breakfast. However for the price I was disappointed as the room was quite small and dated in decoration. The bathroom was also quite small and we had to put out toiletry bags in the room. Only one iron for the whole hotel The location was good with very all sites and also very near the tram line. I am not sure what the prices are like in Istanbul for hotels so can't compare but I would research a bit more for other hotels. otherwise it is a good backup, with free internet. Istanbul is a great place, we went to 360 restaurant and had a very good experience overall. Good views but if you want to sit outside you have to book early.

Reviews.Title: “Nena highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: mvbma
Reviews.Content: Nena is a small hotel in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul, with an unbeatable location and excellent service. My wife and I stayed in one of the deluxe rooms on the top floor, with rooftop views over the city towards the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. The English-speaking staff seem highly motivated and quite flexible with arrangements. The included breakfast is also excellent. The only negative was noisy construction in an adjacent building, during the day. Hopefully this project will come to an end!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely worthwhile!”
Reviews.Author: MusikBrazil
Reviews.Content: From the very first moment, the airport transfer, the warm welcome, the polite staff, clean and comfortable room, and the food at the 4th floor restaurant, everything was excellent at the Nena. At walking distances to 80% of everything a tourist must see in Istanbul, and the best view in town, the Nena is certainly a top recommendation. Plan ahead and take advantage of the discounts they offer for early reservations and payments in cash.

Reviews.Title: “The Nena continues to please as a best buy in busy Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Sam&Peggy
Reviews.Content: The Nena lived up to its reputation as an accommodating friendly, modest hotel steps from most of the city's major historic landmarks, As promised, we were greeted at the airport by a driver, though the plane was early (thankyou Turkish Airlines.). And when we arrived mid morning at the hotel, the room was available within minutes: the deluxe, bright and offering a marvelous view of the Blue Mosque and the city. Though the decor was dated, and the lighting for reading in bed poor, (our only criticism) the bed itself was quite firm and comfortable, and the room was spotless. As for breakfeasts, they were ample, self service on the top floor, which also presented dramatic views. The staff to the person was courteous and helpful, making reservations when requested, including for the popular 360 restaurant in the Beyoglu district. Easy to get there by tram, a block or so from the hotel. Incidentally, the public transportation was excellent, and preferable to the exhorting taxis. Also steps away from the hotel are a selection of Turkish baths, the perfect antidote to jet lag. We prefered the Cemberlitas hamami to the over hyped Cagaloglu. Suggestion: if you book your room through the hotel for a minimum of three days the shuttle service to and from the airport is a courtesy , though tips of course are appreciated . Also, the hotel offers generous discounts if you book early, for extended stays, and pay in cash, which we did. We liked the saving, and we also liked the modest Nena. and warmly recommend it to frugal travelers like us who also like small, local hotels. sam&peggy

Reviews.Title: “Nena - highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Zuffy
Reviews.Content: In March 2008 we spent 3 days at this hotel followed by stays at more expensive hotels in Istanbul and around Turkey. In stark contrast to the more snooty hotels, we found the Nena staff to be incredibly friendly and helpful- which was a sheer delight. The location is brilliant for accessing the main attractions in Sultanhamet as well as other areas of Istanbul because of very close proximity to the tram service. The rooms are clean and neat (perfectly adequate) and the interior of the hotel is in excellent condition. We will definitely be recommending the Nena to friends who wish to visit Istanbul. Barry, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay at the hotel Nena”
Reviews.Author: rebeca74
Reviews.Content: Brilliant stay at the hotel Nena even if the short break was nearly spoiled by Turkish Airlines being late by 2 hours and loosing my buggy and the raincoat going with it!! We had transfers arranged with the hotel directly and being a travel agent myself I knew that with such a delay it could be perfectly possible that the driver was gone. It was 11 at night (we were suppose to arrive at 09 pm), it was raining cats and dogs and I have a 2 year old baby to consider... not a good prospect if the driver was gone... specially as this was my first stay in Istanbul. Fortunately for me, I managed to call the hotel while waiting to go through the passport control and the receptionist informed me that the driver was waiting for me at the Information desk! I must say I was well impressed...specially as the transfers were courtsey of the hotel on the first place. The driver picked us up and dropped us at the hotel and the hotel staff was already waiting for us outside the hotel. The reception was easy and quick and the room on the 3rd floor was fantastic. The bed was huge, the central heating cosy, the baby cot was waiting for my baby already and even if the hotel is right in the center of Istanbul, I must say that I did not hear a single noise during the night which was much appreciated having a baby in the room. The breakfast room is breathtaking with the panoramic views on the Blue Mosque and St Sofia and the quality of the food and the service were pretty good as well. Location wise is very, very good having the major tourist attractions nearby (Cistern, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazar, St Sophia, Topkapi Palace...) and the reception was always willing to help, even Internet at the reception was free of charge which was also handy... In a nutshell, a very nice boutique 3 star hotel with a perfect comfort without breaking the bank and a great location. All along very much recommended. Rebeca Sanchez Santamaria from London

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Istanbul - hands down!!”
Reviews.Author: ProfCampbell
Reviews.Content: I am a college professor and recently returned from a one week study tour of Istanbul visit with 24 students, my family, and two of my colleagues. We stayed at the Hotel Nena and had a wholly positive and highly enjoyable experience. To give you full appreciation of our stay, please allow me to give you some details on how I originally came to choose the Hotel Nena... In anticipation of this trip, I traveled to Istanbul last year to scout it out. Part of my scouting involved visiting virtually all of the hotels in Sultanahmet and Beyoglu (if it's in one of the main guide books, I've seen it). By far, my first impression of the Hotel Nena stood above and beyond the rest. The staff was incredibly helpful, the rooms looked great, the hotel had more comfortable common areas than others (three separate lounging areas on the ground floor alone), and it was in the perfect central location. For me, the Hotel Nena was the definite choice for my group. Bringing such a large group requires a lot of extra planning, and the manager, Muzaffer Sahin, was incredibly helpful over the many months prior to our arrival. Anytime I needed to adjust the number/size of the rooms he immediately responded with whatever assistance I needed. So great was his help, that I decided to book a special dinner in the hotel and a half-day custom Byzantine tour through their agency (this tour included sites not normally offered on the package tours of the city). Again, each of these extra arrangements were managed perfectly and easily through Muzaffer (the manager) and the hotel staff. It was just over a week ago that we arrived in Istanbul, and, as promised the driver was waiting for us with a large bus capable of handling our large group and all our luggage. The students and my colleagues were especially impressed by the fact that the manager, Muzaffer, actually met us at the airport and accompanied us back to the hotel - first class service to say the least! Check in went quickly and easily, and we started our wonderful week at the Hotel Nena. It was an excellent week there, but let me give the highlights for those who are looking for the perfect hotel: Location: 1 minute from the Sultanahmet tram stop. All sites in Sultanahmet within easy walking distance. No one in our group ever used a cab. On a quiet side street, with plenty of great restaurants, bars, and stores nearby. Service: First class. All members of the hotel staff are excellent! All very helpful, attentive, and responsive to any needs one might have. Additionally, my students all remarked about how friendly they were; they thoroughly enjoyed their conversations with the staff. Anytime my wife returned to the hotel with our children in the stroller, a member of the staff would help her up the stairs into the lobby. Rooms: Well appointed, comfortable, and exceptionally clean. Not a single complaint from the 31 people in my group. All remarked on how comfortable the rooms are. Also, I read some reviews about the walls being thin - to the contrary, no one in my group mentioned this (actually one remarked how amazed he was about how quiet his room was once he closed the door). My room was the deluxe on the fourth floor. Great view of the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia from the balcony - very quiet and comfortable. Restaurant: Great!! Excellent view of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Sea of Marmara etc. We had a special group dinner the first night, which was of the highest quality. The 50% coupon in the restaurant means a high quality meal for a great price in comparison to many other restaurants. The breakfast was always delicious, plentiful, and well tended to by staff. One additional thing to mention - with my two small children in tow, the staff were especially helpful in warming up leftovers we had, providing milk and hot water, and always volunteering to bring anything we needed to the room. Exceptional service!! Manager: Muzaffer Sahin is the best hotel manager you will find in Istanbul!! Professional, courteous, and extremely helpful, his personal attention to our group was incredible. On the last night of our stay, my whole group thanked him and offered a round of applause for all that he and his staff did. Overall: It is rare, indeed, that you will find a hotel of this quality for such a great price (we received one night free due to the length of our stay). I take my college students abroad every year to locations across Europe, the Middle East, and Asia, and I would rank the Hotel Nena as the best, most personalized hotel experience I've ever had. I plan to take a group back to Istanbul sometime in the next year or two - rest assured that I have already mentioned to Muzaffer Sahin that he can expect us back in the lovely Hotel Nena, as I would not stay anywhere else in Istanbul!!!!!!!!!! Stay there - you will be glad you did!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: kzdoncaster
Reviews.Content: Nena Hotel was like a home away from home. We stayed for 4 nights and found it difficult to leave. The room and hotel facilities were very impressive for the price. The two most oustanding things were the breakfast and the staff. The breakfast buffet was delicious and we stayed almost 2 hours each morning because of the wonderful views we saw whilst eating declicious food. The staff were so wonderful and polite. We felt more like family than guests. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wigann
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, right in the middle of sultanahmet, stopped between the 15th and 19th of february rooms small, but perfect also lovely and warm (we certainly needed it) due to the worst snow in 15 years friendly staff especially Erol and Kemal and Mehmet i would reccomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: moonutah
Reviews.Content: it was the third time in this hotel always very nice hotel only a little problem in the rooms next the street it is more noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and a Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: meo_travel
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideally situated in Sultanahmet near the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and about 50 feet from the tram stop. There were many restaurants and shops within walking distance. The hotel itself was good, but not phenomenal. The room was small, but comfortable. Similarly, the bathroom was small- the shower space was approximately 9 sq ft with little room for toiletries. The bed was two single beds pushed together. There was limited space for clothes and other items. There was a refrigerator and tv set. However, Istanbul wasn't a place for spending time in the hotel room because there was so much to see. The hotel has two specific outstanding features: a shuttle to and from the airport and a computer terminal in the bar- both free to use. It was also nice that the hotel accepted payment in multiple currencies and gave a discount for paying cash. The breakfast is served on the top level with beautfiul views of the Blue Mosque. There was a mid size buffet of food included. The staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jennilee319
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic stay at the Nena Hotel. I booked a single room and the room I received had a double bed. I'm not sure if that what a person usually gets, but I wasn't complaining. The room would be considered large by Europe standards. The restroom was large also. The shower was a bit odd. It had two levels. Not sure what that was about. My room was clean when I arrived and the maids did a good job each day. My only complaint is the thin walls. I could hear my neighbors coming and going and the hallways echo. The breakfast buffet was very good. I took advantage of it every morning. There was a large selection. Cereal, fruit, bread, hot food, cheese, coffee. The view up in the breakfast room can't be beat. The staff was very friendly and informative. They answered any questions I had. There was free internet in the lobby. It wasn't any slower than an internet cafe I visited. The free airport shuttle was a godsend. Especially my departure at 3:30am. The location. is unbeatable. Walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar. I even walked to the Eminonou harbor. I walked back from Taksim Square. Istanbul is a city that can be walked around easily. But, there is a tram and bus stops very near the hotel if you don't like to walk. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC ISTANBUL”
Reviews.Author: rinaldo_zuccato
Reviews.Content: I stayed 6 day in Istanbul at the NENA HOTEL. Nena hotel is the ideal place to start to visit Istanbul. The Hotel is little but very confortable, nice, charming and clean. The Crew are very kind and qualified. Fantistic wiew from the Terazza Restaurant. I hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “A very good experience”
Reviews.Author: Smooth_Sluggo
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel far in advance back when it was #3 overall in the Tripadvisor rankings. I booked directly at the hotel's website, and received a free roundtrip to/from the airport due to staying for several days, a 10% discount for booking so far in advance; and another 5% for paying in cash. My wife and I booked one of the two suites for 4 nights. Location: right in the heart of the old city, this is a great location if you are here for a short time, and/or plan on spending most of your time here. Everything is within walking distance, and the tram stop is just minutes away. I do want to add my own insight...staying in the old town is not for everyone. Why? Because once the sun goes down and attractions close, there is not a lot to do. There are lots of turkish restaurants, but most of them are very similar. There are no night attractions, very few bars/social activities, and not much else to do at the hotel. Knowing what I know now, I would have stayed closer to Taksim square, where I could have gotten a much nicer room for the money and been close to the action, commuting to the old city during the day. Room: my room was clean, and as it was one of the two suites it had a view of the Blue Mosque. It had a queen-sized bed and a very tiny television, and a small bathroom. It was small for a suite but adequate for 2 people. Overall the room was fine, but I cannot in good faith compare it with that of a 5-star hotel. The one big drawback is its location in the hotel. The hotel has 5 floors, with an elevator going up to floor 4 (where the suites are located) and stairs to the 5th floor. The 5th floor is where the breakfast buffet is served. The walls and door are very thin, so if you're not the first one up for breakfast, everyone's walking/talking up the stairs will get you up. I also presume that the sound of the morning call to prayer by the mosques is louder, as this floor is the only one in the hotel with rooms above the other buildings, so nothing blocks the sound. Breakfast: it is included, with a moderate variety. It was adequate and average. We also received a 50% off dinner coupon, but we did not use it. Service: absolutely top notch. The staff here will help you any way they can. Extremely friendly, will cater to any special requests or needs, I concur completely with the other reviews that say they are the best. It is exceeds service at 5-star hotels. Overall, I heartily recommend this hotel, but in my opinion I don't think it warrants 5 stars, or that it is a top 1% hotel, as the ratings suggest.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: AmiNaz
Reviews.Content: The location is prime within Sultanahmet area (tram station is 1 minute walk). The blue mosque, hagia sofia, topkapi palace, basilica cistern are very close. The hotel is very comfortable, the staff is very friendly and professional. The rooms may seem small but we found them to be of decent size (compared to other hotels); the view from the rooftop resturant is superb. We contacted the hotel directly and got a great package for one week stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot beat the friendly staff & the location.”
Reviews.Author: travelisgood4u
Reviews.Content: In addition to Hotel Nena's excellent location (just few minutes away from all the major attractions in the historical district), it is really the hotel's staff that made the difference. Very accommodating, friendly, and made a visible effort for their guests. For example, finding a voltage converter for me or helping me navigate the Turkish computer keyboard. I booked my room through the hotel's website, and the offered rate was much lower than the rate offered through other internet websites. Airport pick-up & drop-off service was on-time, in their clean van. The breakfast, with very attentive waiting staff, was good enough for one to skip lunch. The view from the roof-top restaurant was awesome. The train stop is only a minute walk away to take you around the city, and there are many eating places within walking distance for dinner & lunch. The neighborhood was very safe and lively. My hotel room was not big, but then you are not visiting Istanbul to admire the size of your hotel room. My room & bathroom were cleaned daily, and even though my room faced the street, there was no street noise to bother me. Before heading out to Istanbul, like any traveler, I was worried about accommodation and location. But the stay at Hotel Nena was so good that all I had to worry about was paying an appropriate price at the shops in Spice Bazaar :) In essence, I could just focus on being a tourist in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find...thank you ALL for your helpful comments!”
Reviews.Author: stigliczvg
Reviews.Content: This is a real find in Istanbul. Clean, friendly, and extremely helpful. The breakfast was excellent, many choices. We also had dinner (one night) at the hotel and it was very good...my Lamb Chops were cooked perfectly (I'm very particular). The view from the roof restaurant is breath taking. You have a choice to sit inside or outside....either way, the view is gorgeous. Step out of the lobby and you are minutes (walking) from ALL the main sights: Blue Mosque, Sophia, Grand Bazaar. You are also few feet from the streetcar. Our only problem was the shower/bath. I have mold allergies and it bothered me the first night. However, I informed the front desk about my dilemma and they immediately offered to change our room. I asked if they could simply clean it REALLY good and he said they would. When we got back from sightseeing, the manager called me and asked if the shower was alright. It was much better than it was the day before, but each day it got cleaner and cleaner. They also kept asking me each day if it was alright. They "aim to please". When you take advantage of the online booking, paying cash and other offerings, the PRICE is great....it also includes pickup from airport and return. Our friends who were staying at other hotels, not only payed more each night, but had to pay 30 YTL more/each way for airport transportation. We would definitely suggest this hotel to all our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: obiwon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights early November 2007 and loved this hotel. The staff were great, the location is perfect and our room #401 was clean and spacious. The balcony had the great views over looking the Blue Mosque. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for the perfect trip”
Reviews.Author: mandi2doors
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Istanbul with three other people and stayed at Hotel Nena for 3 nights. I booked the hotel based completely on the reviews here on TripAdvisor and it exceeded my expectations. We payed 63 Euros per night for a double room which included breakfast and pick up from the hotel so we definitely got a deal. Our original group consisted only of 4 people but a fifth joined us pretty last minute and the hotel was very accommodating in putting a single box spring and mattress in the room for the third person when an additional room wasn't available. Our friends missed breakfast the first morning and the kitchen staff made them up a plate to take back to their room free of charge. Breakfast in itself was an experience not only for the good food but the gorgeous view (I posted a picture of the view from the breakfast terrace). The rooms were clean, the staff extremely helpful, and the minibar wasn't even overpriced (1.50 Lira for a bottle of water). Overall, this is one of the best hotels I've stayed in and would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “central and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: newyorkAukland
Reviews.Content: the staff make the Hotel Nena an enjoyable experÄ±ence. Most of the rooms are also very comfortable. The central Ä±nterÄ±or rooms are a nÄ±ghtmare so be sure to avoÄ±d these, stuffy wÄ±th no aÄ±r and just unpleasant. WarnÄ±ng to other travellers who go to Nena's recommended travel agency Commodore Ä±n DÄ±vangyolo CaddesÄ±, DO NOT USE THIS AGENCY TO BOOK your tours around Turkey. It Ä±s very expensÄ±ve and the qualÄ±ty of the hotels Ä±s good to below average. TheÄ±r organÄ±zatÄ±on works but for the prÄ±ce you pay compared to other agencÄ±es Ä±t Ä±s a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view”
Reviews.Author: jamesa_green
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a great location, just off the main strip with restaurants and the tram stop (which takes you to the port) nearby. View from the breakfast / dining room is fab, with a superb panorama of the southern corner of the city and the blue mosque in particular. Staff very friendly and helpful. Only smallish gripe was that we chose a suite with a balcony which is on the forth floor. These suites have everyone going to the restaurant 'tapping' past on the tiled floors, as the lift stops on the forth floor, yet the restaurant is on the fifth floor and the stairs up go by the suites. We got woken up every day both early morning and in the early hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: grammyannie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulously located--just minutes' walk to the Blue Mosque, Santa Sofia church, the Grand Bazaar. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Using e-mail, I had arranged for a car to pick us up at our cruise pier (15 euro), and the hotel included a one free transfer--a longer trip to the airport the next day. The room, itself, was average and clean. But the location and the friendly, helpful service made our stay just great!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely efficient NENA !”
Reviews.Author: chiliyo
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nena is Istanbul at it's best ! Simplicity and efficiency in hospitality. Clean rooms with fresh bedding , decent toiletries , and great breakfast included for much less that what other hotels in the area are charging. Conveniently located close to light rail between the Sultanahmet and Cemberlitas stops. It's a breeze to get anywhere in town from here. Muzzafer Sahin, the sales mgr and the rest of the staff are a pleasure to deal with. Any meal on their terrace overlooking Hagasofya , the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorous is simply unforgettable !!! Make sure to criss-cross the Bosphorus for around CND 1.00 each ride. The Taksim area is worth a visit as well. I would stay at the Nena again if I go back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps we were at a different Nena...”
Reviews.Author: Rubenesque
Reviews.Content: Booked the Nena based on all the fab reviews ... but then went on to have a completely different experience. Firstly, the free airport transfer offered on the web site. Contacting the hotel a few days before our arrival we were told this only applies to guests who book directly with the hotel. No mention of this on the web site. OK, not the end of the world so we arranged to pay for a transfer organised by the hotel - which was more than an hour late. When we finally got to the hotel, after crawling through Ramadan traffic, we opened the door to a tiny, noisy, drab room with probably the smallest shower/bathroom we have ever seen. While the room was spotless with clean bed linen, we were bitten by bedbugs. We dreaded getting into the bed but didn't know how to explain the problem. OK, we were there for just a few nights and on a visit to Istanbul you don't spend much time in the bedroom. But there was always the much-lauded breakfast in the rooftop restaurant with views of the Blue Mosque and the Bospherous to look forward to. Breakfast was ok but there are only three tables on the balcony which was always nabbed by smokers who appeared to sit there forever. Perhaps we shouldn't have stayed in Sultanahmet during Ramadan. Fascinating to see the number of pilgrims but getting in and out of the hotel and trying to use public transport like trams and taxis was a complete nightmare due to the sheer number of people. If we return to Istanbul we will avoid the 'touristy' areas and stay a few miles out of the centre. We would go further along the Bospherous around Ortokoy or beyond.
