This is the surprising part of Istanbul, more like the Italian lakes. Very beautiful and a pleasure to wander around.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Joanna056
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nena is absolutely marvelous! I stayed in the hotel for two weeks during my research trip this summer and I was delighted with everything that the hotel had to offer. Nena is a small, boutique hotel, with wonderful rooms, beautiful garden roof terrace, and most generous staff I encountered during my stay in Turkey. I was particularly impressed with professionalism and kindness of the Hotel's manager, Muzaffer Sahin, who was incredibly generous with help and suggestionsâ€”somebody should notice this and promote this man to the top position in the business. But, really, everything in Nena was great, including a large breakfast buffet and its superb location in the heart of Sultanahmet. A true find. I definitely will be staying there next year! Thank you Muzo!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nena - Secret little jewel”
Reviews.Author: BoCyn
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT LOCATION! This 3 star hotel is within easy walking distance of all the historical sights in Istanbul and the tram stop is just around the corner. We paid 154 euros per nights for the standard room. Next time I'd pay a little more and opt for the superior room but the standard was fine for 2 nights. The hotel provided pick up from the airport and took us to the cruise ship terminal after our stay. They have a nice breakfast buffet in the AM and the roof top restaurant has a great view of the city. There was also a 50% off dining coupon in the restaurant for dinner. The area around the hotel was very clean and we felt safe walking around after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Go Anywhere Else”
Reviews.Author: YVRperipatetic
Reviews.Content: From Vancouver Canada Stayed 1 night at start and 1 night at end of a 2 wk visit to turkey in Oct 2007 Found and chose the hotel through reading reviews from Tripadvisor. Booking online was simple and prompt. Early booking discount plus cash discount made this stay truly good value. Met by hotel car at airport upon arrival - a great convenience after a tiring flight into a strange city. Returning to the airport on one's own was simple. Great service from all staff at hotel, helpful in all matters. Offers free internet access, safety deposit for valuables, 50% off food in their restaurant, a comfortable room for the money in a major metropolis and a superbly convenient location in Sultanahmet on tramline and close to Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. Also easy to reach Eminonu, Galata bridge and Taksim district where one can truly appreciate life in Istanbul in the evenings. Great view of Blue Mosque in mornings at rooftop restaurant accompanies a more than adequate breakfast buffet included in price of room. On my last day, I had to get to the airport for a 6am flight and the hotel arranged their car to drive me there at 3:30am at no cost and even upgraded my single room to a double with a terrace overlooking the Mosque because there was a misunderstanding about my arrival flight and I was not met at the airport. With this kind of location, service and price point, why would anyone want to stay elsewhere in Sultanahmet?

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Nena!”
Reviews.Author: StormsEnd
Reviews.Content: Nena Hotel was recommended to us by friends and we could not have been more pleased. From the dealings with our reservations via email, pick up at the airport, the arrangements made to recover my missing luggage, the view from the terrace restaurant, to all recommendations made to us by staff, this place is a winner. The location is superb - easy walking distance to everything. The staff are friendly, efficient and professional. I don't agree with the comment about the hotel being noisy (recent review) - we were impressed that given the location it was so very quiet. Traffic was not an issue for us. The rooms were spotless. I will definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel close to all sites.”
Reviews.Author: papillon822
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Nena on Sept. 10th for 4 nights. Spotless boutique hotel with 24 rooms. Walking distance to all sites. The included breakfast was excellent and served on the roof top restaurant which also has an outdoor terrace. The view of Aya Sofia and the Blue mosque were priceless during the day and evening during dinner. Staff speaks very good english and very helpful. There is also a computer to access the internet, free of charge. Will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Naamloos
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nena, Istanbul â€“ HIGHLY recommended. We discovered the Nena on Tripadvisor and booked after reading rave reviews. In a nutshell this is what we experienced: We were collected from the airport and transported to the hotel at no charge. We were given a lovely room with balcony and wonderful views. A 50% discount meal voucher entitled us to a lovely meal in the rooftop restaurant boasting wonderful views of Istanbul After a really good nights sleep we left the next morning to tour Turkey. We returned to Hotel Nena after our tour and then stayed for 4 more days. It was just as great the 2nd time round. LOCATION: Could not be better â€“ walking distance to all important sights, i.e Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Aiya Sofia, Grand Bazaar, Cistern, Topkapi etc. TRAM: Just down the road and very user friendly ATM: Just around the corner SHOPS & OTHER RESTAURANTS: Dozens to choose from in the immediate vicinity, even a small supermarket. THE ROOMS: We experienced different rooms on the 2 occasions. Both were extremely comfortable with balconies. Size wise they are of European standard, with compact well fitted bathrooms and loads of hot water. The rooms are kept scrupulously clean and the Air-conditioning works! Rooms have mini-bars and small TVâ€™s with Sky news and the likes. MEALS: We enjoyed 2x 50% discounted dinners which were great value, well presented freshly cooked and great tasting on both occasions. Breakfast presented us with a choice of cereals, cheeses, cold meats, olives, fruit etc, breads, scrambled eggs and vienna sausages. You wonâ€™t go hungry and whats more, it is served on the rooftop with the wonderful views. What better way to start the day? STAFF: Very helpful and friendly. We toured all over Turkey and stayed at mostly 5 star hotels but did not encounter the homely friendliness experienced at the Nena. We often remarked that staying here was just that - relaxed and homely. We even enjoyed the encounters with the carpet sellers across the road. Yes, they could be a nuisance. We made it perfectly clear, right at the beginning that we were not buying carpets and thereafter greeted them everytime we saw them! Hence, they seemed to add to the atmosphere of the place. It was almost like returning home to a friendly neighbourhood after a long hot â€˜touristyâ€™ day!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend Nena Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JAJDallas
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Istanbul where we stayed at Hotel Nena. This hotel is the perfect location, walking distance to all sites in the city center. All the staff were very helpful and welcoming. We prefer smaller, boutique hotels to the large chain hotels. You can't go wrong here! Great full breakfast with fantastic views of the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. Dinner was very delicious as well, with reasonable pricing. If given the chance to visit Istanbul again, we would not hesitate to stay again. A&J

Reviews.Title: “Perfect position, lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth89
Reviews.Content: This is a small traditional beautifully refurbished hotel, very close to all the major sights in Istanbul. Staff genuinely friendly & helpful and we had free web access - great for 24 hour on line airline check-in! Spotlessly clean with very attractive roof top dining room & terrace with breath taking views of the Blue Mosque, Bosphorus etc. Food very good. We stayed in 2 other hotels in Istanbul, one much more expensive, but this was the best. Would strongly recommend & we hope to go again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo-7
Reviews.Content: Simply an excellently located hotel. A few steps to Hagya Sophia and the same to grand bazaar. Kind staff. Facilities OK. Wonderful terrace with a magnificent view and good restaurant either!!! Breakfast looking at the Blue Mosque, Bosphorus and Hagya Sophia is really a different way to wake up.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Finuala
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in the Nena hotel at the end of a month in Turkey. It is in a super location just a stones throw from the Grand Bazaar and a quick walk to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia, as well as the essential Starbucks, Maccas and kebab shops!! It is excellent value for money, with a stunning view from the rooftop. The service was great, they were very helpful with all our confusing onward travel arrangements. The rooms were basic but immaculately clean, and the lobby, hallways etc had a lovely charm to them. We only ate breakast in the hotel, which was fine, and apart from their restaurant, there must be 100's in staggering distance! We initially stayed in the Empress Zoe, which is a destination in itself, and heavenly; but in a different price range. However for a convenient stopover, at a bargain price, this is great value.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel in the crown of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: padruig
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel - its location, right in the heart of the Sultanhamet district, its size- small and intimate, its decor - traditional, its staff - friendly , the breakfasts- A1, and the views from the terace looking out to the Blue Mosque and beyond - magnificent,. The free transfer to and from the airport for stays of more than 3 days is another bonus. . I personally think that smaller hotels like the Nena are perfect for a city break and we hope to stay there again. Judith and Patrick, England

Reviews.Title: “loved the Nena”
Reviews.Author: joel41
Reviews.Content: Excellent location to all attractions, very reasonable price, excellent buffet breakfast with a fantastic view of the city and ocean. Manager & assitant manager are very helpful and speak good English. Highly recommendit

Reviews.Title: “Such a view”
Reviews.Author: lamancha
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated in the Sultanamet district where all the main attractions are ie the Blue Mosque, Topkapi etc. The hotel is clean and the staff very helpful and welcoming. The view from the terrace of the breakfast room is breathtaking, especially at night. Rooms are adequate and well serviced by staff, although the air conditioning was noisy and could, indeed did, keep a light sleeper awake.

Reviews.Title: “Great views from the terrace”
Reviews.Author: ossietripper
Reviews.Content: Istanbul: Hotel Nena: "Absolutely magnificent views from the terrace of a good hotel" Date: August 19, 2007 Reviewer: A TripAdvisor Member, Brisbane Australia We stayed at the hotel in late June and the air conditioned rooms were large and comfotrtable. The hotel is very central to all the sites in Istanbul. It has magnificent views from the terrace where brekfast and other meals are served. The service was friendly and we really appreciated the free airport pick up and drop off service the hotel provides for stays of 3 days or more. We stayed 4 nights and really enjoyed it. Breakfast on the terrace was so lovely that it was hard to drag ourselves away from the hotel to go to all the nearby attractions. Our children stayed elsewhere and they were always over with us at Nena. The breakfast is a lovely buffet and the views from the terrace were stunning. We enjoyed many evening beers on the terrace watching the sun set over istanbul. The staff were very friendly and the free internet was very handy.

Reviews.Title: “great view, small room”
Reviews.Author: drw1844
Reviews.Content: I regularly check out the reviews on tripadvisor, but this is the first time that I have been moved to write a review myself. My wife and I stayed at the Nena in August this year. I can agree with all the reviewers that the view from the terrace was absolutely stunning, and the location was great. However, in Sultanahmet, these are not unique selling points, with at least 20 or more hotels with exactly the same commodities. So with the Hotel Nena so high on the tripadvisor rankings, I was expecting a little more, and I'm not sure we got it. The room (we had just a basic double) was exactly that: a basic double. It was small, with a tiny bathroom. The view was of a wall, and another hotel. The staff were friendly, but no more than in any other hotel that I've stayed at. The transfer to the airport was nice, but this is offered by many hotels, and once you've tipped the driver, it only saves you c. 10 turkish lira each way. In summary, whilst I can't actually fault anything with our stay (and we had a fabulous time in Istanbul), at the price (89 euro/night), and with so much competition, we expected perhaps a tiny bit more...

Reviews.Title: “GÄ±la”
Reviews.Author: Troro
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nena Ä±s very goog as personal as room. The hotel Ä±s Ä±n the zone most beatÄ±ful of Istanbul near Grand Bazar, the blue Moscow and Santa SofÄ±a. Erol the barman Ä±s very polÄ±te and avaÄ±ble. ASk for hÄ±m for anythÄ±ng. The hotel has un terracce very nÄ±ce, the vÄ±ew Ä±s gorgeous. GÄ±la

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Ever_the_Vagrant
Reviews.Content: We loved our four-night stay at the Hotel Nena in August 07. Our room was quiet and clean, with good air-conditioning and bathroom facilities. The staff at the Hotel Nena were delightful -- they were very helpful and obliging, but were extremely friendly to boot. Late one night they offered to open the rooftop terrace for us, and we enjoyed a few quiet drinks with only the beautiful Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and a glorious full moon for company. Apologies if this sounds a bit grandiose, but it really was a glorious night. The terrace is in fact one of Hotel Nena's chief selling points. It is a wonderful experience to relax with your (very good) breakfast every morning while gazing out over the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia.Finally, the hotel's location is excellent: not only is it within easy walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi, the Basilica Cistern and the Grand Bazaar, it is also very conveniently located for transport, with a major bus stop and a tram stop nearby. This improved our stay immensely, as we spent many of our nights enjoying the more exciting nightlife options on offer in the new part of Istanbul (Beyoglu, including Taksim and especially Pera). As you can probably tell, this hotel comes very highly recommended. Especially when you consider the price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, charming Nena Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shanneykay
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fabulous 6 day stay in Istanbul at the Nena Hotel. The staff was so very helpful, considerate and knowledgeable. We stayed in Room 208 which was very comfortable and met all of our needs. The location is perfect for exploring the old section (Sultanahmet) where everything was in walking distance -sights, shops, bazaars, restaurants and the tram which was 2 minutes away and so very easy to use. We used it to go to Eminounu (the port )and take a fabulous public ferry ride on the Bosphorous. Much more reasonable than taking a private tour. Only 12.5 turkish lira. The breakfasts were fresh, delicious and varied with wonderful fresh fruits, cheeses, different breads and rolls, eggs, breakfast meats, olives, yogurt and wonderful cherry juice. Fell in love with Istanbul; its people, energy and amazing history. Will positively go back and stay at the Nena. We also received free transportation to and from the airport as we were staying more than 3 days. Certainly made life easier.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: pride
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Nena from the 26-29 Jul. It is a great hotel. We enjoyed our stay there. The staffs were very friendly. The rooms were bigger then the other hotels we stayed in istanbul. We ate at the restuarant which offered a 50% discount on food. Good food toooooooo. The hotel is situated just off the main street and its about 5 mins walk to the Grand Bazzer.The tram stops are just a stone throw away. Great Place and Great Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Most friendly staff I've ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: fourmusketeers
Reviews.Content: After a month of traveling around Turkey with two little boys, my husband and I were exhausted and in some ways dreading our stay in Istanbul. I made our reservations online at Hotel Nena with not even having checked any reviews --- it was the first to appear on a search engine and fit our criteria --- in Sultanameht , willing to let all four of us stay in one room and included airport pick up and drop off with the cost of the room. After a four night, five day stay, I can say that I have never met a more friendly and accommodating staff. Many thanks to Erol who taught our eldest how to play backgammond and supplied our little one with endless snacks. Hotel Nena is also in an excellent location for touring most of the major sites in Istanbul, as well as the back streets (for cheap eats). There is also a great terrace top restaurant with a view and a cozy lobby area. We will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nena Gets a Thumbs Up.”
Reviews.Author: travelnymom
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in the Hotel Nena, Istanbul. The room was large and clean, the beds were comfortable. They put an extra bed in so we could have our two children (6 and 9) in the room with us (a lot of hotels would only allow 1 child). The view from the breakfast restaurant was spectacular--right over the Blue Mosque. At night, we ate at the restaurant and the food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nena has some challenges”
Reviews.Author: cstmartin
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel in the touristy area of Sultanahmet, Istanbul. The accommodations are adequate for a single traveler but not roomy enough for a couple. Its location is perfect if you want to walk or take the tram to the museums, mosques, and bazaars. The rooms, however, have some challenges: there is very little storage space so a traveller must live out of their suitcase; there is no place to sit other than the bed; and the room is poorly lit, so bring a book light if you plan to read in bed. The bathroom is just a bit larger than those found on a cruise ship, and it also had poor lighting. The air conditioning struggles continually to maintain a reasonable temperature. As with many hotel properties in Istanbul, this hotel has a rooftop terrace restaurant with a stunning view. However, the terrace furniture is plastic so the ambience is a little lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Wow This is the Place to Stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: herbalsoaplady
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nena Istanbul is a rare find. Clean, clean, clean. Very nice bed - a good night sleep is a must for us! Bathroom with tub was just right. We had one of the two balcony rooms advertised as deluxe. The deluxe part is the balcony with a awesome view of the Bosphorous and the Blue Mosque. Quite impressive esp. at night with the lights shining on the mosque We did not even mind the calls to prayer. Buffet breakfast very nice indeed. Hot and cold foods - local specialties. Do use the 50% off coupon in their rooftop restaurant. The food was good and the savings were great! Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. We used the computer in the lobby to check our email. Be aware of the keyboard differences ASK the clerk they will help. Location is great. ATM on the corner and a local food store within walking distance. Walk to the Blue Mosque .. trolley very close. Lots of shopping on the main drag. We bought a small rug. NOT from the pests across the street. Avoid eye contact with them they are pretty rude characters. Lots of restaurants on the way to the Blue Mosque. We loved the ones with prepared food in the window. Easy to see what you are getting esp. if the staff only speaks Turkish. Check the alleys out for other dining venues. We enjoyed the local pizza and other delights at one. When I asked what the gentleman was eating at the next table he instructed the waiter to take some of his food for us to try. Wow what a friendly country.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: Naseer A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Nena during our vacation between the 17th and 26th of June. I booked with the hotel using their website and opted for cash payment when settling my bill (5% discount). Location: Its a nice little hotel located smack dab in the middle of the sultanahment area and within easy walking distance of all the tourist attractions here. For those looking to roam outside of sultanahment e.g. to go to Taksim; there are two tram stops within 5 minutes walking distance of the hotel i.e. Sultanahmet and Cemberlitas. By the way, there is also a cinema showing English movies inside a pseudo clothing mall at Cemberlitas (directly opposite the tram stop). There are lots of restaurants around the hotel including a Mcdonalds (open till midnight). Rooms: For the first night, we stayed at in Deluxe room which has a balcony overlooking the blue mosque. Since these were not available after the first night; we moved to a standard double room for the rest of our trip. The standard rooms are small when compared to American/Far East lodging standards but in line with European rooms. The Deluxe rooms are much larger. However both types of rooms are clean with most of the amenities required. There are no in-room safes, however there is a safety deposit box maintained at reception which you can use for no extra charge. As a tip, the view from the rooftop terrace restaurant is much better than the one you get from the balcony of the deluxe rooms. Secondly, the restaurant closes down around 10:00 at night but the place upstairs is kept open so you can sit on the terrace and enjoy the cool breeze with a few drinks etc. Most of the times, you will be the only people there. Others: We really enjoyed our stay here. There were a few minor blips e.g. the driver was late picking us up from the airport due to the traffic etc but these dont matter. The breakfast (on the rooftop terrace) is good with different types of teas, fruits etc, however if you expect big breakfasts ala omelettes, pancakes and the like, you are in for a disappointment (pretty much in every hotel in Istanbul except for the big 4-5 star ones). The hotel restaurant which is "officially" located in the basement (but since all patrons prefer to eat on the rooftop terrace so its empty all the time and waiters take orders from people on the rooftop and work the lifts) is quite good but is closed on Sunday. You get a 50% discount for your first time here and I suggest you avail it for dinner. There is nothing like a dinner at night overlooking the panorama of the Sea/Blue Mosque etc. The big plus about this hotel besides the location, are the staff who are really friendly and go out of their way to help you out. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Staff”
Reviews.Author: Tullamarine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely boutique hotel for four nights and really enjoyed our stay. The breakfast was an amazing buffet and the yoghurt was exceptional but then again we were in Turkeyâ€¦...and the view of the Blue Mosque from the breakfast room is unbelievable. One of the best features of hotel Nena was the staff that were so polite and helpful. I unfortunately got food poisoning when my husband and I went out for dinner one night and the manager went out of his way to help my husband find a pharmacy and offered to call a doctor. We also were meeting up with some family relatives of friends from Australia that lived in a rough part of Istanbul and the hotel manager even gave us his personal mobile phone number just in case we got into trouble or got lost. The rooms are clean and spacious and we had a room with a balcony. This is a great hotel which is central to everything. I would highly recommend staying at Nena but beware of the Carpet sellers across the road as once you are out of the protection of your hotel they wonâ€™t stop until you buy a rug!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: SheikhDaoud
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Nena for the first time between June 14 to 16. I arrived aboard a red-eye from Jeddah, which touched down at 6:10 am. The driver was running late, so he called the Information Desk at Ataturk Airport and had me paged to tell me he was on his way. This really impressed me. I got me to the door of the hotel at 7:30. My room wasn't ready, but then again, I didn't expect that it would be. So, the delightful staff at the reception desk invited me to take breakfast upstairs while I waited -- a nice touch. The room I had, facing the street, was small but very nice. The bed was king size and quite comfortable for the price. Everything was spotlessly clean. Opening the window, you face a building across the street where people both live and work, so if are thinking of wandering about naked with the window open, you might be giving someone a show! For me, the best thing about this hotel is the staff: the guys at the front desk are second to none. Each of them, within a day, became a friend. One in particular became a very important friend to have, and this brings me to the rug merchants across the street. They are persistent, loud, obnoxious and annoying as hell. I have lived in Saudi Arabia for the past 8 years, and I thought I was immune to this sort of thing, but the behavior of one of them went far beyond the pale of what is acceptable. He would see me on the main street and follow me to the hotel, all the while trying to make conversation with me, while I was, frankly, not interested. I was not raised to be rude to people, but this was getting ridiculous, so I told him to please go away and leave me alone. He didn't relent. I came stumbling into the lobby and told the guys at the reception desk. Immediately, the new friend of whom I speak ran outside and confronted the guy. Well, unfortunately, the rug merchant defended himself with shouts of, "I'll do as I like, this is my business" and the punches started flying. The police were summoned to the scene, and the tempers subsided. I felt terrible for saying anything, especially because the guy at the hotel got his shirt ripped open in the fracas, but when I told the guy how sorry I was, he said with s a smile, "You are our guest and our friend, and you're here to be comfortable, so we have to make sure you're comfortable." I thoroughly recommend this hotel. Go and enjoy. But do not pay any attention to the rug merchants.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL VIEW”
Reviews.Author: S0lange
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nena for 5 days and every time we went up the restaurant varandah we were once again amazed at the view! The location is very convenient, in the heart of Sultahnemed but in a very quiet street. The hotel is spotless clean (I mean, you see people cleaning the walls!). The room is not very big but ok and the bathroom is great, everything seems new. We booked directly with the hotel and got a great discount for cash payment (no booking fee either), so the price was really low for such a great little hotel. The breakfast is also quite complete, with lots of fruit (fresh cherries, hum,,,) The only thing I would reccomend is to bring some clothes hangers, as there were only about 5 there. They have a restaurant which was quite handy after a long flight (plus they give you 50% discount on the first meal there).

Reviews.Title: “I can't say enough good things. BEST PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: Boston2Bronx
Reviews.Content: I Loved the Hotel Nena I can't say enough good things. BEST PLACE TO STAY +++ Location - in Sultanahmet near Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque etc Great Price - 100E with breakfast for our family of 3 Free Internet Access in Lobby Excellent Breakfast in Rooftop Restaurant - See photos Clean Room Safe Neighborhood Everyone speaks English and is friendly Would stay there again. Nothing Negative to Say

Reviews.Title: “We Loved The Nena”
Reviews.Author: Klockars
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nena Hotel for five nights beginning May 19, 2007, and it couldn't have been better. Our standard room was very comfortable, the location was excellent, and we appreciated being picked up at the cruise ship and eventually taken to the airport. We liked their dining room so well that we ate there almost every night. The only difficulty was in leaving the nice staff we got to know as friends. We miss them! When we return to Istanbul, we will certainly stay at the Nena again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel Nena”
Reviews.Author: ThessalonikiGreece
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Istanbul was realy wonderful. The Hotel "Nena" made it to be perfect. Beginiong from the kindest stuff, the great position of the hotel (you must see the vew from the roofterace of the hotel!), the perfect hygiene of the whole hotel, reach asortiment of the breakfast buffe and also of the hotel restorant - and all that by realy good prices! I can highlly recommend hotel "Nena" to every one who wants to have a unforgetable holyday in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “many thanks to the staff”
Reviews.Author: KarenKwag
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for the final two nights of our two week stay in Turkey, after we returned to Istanbul from a tour. We had read the many good reviews here and we agree with the positives of the location, rooms and view. However what we will always remember is the help the staff gave us when our daughter was struck with a sudden attack of gastro. Many of the people on our tour had also been sick, whether virus or whatever we are not sure. The staff at Nena phoned a chemist, then their on-call doctor, got us to speak to the doctor, translated for us to the chemist, then got their driver to collect the medication and delivered it to the door. The medication worked immediately and she was able to sleep off the attack. We were not even charged for the medication or the driver's time. I think the action of the staff at Nena almost certainly saved our daughter from ending up in hospital with all the resultant trauma, insurance claims etc and we could not be more grateful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Nena”
Reviews.Author: happytravels2
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from a Mediterranean cruise and stayed over in Istanbul at the Nena. We had chosen this hotel based on many favourable comments from other tripadvisor members. We were not disappointed. Their shuttle picked us up as soon as we disembarked our ship and took us directly to the hotel. As it was early morning, we had to wait an hour until our room was ready but then were able to check in early which was much appreciated. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and spoke excellent english. The hotel was immaculate and our room was very nice. The only negative is that the bathroom shower/tub was difficult to enter and exit due to the fact that the shower door does not open wide enough. Although there is no in-room safe, there is a safe available for your private use at the hotel. The location of this hotel is excellent - you can walk to almost everything you wish to see. Because it is on a side street, we found it very quiet in terms of traffic noise. The Nena gave us a 50% off coupon which could be used towards dinner. We took advantage of this and had a really great dinner in their rooftop restaurant. Their appetizer plate was scrumptious and the lamb kabob was the best I had tasted. The evening view of the Blue Mosque was stunning!! It was an especially memorable dinner because May 19th is Turkey's National Day and we were treated to a lovely display of fireworks in the distance. On the morning of our departure, their shuttle bus arrived promptly at 5:45 am and delivered us to the airport. Thank you Hotel Nena. We would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was a Pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: Belowradar
Reviews.Content: The location was wonderful. The Deluxe room with balconies afforded us a view of ship traffic, the Blue Mosque, The Palace. The best amenity of the hotel was the staff. Smiling, casual, eager to help out with directions, advice on attractions, service. It was they that pushed the stay to above average.

Reviews.Title: “Nena Hotel Staff is Extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: DallasTexasMary
Reviews.Content: My sister and I enjoyed both the beginning and the end of our trip to Turkey staying at the Nena. Clean room, excellent breakfast with a great view from the rooftop terrace, and a guest computer for sending email home. The extraordinary service of the staff insluded helping me arrange a surprise dinner at an outside restaurant (listed by Bon Apetite) for my son when he is in Istanbul later this month. I was treated like a family member or a friend while I was there. Mary from Dallas

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gmuessig
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nena is conveniently located, close to major attractions and the tram. The staff was very helpful in making and confirming car rental, airport transfer, lodging and airline arrangements for excursions outside of Istanbul. The breakfast is ample and fresh. The breakfast rooftop room has a beautiful view of the historic district. Free online access is available in the lobby. Very clean. Highly recommended! Geoff and Susan

Reviews.Title: “Nena is fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: marybindc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely and the staff is friendly, cheery, and helpful. The showers are GREAT! Great location in Sultanhamet near two trolley stops. Walking distance to tons of stuff. The restaurant is yummy and beautiful, with a rooftop view of the Blue Mosque that really is just as stunning as the pictures on their website. Breakfasts are a buffet of wonderful cheeses, olives, bread, eggs, fruit, and cereal. I can't recommend it enough and would stay there again. Tomorrow, preferably!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Mauratus
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend Nena enough. It is a delightful hotel with an exceptional staff. We stayed a week, and by the end I was very sad to leave my new, good friends. Without question, I will return to Hotel Nena.

Reviews.Title: “Easy, Friendly, Courteous”
Reviews.Author: Manfromthebubble
Reviews.Content: I did a bit of research into hotels in Istanbul and decided on Hotel Nena as it seemed to be what we wanted, ie, not too big - it has, i think 29 rooms. The transfer from from the airport was excellent. The driver from GTA Hotels (whom we booked with) was waiting for us when we arrived and transferred us to the hotel without any problems. The room we were put in first of all was quite small and faced into an internal part of the hotel, ie no view other than an air conditioning shaft. DONT BE PUT OFF BY THIS - READ MORE BELOW. I requesrted a change of room as 6 days in such a room would not be ideal. The staff were excellent in sorting out another room for us. They moved us, our wardrobe etc without any problem whatsoever. The room we then had was at the front of the hotel, it had a small balcony which was useful to look out into the street to see what was going on. If you havnt been to Istanbul before, prepare yourself for the onslaught of "carpet salesmen" including the guy from the shop opposite the hotel. They are very focussed in getting you into their shop, you should just resist & walk away. Back to the hotel though. the staff were first rate, they fell over themselves to help, no matter what you wanted. The rooftop breakfast area was marvellous overlloking the roofline of old Istanbul. The view was amazing. A special mention for Adi (the concierge/porter), he was just great, so keen & willing The hotel was very well placed for visiting all the sites of Sultanahemet, It was simplicity itself to take the tram to the other side of the city. If we went back ti Istanbul, we would certainly stay at hotel Nena again.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK, but not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: picolina
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on reviews from this site. We were at first somewhat dissapointed because the hotel has no special charm or unique features that would separate it from others. We were given a standard room on the first floor, which turned out to be unbearable. The room did not have adequate furniture (no chairs), the air was heavy (smoking room + old air) and since it faces the street, it was not possible to open the window even at night. We asked to change room and were given a room on the fourth floor with nice view of the Blue Mosque. The highlight of this hotel is the roof terrace and the nice view as others have mentioned. Staff overall was courteous and professional, and seems eager to please. While the location is convenient, you have to pass by a few rug deales to get to the main street and this can become very unpleasant. At times, you feel like you were cornered by the rug sellers since if you greeted them back, they would not let you go and this would go on for the whole stay. Overall, I would book this hotel if you got a good deal out of it, since it is certainly not the best choice one can have in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Bosnia11
Reviews.Content: We spend few days in this Hotel and everything was great. Nice rooms , location of hotel and very nice staff. I hope wi will go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sam_Cross
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of research into hotels in Istanbul and decided on Hotel Nena because of their review on here, their website and excellent communication. The pick up service from the airport (we flew into Sabhia GoÃ§ek) was excellent. Their driver was waiting for us when we arrived and transferred us to the hotel without any problems. We had requested a 3rd floor room at the front of the hotel and that is exactly what we got. The rooms are not exactly spacious but certainly adequate. Our room could have done with another set of drawers to put our clothes in and a few more coat hangers but apart from that it was fine. The bathroom was spotless and the shower excellent. The bed was very comfortable the only problem was the light switchbeing in the headboard and if you were not careful you switched them on inadvertantly. Breakfast was very good, tasty and plentiful. The staff were attentive without being obtrusive. The view from the breakfast terrace was amazing. The hotel was very well placed for visiting all the sites of Sultanahemet, however in February we found that nightlife in this area was a little lacking. I should imagine that more 'in season' this would not be a problem. We had a little problem on check out as we had accidentally broken a glass vase in the bathroom which they charged us for. The bill was not broken down and so it was difficult for us to be certain what we had paid for, hence a few telephone calls to us in the car whilst being transferred to the airport which we found rather jaded the end of our visit. However this did get sorted out and to the hotel's credit they resolved the issue efficiently. We would definitely return to Hotel Nena. The staff were friendly and helpful, the hotel was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value great staff”
Reviews.Author: canadawolfinottawa
Reviews.Content: I stayed there from March 07 till March 10 2007 .Airport pick up was included in the room price as was a single 50% discount coupon to be used towards a dinner at their in house restraurant "Nena Always ". Airport pick up was a breeze .I was met with a big smile from the driver who quickly took my luggage and whisked me away to the hotel in a new SUV , He was a very friendly chap who is very proud of his city . He will not look for a tip like the other guys do whenever I get an airport pick up . For that reason he got a big one from me The hotel staff are excellent so expect to be pampered like a family member . The room had everything that you would need . It was spotlessly clean . Lots of channels to choose from including CNN . Lots of shampoo soaps etc . I was in room 202 which was unfortunately faced the street below . The traffic noise on the Friday night was bad but eventually the city went quiet .If you do not like traffic noise ask for a different room. They should invest in door restrainers as some inconsiderate guests close their doors too loudly . Breakfast is not served until 7;30 so if you have a morning flight forget about getting anything to eat until you reach the airport . They serve a variety of things that are typically European in nature . Forget about having a lavish North American style breakfast buffet if that is what you expect You will find however enough to meet your dietary needs and more . They have a treasure chest of endless speciality teas ..The eggs are fantastic and the variety of breads is endless . The cheeses are fresh and numerous in variety . The city views from the upstairs restraurant are breathtaking especially as the sun is setting . Expect to be treated with a kid glove by the front desk staff. They are professionals ! Have them help you with your emails as the Turkish keyboard will not get you into the more popular email providers if the letter "i"is required for login ..also the "@" symbol is not associated with the number "2" key . They will quickly get you going ..just ask for help . Inexpensive bottled water is available from a vendor right outside the hotel door to the left .....he is located inside the corridor off the street ..Everything you want to see in Istanbul is within walking distance . The tram is just around the corner from the hotel entrance if you need it . It is extremely efficient and user friendly , Hotel Nena is the only hotel that I would ever stay at when I return to Istanbul ...A big thank you to all ! A most pleasant experience .

Reviews.Title: “Nena Heaven in 2007”
Reviews.Author: Gazbee
Reviews.Content: On our first visit to Istanbul we experienced cold, clear weather offset by warm, friendly and cheerful staff at Nena Hotel. In addition to wonderful hosts, clean rooms, good meals, e-access the Hotel is just so central to the big attractions of Istanbul, and adjacent to the efficient tramway if walking is not your thing. We Aussies were delighted with our stay at Nena Hotel and recommend it to all. Gary and Carol

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Price!”
Reviews.Author: Alexmluc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Nena Hotel with a friend for 5 nights in early March 2007 and the accomodations were excellent. We were in room 201 and it was a fair sized room (for Europe, not the States) with a great bathroom that looked to be brand new! Great water pressure in the showers and no lack of hot water. Comfortable beds with extra pillows provided. TV with multiple English channels and reasonably priced minibar. Clean room and sparkling bathroom. Great breakfast with eggs, yogurt with many toppings, breads, cheeses, tomatoes, olives, cereals, tea, coffee, juices, water all served in a rooftop restaurant with a fairytale view of the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sofya. The staff was not overly friendly, but they were not rude. We also got a free transfer back to the airport. All in all I would definitely return to the Nena on a return visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “I love Nena Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Macedonia
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel, near everything what is important to visit in Istanbul. Clean, quiet, an excellent staff. Go there, you will be not sorry. Prof. Dr. Dana Dina Kolevska, Macedonia

Reviews.Title: “The Nena was Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Laurenceb1
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a little gem. We loved it. In the heart of Sultanahmet and central to all the magnificent sights. The hotel was spotless and of a good standard. The hotel staff were very professional and always willing to help. We stayed B&B and the food was excellent such a choice for breakfast, both Turkish and Continental. Our room was a double and very comfortable. The breakfast room was a sight to behold, a fantastic view over Sultanahmet capturing the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque, what more could you wish for to start your day? Don't hesitate to book this hotel you won't be disappointed. You also get a discount on your bill if you book early and pay in cash. Laurence Broady

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay !!!”
Reviews.Author: Thibojo
Reviews.Content: Spend 5 days, 4 nights in Instanbul from Jan 26th through Jan 30th. We stayed in hotel Nena and were absolutely satisfied with our stay. This is a very decent and pleasant 3,5 to 4 star hotel. All suggestions and tips from other travellers on the tripadvisor site showed to be very valuable. Location : Perfect !!! - the hotel is perfectly situated at walking distance of all tourist attractions in Sulthanamet (Bleue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Ayasofia, the Grand Bazar and Egyptian Bazar) and there is a tram/tramway station at 200 meters distance. It is very easy to visit the city by tram and it is extremely comfortable. Rooms : given that we booked well upfront we were lucky ! - we had room 402 and this was fantastic - the room has adequate space, the bathroom is small but very functional and there is a small terrace - from the room and the terrace you've a nice view on the blue mosque and on the Bosphore - just marvelous ! Two small remarks : 1Â° noise of doors being slammed during the night (people get in drunk or do not pay attention... - bring your earplugs - like I did - it works just perfectly well !! - and 2Â° the curtains were just a bit small and very transparent.... The room and bathroom - as the whole hotel - were very clean ! Staff : staff was extremely friendly and helpfull ! Due to the fact that we made our reservation via the hotel internetsite, we were picked up at the airport on arrival and dropped off upon departure - this all for free - just fantastic ! Breakfast : is taken in the rooftop restaurant - nice view on part of Sulthanamet - and the food is adequate - service is very friendly. We did not have lunch or dinner in the hotel given the numerous possibilities in the hotel area (all at walking distance). Restaurants in the area : Restaurant SarniÃ§ (restaurant of hotel Ayasofya Pansiyonlari) - FANTASTIC experience - great foodt, great wines, great service, genuinely historic surroundings - we felt privileged having been able to have dinner there - we even went twice - do make a reservation however particularly during weekends. A must ! Restaurant Rumeli CafÃ© - nice - good food, good wines, good service, surroundings just fine - please make a reservation. Restaurant Balikci Sabahattin - primarily fish restaurant - food just just ok, service unfriendly, surrounding very noisy with a lot of drunk people in the restaurant. A never again experience. For lunch you can choose from a lot of small restaurants. When in the Grand Bazar environment however, try the Havuzlu restaurant in the Grand Bazar itself - a very nice local experience with decent food and very friendly and helpful staff. Give it a try - it's worth it. We'll for sure go back to Istanbul and when we do, we'll for sure stay at the Nena Hotel again !

Reviews.Title: “pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: shakaib
Reviews.Content: I had a difficult time choosing between this hotel and apricot hotel after reading all the reviews. I chose Nena due to the easy way to book the hotel throught its website. Pros: 1-Location, right in the heart of sultanahmet 2-Nice staff 3-Good view from the breakfast balcony 4-close to the tramstation 5-clean rooms 6-Good housekeeping, they would provide you with whatever needed 7-Safety deposit box, big help 8-Courteous front desk cons: 1-no internet service was available for the 3 nights i stayed there as there only PC was gone for "repair". I was surprised that they would only have one PC for the guests with no back up plan. 2-Breakfast is just edible. Orange juice is more like an orange squash, dont try. The breakfast staff specially kauser is very nice though. 3-The walls are very thin with noise from one room easily heard in the next one. I could easily hear some passionate sounds from some "possible honey mooners" in the hallway and it was quite embarassing. I think they should improved their noise insulation 4-They could be pushy to book the package tours whereas i found the tram and buses to be very easy way of traveling around in istanbul. Most of the places you can just walk to in nearby places. Overall good for price.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Oasis - Hotel Nena”
Reviews.Author: TitchLondon
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a half-term break to Istanbul which was much bettter than anticipated. We were met at the airport by the hotel's courtesy car with the minimum of fuss and whisked off to the hotel where we were met by the manager and variety of other staff. We were made to feel very welcome. The room was small but very clean and the bedding was crisp and white. The bathroom was modern,clean with fresh towels daily. We ate in the roof top restaurant (having been given a 50% off voucher for our first visit) and were not disappointed. The food was flavoursome, hot (despite having to be brought up from the basement) and well presented. It was all very relaxing after a long day travelling and getting our bearings. Price wise it was probably slightly cheaper than most other restaurants in the area. The view from the restaurant was great, just as it shows on the hotel website. The hotel is excellently placed for all the main tourist sites - Blue Mosque was 5 minutes away as was the Grand Bazaaar in the opposite direction. Starbucks was one minute away if you get desperate for western coffee. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff at the hotel, they were all very pleasant whatever time we came in. We were always offered tea or coffee, often on the house. The return transfer was confirmed the night before and the luggage left whilst we had a final wander around. The manager was again there, to bid us goodbye. I think it was excellent value (268 Euros - included a few things out of the fridge - for a twin room for 5 nights) we took advantage of a reduction for paying cash and booking direct with the hotel. Transfers were also included as we booked 5 nights. If we go to Istanbul again we would definately book to stay here again. Teachers - London

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: chocomousse
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nena is just perfect for your citytrip to Istanbul. It's location is near the Blue Mosk and other great monuments. Although it is in the center of Sultanahmet (tramstation nearby), you have a quiet location, no street noise. The rooms are comfortable and very clean. You start your day with a good breakfast on the 5th floor with a breathtaking view. Lunch or dinner in the Ã  la carte restaurant is also to recommend and last but not least, the staff in the hotel is friendly and very helpful. So my stay in the hotel Nena was wonderful. Thank you very much and see you again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Nena. It was fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: jweinland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent ten days in Turkey during the Fall of 2006 and we thoroughly enjoyed our visit at the Hotel Nena. The linens were lovely, the bathrooms impeccably clean and very modern. We had a difficult time determining what we appreciated the most about the Hotel Nena. We came to the conclusion that the staff was just remarkable. By the end of our stay, we felt as though they were members of our family and we hated to say goodbye as we wanted to spend more time with them. Not only are they extremely helpful, but very professional, extremely well-groomed and have beautiful manners. You will be most delighted with the view from the balcony on the fifth floor where they have the breakfast room. You get a magnificent view of the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia. The picture is so breathtaking when the sun comes up that you will think you're in a movie or looking at a gigantic postcard with the best picture ever taken of the two structures. They also have a sweet courtyard that will give you an opportunity to enjoy a quiet lunch outdoors in a garden atmosphere. Additionally, the internet is available 24 hours a day at no charge if you want to leave your computer at home. We plan to return to Istanbul and Turkey and when we do, we will stay at the Hotel Nena. It's close to all of the historic sites and you will not find a more cozy, quiet and restful hotel with a kinder staff. It's like staying in someone's home, but still affords privacy. If you like small, European hotels at a reasonable price, then look no further than Hotel Nena. James and Jennifer Weinland Oklahoma City, OK USA

Reviews.Title: “Nena is nice but not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Cholmley
Reviews.Content: My husband, our daughter, and my sister and I stayed at the Nena for six nights (we returned yesterday). We booked a deluxe room and a regular double. The reviews for this hotel are fairly accurate--the location is excellent for sightseeing and using public transport, plus it's simple to walk to the Grand Bazaar and spice markets. The deluxe room (we had 401) was comfortable and we had lovely views, but the double rooms are small, dark, and the sole window opens to an interior air vent. And because the hotel is quite small and the hallway is mostly uncarpeted, you can hear the other guests coming in and out of their rooms. The hotel staff is pleasant, but unexceptional. We asked them to arrange for a car to take us to the airport on the Asian side (which Easyjet uses) and, as they had when we arrived, put it on our bill. However, the driver expected us to pay him directly, which posed a bit of a problem as we were out of Euros by that time. I was unaware that the hotel did not follow our directions as the desk clerk did not give me an itemized bill or even a receipt on departure. I was also very displeased with the one restaurant recommendation from the hotel. We asked them to make reservations at a particular fish restaurant, but they told us it was booked and suggested a restaurant called YengeÃ§. I ought to have been wary as this restaurant sends a shuttle to pick up customers, but it was getting late and we decided to ignore our instincts. I still can't figure out where this place is located, but the neighborhood was definately dodgy. The restaurant itself was not particularly comfortable. The food was okay, but over-priced (one "large" shrimp was five pounds!|). I realize the hotel gets a commission and I don't mind as long as I don't feel taken, but I strongly recommend that you do not let the hotel send you there. The food in Istanbul is wonderful and there are many terrific places to eat from modest meatball and kebab cafes to white tablecloth restaurants such as Hamdi, where you don't mind spending more for dinner because the atmosphere (as well as the food) is worth it. I do think the Nena offers good value for money, but it is a 3 star establishment in every respect so keep your expectations in line. If you are sensitive to noise, make sure you spend a bit more for a deluxe room. It won't be totally quiet, but it will be an improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Great cozy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Handerson
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Tripadvisor, we booked to stay the weekend at the Nina. Hotel staff are indeed extremelly friendly and helpful. We had a fairly small room, without much of a view, so I would perhaps recommend trying to book one of the rooms with a view if you can. Breakfast in the terrace outside is outstanding - great views of the city and of the Blue Mosque. I would say this hotel is perfect for friends or couples wanting great value for money in a fantastic location!

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Service at Three Star Prices”
Reviews.Author: georgina
Reviews.Content: On studying the reviews on Trip Advisor, we chose to stay at Hotel Nena and booked one of their deluxe rooms (401 or 402), which is a must if you would like fantastic views of the Blue Mosque. The location of the hotel is excellent and near everything you would want to see without the need for taxis and is located on a quiet side street just off the main road. The rooms were spotless and even though some light bulbs needed to be replaced, this was done within the hour. The room size was generous and the bathroom had a nice powerful shower with unlimited hot water. The staff were friendly, attentive and efficient, nothing was too much trouble. The breakfast room was nice on the rooftop and there a large selection of everything to choose from. It was my birthday whilst we were staying there and when I came in from a hard day's shopping, I found a big bowl of fruit had been left on the bedside cabinet, which I thought was nice! The only drawback is what seemed to be the constant door slamming throughout the night which although was not the fault of the staff, was the only thing that I found irritating as I am light sleeper. On the whole, a really nice enjoyable stay and would definitely return. Many thanks to Muzzafer and his team!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Adi_Pocere
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about as centrally located in Sultanahmet as you could hope to find. Step out the door and you are 20 paces from an ATM, minutes from the Blue Mosque, and very short walks to the Grand Bazaar and the other places you will want to see during your first days in Istanbul: Hagia Sophia, Topkapi, the Archaeology Museum, the Cisterns. The staff were all wonderful, friendly and helpful. The rooms, though small (we expected this, and it is not a problem) are clean and comfortable, and the hotel has been beautifully renovated. Breakfast on the roof terrace was fabulous, as the views of the Blue Mosque and surroundings are truly amazing, and in the evening it is pretty fantastic, too. For first time visitors to Istanbul we lucked out in booking a hotel that met and exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Wisey29226
Reviews.Content: A quick one as the previous reviews say it all! Great little place with very helpful staff. Wonderful views from the restaraunt of the Blue Mosque and Ayia Sophia, what a wonderful way to start the day! Highly recommended. Tip : Get off the main street to eat, tourist traps and about 100 per cent mark up on same meals and drinks off the strip. Wonderful restaruants hidden away in the side streets and at the right price. Wisey and Sue Victoria Australia

Reviews.Title: “The BEST thing about Istanbul!!!”
Reviews.Author: richardpnyc
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful boutique hotel located in absolutely the BEST location in the old part of Istanbul. The owner was on the premises when we (group of six) arrived and was the BEST host one could ever hope for. The porters and front desk staff were exceptional. The breakfast was delicious and the view from the breakfast room, spectacular. The facilities of the hotel are of the highest standards, modern and clean. If you plan a trip to Istanbul, please treat yourself to a stay at this wonderful hotel. It will be a highlight of your visit as it was for us. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Barmek
Reviews.Content: We booked the Nena mainly on the strength of the reviews on TripAdvisor and we can say that we were not disappointed. The pictures of the hotel on the web site do not do it justice. We had hoped for a deluxe room but they were fully booked, however our room on the first floor was above our expectations. The bedding was beautifully embroidered pillow cases and duvet cover. The decor and furnishing was of a high standard. Breakfast was definitely a highlight - a great buffet enjoyed overlooking the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus! To paraphrase the hotel's own web site - the Nena is a 3 star hotel providing a 5 star service. We will definitely return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: swiftcreek30
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nena is a great hotel. The staff was very nice and helpful. The location of the hotel makes it close to a very nice market, restaurants, and other great sites. The marble floors in our room were very nice and we really enjoyed the room, because the hotel did a good job with the use of a small space. When I will return to Istanbul again, I will stay at the Hotel Nena and I will tell everyone that I know about this wonderful place.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful, courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: napal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel nena for 2 nights Oct 14 & 15th. We were very pleased. Room was small but comfortable with lovely sheets. Beautiful view from roof top restraunt. Staff was very friendly and courteous. would stay again. Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nena is a gem”
Reviews.Author: travelerjoyce
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Nena one day post-cruise based on recommendations here and at cruisecritic.com. We were NOT disappointed and wished we could have stayed longer. The room was nice, people were friendly and everything went smoothly. The airlines changed our flight to an earlier one and we were not able to take advantage of their included breakfast buffet but they had sandwiches ready instead. They include your ride to and/or from the airport or cruiseport and that was great. We intended to try their rooftop restaurant (they give you a discount) but it was filled by a group during Ramadan. Other outdoor restaurants in the area seemed a little pricey but had good food and service, everyone speaks English. The location is fantastic, just 1 block from the Sultanamet tram stop and two blocks from the Blue Mosque (Hint: bring a compass and any map will get you around easily. ) Although they do take credit cards,( you can exchange money nearby at a change, the best rate is at the grand bazaar,) you will do better if you pay in local currency before you leave the hotel. Not sure how this hotel rates for value but would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “No comparison”
Reviews.Author: Araucana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Nena for 5 nights and there was no comparison with the other hotels we stayed in during our 11 night stay in Istanbul (Holiday Inn 5 nights, Zeynep Sultan 1 night). Location, staff, breakfast and room/bathroom size and cleanliness were above the other two hotels. Only negative about it was they need to invest in some slow door closers/stoppers as when guests closed their doors, it slammed hard and noisily and the doors could also do with some bottom gap covers as hallway lights seep through 1-1.5 inch gaps causing noise from the wooden floors and lights in the night. Other than that fully recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Puchalski
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights from October 5-9, 2006, during Ramadan. We were in room #405. King size bed, modern bath and a small balcony (no view). Pros: Great location. A short walk to the tram, grand bazaar, blue mosque, etc. With the A/C turned on, you could not hear the tram nor the 5am prayer. Others we spoke to in other hotels were woken up every morning, not us. I think this is because our room didn't face the mosques that were close by. Friendly staff. Access to internet in the lobby. Good breakfast on the rooftop, with views of Topkapi, Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque. Clean room. Inexpensive mini bar. Good shower. Free transfers in both directions if you stay a minimum # of nights. You can use the roof deck at night. I grabbed a drink from the minibar every night and went to the room and took in the sights. If you pay in cash, you can pay in Lira, Euro or Dollars with a very good exchange rate. Cons: If you get up late, you will hear people going to the roof top for breakfast and they usually make a lot of noise. The bedspread didn't fit the bed completely. Needed to use the extra one provided so we didn't fight over it every night. The light switches in the room are fixed to the headboard of the bed. Two of the four nights I accidently turned on the lights. Overall the Cons were very minimal for all the good qualities this hotel has. I would definitely stay here again, probably in the same room. Rates were very reasonable. About $105 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and well-located hotel”
Reviews.Author: MurrayHillDenizen
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nena is very spruce and well-located. The rooms are small but are in tip-top shape, and quite clean (including the bathrooms). The booking process was very easy, with additional discounts available for advance bookings and payment in cash. There's also a free breakfast on a lovely terrace overlooking Sultanahmet. The hotel is ideally located in Sultanahmet-- on a quiet street off the main roads in Sultanahmet but only a five minute walk from major attractions such as the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, etc. Overall, the hotel is charming and affordable and I'd highly recommend a stay there. It is perfect for someone seeking a good and reliable base in Sultanahmet without spending a fortune.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Tommy_Boy1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our honeymoon in Paris, Athens, Santorini Greek Isles & Istanbul. Nena was the best value of all our stops. The staff provided 5 star service. Deluxe room #401 provided picturesque view of the Blue Mosque - awesome! Be advised, this is a boutique hotel in Turkey, don't expect a Four Seasons or Ritz type hotel like in Paris or NYC. Excellent location, convenient walking distance to the tourist stops. Restaurant breakfast is average compared to American standards but did not disappoint. Focus is on cold pastries/ fruits etc. Overall excellent value for the money! Tommy and Kristina

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: monkeyman
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the amazing reviews on tripadvisor. I am now learning to take such reviews with a pinch of salt. Being a critic, and with high standards and expectations, I thought this hotel was no more then ok. For a tourist hotel - it was at least what I would expect for what I paid, but was let down in a few areas. Here are my few points on the hotel: The hotel was in a good location in Sultanhamet (so were all the other hotels in the area!!!). Breakfast was ok to poor. I heard some people at breakfast time say it was exellent. I could not think of one thing exellent about it. I don't like places that serve orange squash for breakfast (I think it is tight). We stayed in a small room with NO external light. It was miserable. Luckily (and kindly - after a bit of discussion) they moved to the room 401 "suite" on the 3rd day. Suite? They must be joking - this was the room I would expect all rooms in this "highly recommended" hotel to be like. Avoid rooms with room numbers: xx5 Restaurant was totally overpriced, and only made somewhat reasonable when we used the 50% discount coupon. Maybe the other hotels at this price in Istanbul were so bad, that's why this hotel is highly recommended (relatively speaking) by trip advisor. Overall- it did the job. It provided us with a bed, a shower. No more. Would I recommend: If you like simple accomodation, then is suitable. If you have low standards, then you will think this is place is heaven. Would I return - no. (Note - i am fully aware that if I want 5 star service I would pay more for a 5 star hotel)

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: atk511
Reviews.Content: When we had to make a very last minute trip to Istanbul, we asked a travel agent in Istanbul to find us a hotel in Sultanhamet so we could see as much of the old city as possible in 2.5 days. We were booked at the Nena Hotel and it could not have been better. The rooftop restaurant is lovely, the food is better than average, and the staff was outstanding. They helped us find a bank, provided an adaptor when we didn't have the right one for our computer, and one of the evening staff members even helped me practice a speech in Turkish that I was to say at our son's engagement party! The hotel is right around the corner from many restaurants, a nice bookstore, and close to public transportation. The harrassment by carpet salesmen was a little hard to take everytime you stepped out of the door, but the location and the personnel were outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nena”
Reviews.Author: penfold5
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed in Hotel Nena for 4nights in August '06. The location is fantastic, the staff were very friendly and extremely helpful and the rooms were both attractive and spotless. We were upgraded to a suite with a view of the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofya. To top it off, breakfast was served on the roof terrace with morning views over the Bosphorus. I would not consider staying anywhere else in Istanbul! Thankyou to the staff of Hotel Nena who helped make our stay both comfortable and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Its All True”
Reviews.Author: Carny31
Reviews.Content: Everything positive you read is true........ calm, peaceful, classy, great value for money. Excellent friendly helpful staff, comfy beds, great rooms, great balcony, great location, lovely bathrooms, supreme breakfast, great views. Its located near to all Old Town Attractions..... and 5 mins walk from my favourite place in the world - The Grand Bazaar. Try and get a deluxe room though - even though the standard rooms are great - the views from the giant balconies of the deluxe rooms are breathtaking. Thanks to everyone at Nena from Erol and Christina

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!!!”
Reviews.Author: PetertÄ±mea
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nena is a gem of Istanbul located in the old historical area of Sultanahmet. My wife and I stayed there for 4 nights and 5 days, September 5-9, 2006. It has the best location close to major tourist and historical sites. We enjoyed the courtesy van waiting to bring us to the hotel from the airport. The room was clean, spacious, and well appointed. Our balcony had a view of the Agia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. The breakfast buffet was SUPERB and plentiful. We found that with a full breakfast we could sightsee until dinner and skip lunch. The staff was helpful and couteous. The hotel was an oasis of peace and calm in what can be a very busy city. We look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Ginger5
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the excellent and very helpful service we received at this little gem of a hotel. They were very anxious and willing to fulfill our every request and even some we didn't make such as accompanying me to the nearby ATM when I went to get cash. The hotel has a great location with wonderful views of the city. The rooftop terrace is a wonderful place for drinks or dinner and they are more than willing to accomodate you there although the normal restaurant is on the street level. Our rooms were good sized and nicely decorated with a marble bathroom and again a wonderful view from the balcony. The very reasonable price included a buffet breakfast. A really great added feature is the included transfers.

Reviews.Title: “A treat for our family”
Reviews.Author: GuinnessGuy
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nena was even better than we expected! Our family suite was large, clean, and comfortable. We loved sitting on our big balcony watching the sunset on the Blue Mosque. All the front desk and serving staff were very friendly and attentive. They especially made our two girls (13 and 8) feel comfortable and welcome. The complimentary internet service was a nice treat for our teenager. The breakfast buffet offered lots of choices for us vegetarians (including hard boiled eggs) and eating on the terrace with the gorgeous view was the perfect start to the day. I enjoyed that the location is not right in the heart of the busy Sultanahmet hotel district yet still within easy walking distance of the main sights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: miriams
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a stroll from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and the Grand Bazaar. The staff are very helpful, the rooms are fine with great views. We enjoyed a meal overlooking both mosques and the prices are very reasonable. A very pleasant experience just sorry we couldn't stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: hummaia9
Reviews.Content: Excellent, efficient service. Rooms were simple, very clean and comfortable. Hotel staff were exceptionally friendly, particularly with my young family. Breakfast was good and the view was stunning. The location was also excellent, central but in a quiet street. I will be recommending Hotel Nena to every one who is going to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Room 401- Perfect Getaway Suite”
Reviews.Author: quest_for_truth
Reviews.Content: I just returned to the states from three blissful days at the Hotel Nena in Istanbul. I was in Turkey for one month - and stayed at many hotels. This hotel was superior in every facet! It is not a "resort hotel", but my deluxe room (401) offered a view of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, and Bosphorous! It is clean, well appointed, and charming. It is also affordable. The rooftop breakfasts (include in the 89 USD per night price) were amazing. The staff were so helpful, particularly when I had difficulty with the internet (free). I felt so at home, and really was appreciative of the welcoming manner of everyone. My three night stay included airport transfers (which usually run 20 USD each way). I loved the balcony the most - 5 meters by 2 meters - HUGE! A paradise overall. I just fear that I will not be able to reserve this room for my return next year due to amazing reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and helpful staff at the Nena”
Reviews.Author: Galipolivisitor
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in the Nena from 2-4 July 2006 and then again on 8th July when we returned to Istanbul. My wife and I had one room and my two teenage children had a second room. The Nena put us on the same floor in two nice rooms overlooking the street. The Nena has a lovely lobby lounge area and a terrific roof top breakfast room. But the thing that sets it apart is the service of the staff. From the Front Office manager to the ladies who serve breakfast, nothing was too much trouble. All of the staff were polite and helpful. Their English was good and they understood what we needed, though we spoke not a work of Turkish. We had decided to hire a car and drive to the Gallipoli area ( we are from Australia). The front office manager was enormously helpful in getting us organised and booked on to the ferry that would take our hire car to Bandirma. He assisted to book the tickets, explained how it all worked, translated the Turkish information we would need and gave us instructions on how to find the ferry. (that we got lost in the back streets was our fault, not his!) But we made the ferry and had a great time around Gallipoli. On the way back I was unable to organise a return ferry booking myself, but a call to the office manager at the Nena (who speaks excellent English) and he generously offered to make the booking for us. I would recommend the Nena as a lovely comfortable hotel, in easy walking distance to all of the Sultanahmet sites. The rooms we stayed in were clean, airconditioned with free wireless internet access for those with laptops. The rooptop breakfast room and restaurant has a view to the Blue Mosque and the Sea of Marmara. The front office staff also helped me to park my hire car right out front ( in a town where parking is tight, to say the least) and when it was time for us to fly from Istanbul, they not only helped to organise our airport tranfer, but put together some breakfast bread rolls to take with us (as we had a pre breakfast start). I would wholeheartedly recommend the Nena to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: GINGOLDJ
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 from Seattle that spent two nights at the Nena (July 16 and 17). This was our first trip to Istanbul and the hotel could not be more perfectly located. We arrived after midnight and the hotel staff was available, friendly, and helpful at that late hour. On the day of our departure, we had to leave at 5:30 a.m. to get our flight home and Mr. Muzaffer, whose name I knew from other reviews on Trip Advisor, arranged for a driver to pick us up and take us to the airport, made arrangements to have sandwiches and coffee available for us prior to our departure as the rooftop restaurant would not yet be open, and confirmed our airline reservations. Mr. Muzaffer and the entire staff was fantastic. We had two double rooms on the third floor facing the street. One had a little balcony. Although there was no view of the Blue Mosque (a short distance away) from our rooms, they were clean and nice, well airconditioned and quiet, and the shower was great. The rooftop restaurant for breakfast affords a spectacular view of Istanbul and the food was terrific, as was the staff. I can't say enough good things about the Nena.

Reviews.Title: “We Now Have a Home in Turkey! Hotel Nena!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: "The Nena was a real find. We chose it by internet, but a local friend went to check it out in person and was so very complementary that we cancelled all other options and never looked back! Situated in the heart of Sultanahmet, the famous historic district of Istanbul, we could walk most everywhere the guidebook mentioned and felt instantly at home. When we arrived we were promptly greeted with welcome signs at the airport and immediately felt at ease in what could have been an overwhelmingly vast city. Once at the hotel, the staff was eager to be attentive. We found their friendship and efficiency really heartwarming and helpful during our multiple stays in the hotel, as we took off for more remote areas of Turkey a couple times and used Hotel Nena as our home base to leave things and get messages while we were off exploring. THey made an effort to remember us and our requests, and were always ready and waiting on our return. (The pick ups and send offs to the airport were so convenient and reliable!) The rooms at Hotel Nena are modest but nicely arranged, with beautiful sheets and comforters! Hair dryers in the bathroom were an unexpected plus! The hotel is situated on a little narrow street off the main drag so traffic and noises of the night are minimal ,which is quite a contrast to other small places we've stayed where sleep is limited because of night life and relaxation is never really an option. The desk people made helpful suggestions, used maps to orient us and taught us the important landmarks for finding our way back 'home" each time we ventured out. In addition to being able to walk to so many of the guidebook sites in Sultanahmet, we also found using the tram made visiting more distant sites a real joy and it was so close to the hotel! And, it was cool and easy to use. There is a terrace restaurant upstairs at Hotel Nena with views of historic Istanbul that rival any postcard!
