Each morning a colorful array of fruits, cheeses, meats, and eggs were laid out beautifully and generously. Breads, juices, teas and coffee as well are served without limit. This we found was most unusual and setting out with a healthy and complete breakfast made all the difference to our energy and stamina during the day. Dinner was served downstairs or up, at our will. The food was delicious, well prepared and beautifully served... and overlooking the mosques and palaces, what ask could you more??? The staff were so amenable to our requests and so warmly relating. Service to all the guests was just exceptional!!. Obviously Hotel Nena is taking great care in training and maintaining high standards of hospitality! Using the internet freely, when and as needed, was most appreciated and very helpful when we ran into a few complications at home and needed contact quickly. A thoughtful gesture to provide it for guests and make it so easy to use night or day. Congratulations on the English efforts of the staff as well!! We don't always expect it when we travel, but when resolving issues, planning a day and making decisions it was so helpful! The men and women were always so conscientious, respectful, and careful in most professional ways. Attention to small details can make or break a stay! It certainly enhanced ours at Hotel Nena. They made us feel like family. We also noticed that those working there seem very heppy to be at Hotel Nena. It comes through in their spirit and service. We were very sorry when our stay had to come to an end! But we now look forward to a return visit, and in the meantime have recommended it to several we know who will be going there soon. When its our turn again, we will certainly first call Hotel Nena and go from there. Good Luck for their continued success! Til we meet again!. Rich and Marilyn Watson, Richard and Elizabeth Naegle

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gnocchi79
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nena had everything we wanted. The staff are extremely helpful and professional, the rooms are pleasant and kept clean. The bathrooms are spotless with powerful, pleasant shower facilities. We never ate at the hotel restaurant because we wanted to tour Istanbul, but we had breakfast every morning on the hotel terrace, which looks out over Istanbul and the Bosphorous. It really is an incredible way to start the day, and looks extremely beautiful. The location of the hotel is absolutely perfect. It is in a little street so there is no traffic or tram noise, but this street joins straight on to the main road and is literally a 5 minute walk from the main tourist attractions in Istanbul. In our whole holiday, we never needed to consider getting a single taxi, tram or bus, and yet we saw everything we wanted to see. If you want a 5 star luxury hotel, this isn't for you, but if you want a great holiday, it is the right choice.

Reviews.Title: “great from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I chose Hotel Nena, in part, from reviews on tripadvisor.com. I couldn't be more pleased. Our room had a balcony, refrigerator, full tub, comfortable beds, and character. Airport shuttle both ways made that aspect of travel carefree. The people were fantastic, the service awesome. We ate our breakfasts (with variety and taste) overlooking the Blue Mosque - stunning. The location was great as well, with the Aya Sofia and Blue Mosque within easy walking distance and a tram stop about 3 blocks away for access to other sights. Be sure to visit the restaurant in front of the tram stop (left out of hotel, right at corner, about 2 blocks down). Our Kurdish friends will treat you well. Also, visit Emru across the street from the hotel. He'll have the typical hard sell on his carpets but in a very entertaining and congenial way. We spent hours with him drinking apple tea before and after we bought carpets. We were "very lucky customers", getting about 50% off the price at other stores, and having a great time in the process.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: quirkykiwi
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in this hotel, and our 4th time in Istanbul - this has been the best place we've stayed at so far, and fully intend to come back when next in Turkey (can't come soon enough!). On our first night, our room was very nice but small. We asked if other rooms were available but there were none that night. We were upgraded for the rest of our stay however at no extra charge. The upgrade room was fantastic - large and spacious, with the highlight being the enormous balcony overlooking the Blue Mosque. As nice as the rooms were, our stay was made most memorable by the reception staff. Nothing was too much trouble, from suggesting sights to see, to loaning us their Lonely Planet book. The service was quick, efficient, and very friendly. The breakfasts were lovely with a wide range of items to choose from - again, you could eat on a large balcony over looking the Mosque if you wished. Overall, we cannot recommend this hotel highly enough, and look forward to our next stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AlanRJ
Reviews.Content: We're a family of four, including two teenagers aged 14 and 17 and just back from spending a week in Istanbul and at the Hotel Nena. I chose this hotel after reading the reviews posted here and all the good things people have said about this hotel are true. We were too late getting one of the four deluxe rooms with balcony, so had two doubles instead. A bit of a squeeze, but fine considering we were out most fo the day. So if you want the bigger rooms, book early. The Nena is hard to beat on these counts: Location: If you're a tourist, you want to be in Sultanahmet. Several of the major sights are in this historic district and within a short walking distance of the Nena - the Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, Grand Bazaar ... or you just hop on the easy-to-use tramway two minutes from the hotel and get around. There's no shortage of good places to eat in the area too. Cleanliness: The hotel and the rooms are clean and kept spotless. It was great coming back to made-up rooms and fresh towels every day. Staff: On my last (business) trip to Istanbul in 2004, I stayed at the Hilton. I can't remember a soul from there. Several people at the Nena made an impression, and one I know will last, because of their friendliness and a great service attitude. From Muzaffer and Emre at the front office to the cheery young women at breakfast, people were simply fab. By the end of our stay, we felt we were leaving friends. The worst thing happened when we missed our flight home and had to make new arrangements late at night. I was most grateful then, that we were dealing with the good people at this hotel, who made things easier, and got us the extra nights' stay we needed. I love Istanbul as a place to visit. Great sights, great food, great people. The one downer? The city's taxi drivers. Four of the six we took were dishonest and unashamedly out to rip off tourists. The two who used their meters showed up the rest. Learn to use the public transport and save yourself some burst blood vessels. My son and I wanted to do a half day excursion and the choice was hiring a taxi or going with a driver recommended by the Nena. We went with the latter. Hassan proved to be a courteous, friendly chap who stayed cool through horrendous traffic and unexpected diversions that made our drive longer than anticipated. He also brought back the camera we left in the car. If you need a car and driver, ask Mr Muzaffer at the front office for Hassan.

Reviews.Title: “great disappointment”
Reviews.Author: AucklandKat
Reviews.Content: Having read all the reviews about Nena hotel we cancelled our original booking and decided to stay there for the entire week of our visit to Instanbul. But to our disappointment the room was extremely small, didn't know where to store the suitcases! The noise from the people next door and above us was only surpassed by the noise of the big air con unit stationed outside our room. The bed was not queen size but simply two singles pushed together. The front desk staff were ok, but not overwhelmingly friendly or attentive. No internet service, not even a newspaper in the lobby, no other services available. Rooftop terrace lovely place to begin the morning with a nice breakfast buffet attended by the two most cheerful staff in the whole hotel. There are 4 very good hotels in the close vicinity to this one(the location is pretty good) and we will go there for our next visit in October.

Reviews.Title: “THE Place to Stay in Istanbul,The people.+ The people + location= The best!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Mine was a Three day stay.... it left me wondering HOW DID I PICK THIS PLACE OUT FROM ALL THE OTHERS ??? Looking Back ..... Unless every place treats you this Special then Stay anywhere...... But for me it's my first visit to Turkey. ( Not my last >>> I will be back 24 August 06) This was the place to be. I was Picked up at airport @ 02:00 and returned to depart for Izmir days later @ 06:30. It was in the best possible location to walk to all the sites from the Blue Mosque to The Spice Market and my Boat Trip on The Bosphorus was all done on foot. Why Did I make my stay so short??? But now off ..... to the rest of Turkey and the wonderful people of Hotel Nena and Turkey !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good clean rooms, nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: AlexBk
Reviews.Content: Hotels are strange; you don't always get what you pay for, especially in European capitals. I've experience hugely variable quality at high-end hotels in Venice, Barcelona, Paris and London over the past year or so, and so decided on this mid-price hotel for a 3 night city break in Istanbul. The Nena was lovely, it looks great (outside and in) and it's in a perfect location near the Blue Mosque. Our room (402) was large enough, spotless, comfortable and had a nice bathroom (good shower). The balcony was big enough to have a table and two chairs, with a view of the mosque; though the floors below would have their view obscured by a 3-story building opposite. Breakfast was above average - a buffet on the top floor restaurant, with three of the tables on an outside balcony; beautiful view overlooking the Mosques and Bosporus. The staff were fantastic - friendly without being ingratiating, professionally dealing with every request that a bunch of fussy tourists could throw at them. They even throw in free transfers to/from the airport if you stay for three nights or longer. Highly recommended; location aside, it's on a par with the Metropole in Venice (EUR 320) for all-round quality.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: LMB25
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in the Nena. Our room (no.402) was very clean, well air-conditioned and had a stunning view of the Blue Mosque from the balcony. The breakfast selection was more than adequate and the staff were always pleasant and helpful. The location was fantastic for sightseeing in Sultanhamet and a good base for exploring the rest of Istanbul. We would recommend booking directly through the Nena's own website to avail of discounts and free airport transfers. We had a lovely time in Istanbul and would highly recommend the Nena to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A welcoming hotel, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were recently, May 17 -20th, at the Nena Hotel. The service was excellent and the accommodations were very comfortable. The location is central in the historical Istanbul, all the main sights are within a few blocks from the hotel. All in all a very comfortable way to spend some time in Istanbul. The price for such proximity to the sights of Istanbul is hard to beat and the service is the friendliest possible. The Hotel also makes free wi-fi available to the residents. We intend to go back to Istanbul and we would certainly stay at the Nena Hotel, without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Nena was my best Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nena was indeed my best experience. Because of my work, I travel too frequently including Europe and Eastern Asia and I do not ever hesitate to recommend you this hotel : Here are the reasons : 1- In Hotel Nena, you pay less than what you have to pay in other cities of Europe and the service you get is much much better. 2- In addition to being located in a perfect touristic venue, it is close to business centers as well. (Well, Istanbul is BIG. If your business is in the other corner of the city, I have nothing to say :) ) 3- Breakfast and terrace restaurant are perfect !!! Nothing could be a better start to a day. 4- Excellent staff ! Both friendly and professional. Their reservation system is cool. You can see all the details of your reservation by logging into your personal space with your password. You can make special requests there and book any extra services if you like. 5- What they offer : Airport wellcoming (I have booked from their own web page and got this offer.), hot water 24 hours, a working A/C, discount coupon for restaurant, VERY clean rooms and a cosy garden cafe. Well, I have more to list. But I think above 5 items are enough for you to get an insight about to hotel. Go there and experience ! Last thing I have to say other than the hotel is : ISTANBUL is just GREAT and full of excellence !!! If you have a chance, visit there. You will be impressed ! Although I was there for business, I will definetely go there again for traveling. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joey111
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect hotel for a touristic visit to Istanbul. Located between the Aya Sofia/Blue Mosque and the bazaar, on a quiet and very safe street, it boasts a roof terrace with stunning views where you have a delicious breakfast (hot as well as cold food). The rooms are tastefully decorated and kept spotless. Wooden floors in preference to carpets, and the television has all the major european channels, and there is free wireless internet too. But the best thing about Nena Hotel is the staff. From the manager Muzaffer to Turgay who helps you with your bags and the cleaners and shuttle drivers, everyone is very courteous, pleasant and helpful. (There is a hotel just around the corner where everyone is miserable and foul-tempered, so believe me when I say that having wonderful staff is the best thing one can hope for!) I would recommend Nena Hotel emphatically to anyone wanting a touristic visit to Istanbul or a romantic break, and I look forward to visiting there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul great for short city break”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were extremely friendly and obliging. Hotel in excellent location. Rooms and breakfast perfectly adequate for a short break. Found two great restaurants (Amedros and Rumeli Cafe) short distance from the Nena Hotel. There is a rug shop opposite the Nena Hotel, the boys always there to greet you with apple tea. We ended up buying two rugs deal hard. Topkapi Palace, Haghia Sophia and Blue Mosque highlight worth visiting. Would recommend using this hotel and a visit to istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful Place in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: bluemetro
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with great staff. Resonable price and very clean room and bathroom. Right in the old town with good tea houses and resturants nearby. The tram stop is a 1 min walk, which takes you to all the tourist spots. The breakfast is decent. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel Worth it Just for the Location!”
Reviews.Author: Radio_WRJPF
Reviews.Content: I would choose this hotel again just for the location, if nothing else! It's fabulously located in the Old City smack in the middle of all the tourist sites and a perfect place to stay if you only have a few days to see Istanbul's major tourist attractions. They have a computer system whereby you can state your preferences and they give you a private space before you arrive to confirm your booking and make special requests etc...I found this the most efficient reservations system I have ever used especially because they respond immediately.In general this gave me a very good, if somewhat overly optimistic, impression of the hotel way before we arrived. However they knew ,because they were told through this great computer system, I was disabled ,and yet they sent a van to pick us up at the airport whose driver was outside the arrivals hall, this was very good , but who made us walk a quite long distance to the garage instead( he saw I needed 2 sticks to walk ) of telling us to wait and bringing the van around to the front of the airport. This, despite my companion telling him I couldn't walk. He didn't offer to help with the trolley either but did, in all fairness load the suitcases onto the van ( hmmmm...did he have a choice?) So negatives were beginning. Arrival at the hotel late at night was OK and went as smoothly as to be expected. The room was exactly as pictured on the web site and they had provided the extra pillows we had requested ( for my legs). The lighting in the room was awful, though, and they did not provide the reading lamp I had requested(having read some comments on this web site)...the receptionist simply came up and took the shades off some wall sconces! Be careful, though, I suspect we had one of 2 best rooms in the house (room 401) as the others most probably are dark and facing walls etc... Our room, being on the top floor, had an adequate but not fabulous view of St Sophia and the Blue Mosque as allot of the roof tops are in the way. But we had a lovely balcony but as it rained constantly during our visit, we didn't use it. Would be excellent in the summer. The room is perfectly OK for a 3 star hotel, except for the lighting, as mentioned above. It had a very comfortable bed, nice sheets, (terrible cheap acrylic pillows though)and the small bathroom had excellent towels some amenities and a beautiful bathrobe ...but only one bathrobe for 2 people! The bed has switches to control the room lighting but they are located just behind your head so I turned them on and off all night! The most annoying thing about the room was that the curtains didn't draw all the way and there was no way of preventing being woken up by the light of day, especially as we were on the top floor. This is something I have never had to deal with in a hotel ever before and is a definite negative. Housekeeping was just OK as they forgot to empty full wastebaskets and sweep the floor on the 2nd day. The best and worst was the restaurant. Breakfast (included in the room rate)was , to put it mildly, terrific! The breakfast waitresses were the friendliest I have experienced for a long time( one even loaned us her stored value public transportation card) and the buffet was varied and good. Altogether a marvelous way to start the day. Dinner was another story. They gave us on arrival a 50% discount voucher in the restaurant.This encouraged us to try it. Mistake. Almost 2/3 of the comprehensive menu was not available...and what we had was not good. The maitre D' was more interested in selling carpets to us than taking care of the food and the waiter stood over us as we signed the bill and made sure we knew service was not included. A terrble and most forgettable dinner experience. Other than that I can't say I do NOT recommend this hotel. I do recommend it , if only because of the location ,and, in general, the staff ...not overly friendly (except for the breakfast staff) but certainly adequate. I had to constantly remind myself that this is not the Far east where smiles are usually the norm not the exception.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: lucky52
Reviews.Content: Great location, helpful and friendly staff, comfortable beds, nice bathroom. And the breakfast buffet is a pleasant way to start your day.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in the great city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Istanbul could not have been better. We really loved the city and the hotel. Its location is perfect. Historical attractions are steps away. Very helpful staff. They assist you in any subject you need help. Very clean and cosy rooms. I booked online from their page and they picked me up in the airport. If you are unsure about visiting Turkey in Ramadan, do not hesitate to go there ... also they have the best full buffet breakfast I ever tasted.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: STaylor123
Reviews.Content: We were happily surprised at Hotel Nena. We found the location could not have been better and the service excellent. The staff did everything they could to make our stay pleasant and always were cheerful and friendly. The rooms were fine, all we could ask for was better lighting and a few drawers! We had one of the more expensive rooms with a terrace and the wonderful view but our friends were also happy with their regular doubles. We don't have anything in Istanbul to compare to but we felt great about the Nena and wanted to say so.
